loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 38-year-old married woman. She has six children. 

Dorcas describes herself to be industrious. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, maize, rice and other items. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a good market and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, rice and other items. Her business goal is to have multiple shops within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved her livelihood. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, rice and other items.

loans.name: Grecilda

texts.en:
Grecilda is 34 years old and is married with three children, who are all currently in school. Grecilda works very hard to provide for them.

Grecilda's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 6,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. 

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Grecilda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married and has three children, and she runs a business in front of her house by offering motorcycle repair services. She makes a good income from her motorcycle repair services and she wants to buy more supplies with the loan and pay the mechanic who works for her. 

Julieta lives in a town near by the main road, so many people come to fix their motorcycle. She opened her business in 2002 with her own working capital.

loans.use: to buy tires, inner tubes, and the key to attach unloading motorcycles.

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en:
Jocel is 36 years old, married, and has seven children, all of whom are currently in school.

Jocel and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. She is taking a housing loan of PHP 9,300 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

With your help, Jocel can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

Jocel has been an NWTF borrower since 2012 and plans to recover through her general store.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and been in NWTF since 2013 and is now requesting a 7,400 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Josephine will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Dagoberto Antonio

texts.es: Dagoberto de 33 años de edad vive con su esposa, sus tres hijos y su suegra en casa propia, el es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. El se dedica a ser agricultor su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos asi como muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados.  Dagoberto  desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Dagoberto is 33 years old, and lives with his wife, their three children and his mother-in-law in their own home. He is a man who is very responsible when it comes to his family obligations, as he always has been known for providing the best for his family. 

He is a farmer, and his main crops are corn and beans.When his harvest is ready he stores it in sacks, as shown in the photo, so that he can then sell it in the various markets. 

Dagoberto wishes to increase his sales and that is why he visited the offices of Integral to apply for a loan that will allow him to buy manures, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides and other products. 

He wants to have the help requested, as he does not have other sources of income, and this way he will continue supporting his household without any limitation.

loans.use: To buy manures, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, and other products.

loans.name: 0112 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Dung is a 27-year-old married woman with 1 child.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

Dung has a retail business to sell shoes and has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Dung faces in her business is the lack of capital.  She requests a loan to invest in her business.

In 2010, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Dung has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Dung is the group leader of the 0112 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her child.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 2 Quảng Đại Group

texts.en:
Hương is a 31-year-old married woman with 3 children.

Huương works in agriculture and raises cattle.  Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.  She is applying for a loan to purchase cattle to raise and sell in future.

In 2013, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hương has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 Thôn 2 Quảng Đại solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

With her business profit, Huương hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and to make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 3 Quảng Giao Group

texts.en:
Thanh is a 48-year-old married woman without children.  

Thanh works in agriculture and raises poultry. Thanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.  She requests a loan to purchase poultry to raise and sell in future.

She is the leader of a 3-member group, the Nhóm 01 thôn 3 Quảng Giao  solidarity group. This is Thanh first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

In the future, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and to buy business supplies and equipment.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: 0403 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Nhạn has a service business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Nhạn is 55 years old, married, and has 1 child.
Nhạn is the group leader of the 0403 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.
This is Nhạn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Nhạn has been involved in this business for 3 years.
The main hardship that Nhạn faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nhạn hopes that her family will be healthy and happy, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man, and has four children. 

Stephen describes himself to be trustworthy. He operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a business friendly area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient capital. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy equipment for repairing vehicles. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy equipment for repairing vehicles.

loans.name: Benny

texts.en:
Benny earns a living from selling goods in her retail store while her husband does farming. For five years, Benny has earned well and improved the business. Her earnings go towards her home improvements. 

To add inventory capital, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of providing a better education to her children.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: 0404 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Bình is 51 years old and is married with one child. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Bình has a retail business selling dry food. She has been involved in this business for five years, and says that the main hardship that she faces in her business is a lack of capital. Bình is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

She is the group leader of the 0404 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of three members. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Bình hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase dry food to resell.

loans.name: Wamuyu

texts.en:
Wamuyu is a 62year-old woman with eight children. 

Wamuyu describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she keeps cows which produce milk for sale. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area ideal for the business and her primary customers are farmers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 25-year-old married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as being determined. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and has a variety of customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be perish ability of products. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more fruits and vegetables. 

Her business goal is to own a larger shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have an economically sustainable business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a married man. He has four children. 

Silas describes himself to be trustworthy. He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a business friendly area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of sufficient capital. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy timber for making furniture. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy timber for making furniture.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is married and has three children. 

He describes himself to be trustworthy. Fredrick operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy and business friendly area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of sufficient capital. 

Fredrick will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy equipment for repairing motor vehicles. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy equipment for repairing motor vehicles.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 41-year-old single woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be creative. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, cooking oil, drinks, rice and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a viable location and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of sufficient capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
This is Aurora, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is 45 years old, and is married with children. Together with her husband, Aurora manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Aurora sells different crackers and business. She gets her products in large quantities and then sells them for retail. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15, 000. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of crackers and biscuits needed in her business.

Aurora hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of crackers and biscuits needed in her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 58, resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Tomas and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Teresita operates the buy and sell business of her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and sells them with a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise for men (like polo shirts) and women to expand her product inventory.

Teresita hopes that her business will get bigger. She dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy RTW products for men (like polo shirts) and women

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and been with NWTF since 2012. She is now requesting a PHP 3,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

With your help, Ma. Theresa will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. 

On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan. She has restarted her business and been with NWTF since 2012. She is now requesting a PHP 5,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Marilyn will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 57 years old, married, and has two children. Juanita works very hard to provide for them.

Juanita's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Juanita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Juanita has taken a 7,400 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home and pay for construction labor.

Juanita is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 49 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Luzviminda's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Luzviminda is taking a PHP 7,400 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Luzviminda has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Noong Luong 6 Group

texts.en:
Tien is 30-year-old lady, who is the team leader. She lives with her husband and her small child in a small new house, after moving out of her parents-in-law's house. Starting a new independent life has brought them plenty of difficulties, but they are handling their life everyday very well by constantly developing their business. Their main source of income comes from agriculture production with varied activities, such as cultivating rice, vegetables, breeding chickens, and fishing. Furthermore, her husband works for a local construction employer to have additional income. 

This is Tien's fourth loan in Anh Chi Em Program and she will use this loan to buy piglets and food for pigs. She said that she was really grateful to Anh Chi Em Program for providing loans that supported her considerably in business and for training her with lots of knowledge about farming and breeding. She hasn't raised pigs before but she decided to try doing it this time because she was motivated when attending lessons about pigs held by Anh Chi Em team. 

Tien hopes that she will succeed in her pig raising project with the loan and additional useful training lessons from Anh Chi Em. She dreams her child will study in a well-known university and have a good job. In the picture, Tien stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets and food for pigs.

loans.name: Tusaidiane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bitaha est une commerçante et vice-présidente de la banque communautaire «Tusaidiane», senior entrepreneur, expérimentée, âgée de 62 ans, responsable et mère de 2 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe ses marchandises tout au long de la rue dans un quartier  animé. Elle commença ses affaires avec de fonds reçu d’une coopérative de la place. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a plus 15 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 sacs de patates douces, tomates, oignons et braises. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir  ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie  fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Bitaha is a retail merchant and the vice-president of the Tusaidiane community bank. She is a senior experienced entrepreneur, 62 years of age, and a mother responsible for two children, both in school.

She sells food products, and displays her goods at the roadside of a lively neighborhood. She started her business using funds received from a local cooperative. Later she was granted a loan from the Hekima MFI, and has been in business now for over 15 years.

This new loan will serve to buy two bags of yams, tomatoes, onions and charcoal. She would like to build a house, and educate, clothe and feed her children.

In the end, she greatly thanks Hekima for empowering non-bankable women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical time of war in the Eastern part of the country.

loans.use: buy two bags of yams, tomatoes, onions and charcoal

loans.name: Akonkwa Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Kazungu est une ambitieuse commerçante depuis 6 ans, présidente et membre d’un groupe d’Affaires «Akonkwa» âgée de 44 ans, divorcée et mère de 4 enfants, qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse du carburant. Elle installe sa marchandise aux croisées des avenues animées de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir pour acheter 33 litres d'essence. Elle avait reçu son premier fonds reçu d’IMF de la place. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son activité, construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en:
Kazungu has been an ambitious retail merchant for the past six years, and is the president and member of the Akonkwa business association. She is 44 years old, and the divorced mother of four children, all of whom are studying.

She sells fuel, and offers her products at the city's busy crossroads. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her business. This new loan will serve to buy 33 liters of gasoline. She had received her first funding from a local MFI.

In the future, she wants to expand her business, build a house, educate and feed her children. She thanks Hekima for its support to non-bankable women entrepreneurs, by offering them unsecured credit loans.

loans.use: buy 33 liters of gasoline

loans.name: Edith Ruth

texts.es: Edith de 40 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo en casa propia, ella posee un negocio donde vende variedad de productos como golosinas, granos básicos, carteras, detergentes, útiles escolares, etc. tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa y los precios accesibles, Edith está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder continuar con su negocio y generar mejores ganancias y así darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación algún.
texts.en:
Edith is 40 years old and lives with her husband and their son in their own home.  She owns a business where she sells a variety of products such as candy, grains, wallets, detergents, supplies, etc. She has a lot of customers due to the variety of products she sells and due to her affordable prices.

Edith is seeking a loan so that she can buy more products in bulk so that she can continue running her business.  She wants to generate a higher income and provide her family with whatever they need.

loans.use: to buy more products in bulk, such as candy, basic grains, wallets, detergents, supplies, etc.

loans.name: Ovidio Edgardo

texts.es: Ovidio de 48 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable y dedicado al bienestar de su hogar. El vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos en casa propia. Ovidio trabaja como seguridad en una empresa privada, él esta solicitando un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el deseo de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar, construyendo un cuarto que sirva de habitación para sus hijos, lo cual gracias a este préstamo podrá lograr ya que lo que el gana no dan a basto para poder construirlo, por esa razón solicita el crédito y así comprar arena, cemento, hierro, ladrillo y pago de mano de obra. Ovidio es un hombre que desea darle lo mejor a sus hijos por lo que espera construir su habitación y que ellos pueda vivir mejor y seguros.
texts.en:
Ovidio is 48 years old and he is a responsible man dedicated to the well-being of his household.  He lives with his wife and their two children in their own home.  Ovidio works as a security guard for a private company.

He is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL which he will use to improve the conditions of his home. He will build a bedroom for his children. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to make the improvements as he does not earn enough money to be able to build the room right now.  This is why he's seeking a loan.  He will buy sand, cement, iron, bricks, and pay for manual labor.

Ovidio is a man that wants to give the best to his children.  He dreams to build a bedroom for them so that they can live better and safer.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, iron, bricks, and to pay for manual labor

loans.name: 0205 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Loan is 33 years old and is married with 2 children.  She lives and works in the city of Thanh Hoa, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

Loan has a manufacturing business to make iron furniture. Loan has been involved in this business for 5 years.  The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.  She requests a loan to invest in her business.

In 2011, Loan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Loan is the group leader of the 0205 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

With her business profit, Loan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, her business to do well, and her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more iron to make furniture.

loans.name: Winefreda

texts.en:
Winifreda’s is in the business to sell perfumes, powder, soap, bags, shoes and underwear.  Her spouse is a farmer. 

She had two children and they currently work abroad.  She takes care of her grandchildren. 

Though she only earns a minimal income from her business, she still provides for her grandchildren. Her children pay her, but she doesn't want to rely on their support and is asking for additional capital. 

She requests 20,000 PHP to buy merchandise to sell. She will buy shoes, bags, umbrellas, and perfume. She hopes to improve her sales and earn a good income. She promises to repay her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy shoes, bags, umbrellas, and perfume.

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Thôn Đồng Thọ Xã Vạn Hòa Group

texts.en:
Hương is 31 years old and is married with 2 children.

Hương has a store to sell coffee, tea, soft drinks, and fast food.  Hương has been involved in this business for 3 years.  The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.  She requests a loan to purchase materials to maintain the refreshment bar. 

In 2011, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hương has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is the leader of a 3-member group, the Nhóm 03 thôn Đồng Thọ xã Vạn Hòa solidarity group. 

In the future, Hương hopes for her business to do well, her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, tea, soft drinks, and fast food.

loans.name: Dahlia

texts.en:
Due to financial hardship, Dahlia and her husband work together to meet the necessities of their family. They aim to improve their standard of living and educate their three children to give them a better life. 

Dahlia's husband cultivates their farm and she operates a motorcycle transportation business to earn additional income. She asks for 5,000.00 PHP to buy gasoline, spare parts and other accessories needed to maintain the motorcycle and continue her business. 

Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will be able to earn sufficient income.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts and other accessories needed to maintain the motorcycle.

loans.name: Aksanti Group

texts.fr: Madame Feza, âgée de 59ans est présidente du groupe de credit Aksanti. Elle est mariée  à  un homme sans emploie et ensemble ils ont 12 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est  dotée d’une grande expérience dans la vente des produits divers depuis 1980. C’est  ainsi qu’elle sollicite un credit pour lui permettre d’acheter 5 douzaines d’assiettes en porcelaine et  5 bassins en plastique. Son objectif est  d’agrandir son entreprise et scolariser ses enfants. C’est pourquoi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux activités des femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Mrs. Feza is 59 years old, and is the presient of the Aksanti credit association. She is married to an unemployed man, and together they have 12 children, all in school. Since 1980, she has had extensive experience in selling various products.

She is now requesting a loan so she can buy five dozen porcelain plates and five plastic basins. Her goal is to expand her business and educate her children.

This is why she thanks Hekima for supporting the activities of women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy five dozen porcelain plates and five plastic basins

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth operates her own farm to make a living. For many years, she has earned well to sustain her living. She had planned to improve the farm in order to ensure a better harvest next cropping season. 

Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer and seeds to have higher returns. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Hard work and patience are Thelma's guiding principles in running her retail store.

She is a 61-year-old widow with three children.  Thelma wishes to increase the stock of merchandise she offers and requests 18,000  PHP to purchase grocery items such as soft drinks, eggs,canned goods, cooking oil, and assorted biscuits.

She believes that this loan will enable her to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, eggs ,canned goods, cooking oil and assorted biscuits.

loans.name: Rizalyn

texts.en:
Rizalyn previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan to buy children's clothing for her business. Her earnings helped to pay for the education of her child, personal house hold expenses, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy children's clothing. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet the daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness.

Rizalyn dreams of having other sources of income and hopes that her youngest child will finish his studies. 

She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business. She can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing.

loans.name: 0102 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Hương is 37 years old and is married with 2 children.  She lives and works in the city of Thanh Hoa, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

Hương has a retail business to sell stationery items. Hương has been involved in this business for 5 years.  The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.  She requests a loan to invest in her business.

In 2013, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hương has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hương is the group leader of the 0102 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, her business to do well, and her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more stationery.

loans.name: Las Señoras De Lucumo Group

texts.es: Milagros es socia del grupo “Las Señoras De Lúcumo” conformada por 08 mujeres  trabajadoras que pasan a su 9vno ciclo. Milagros de  28 años es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Hace más de 01 mes que se dedica a la venta de productos de frituras como el frito lay. Se siente feliz pues gracias a su esfuerzo puede seguir apoyando a sus menores hijos. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de chisitos, papitas lays, y chifles. Seguir implementando su negocio es el mayor deseo de Milagros. El grupo “Las Señoras De Lúcumo” están agradecidos con el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso. Milagros es la tercera del lado derecho y viste polo celeste.
texts.en:
Milagros is a member of the group “Las Señoras De Lúcumo” which is comprised of 8 hard-working women that are in their 9th cycle.  Milagros is 28 years old, she is separated from her husband, and she has two dependent children.

One month ago she began selling snacks, such as Fritos.  She is happy because, thanks to her hard work, she can continue supporting her two small children.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy Chisitos, Lays, and Chifles (brands of snacks). This way she can continue running her business, which is her biggest dream.

The group “Las Señoras De Lúcumo” is thankful for the loan as it makes their progress possible. Milagros is the third from the right and is wearing a blue top.

loans.use: to buy Chizitos, Lays, and Chifles (brands of potato chips and snacks).

loans.name: 0111 Phú Sơn 3 Group

texts.en:
Liên has tailoring business. Liên has been involved in this business for 8 years.  The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital.  She requests a loan to invest in her business.

Liên is 39 years old and is married with 3 children.

Liên is the group leader of the 0111 Phú Sơn 3 solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 
She lives and works in the city of Thanh Hoa, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 3 dependents.  This is Liên first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, her business to do well, and her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more material.

loans.name: 0405 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Xuân is 55 years old and is married with no children.  She lives and works in the city of Thanh Hoa, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

Xuân operates a food stall restaurant to sell fast food. She has been involved in this business for 5 years.  The main hardship that Xuân faces in her business is the lack of capital.  She requests a loan to invest in her business.

Xuân is the group leader of the 0405 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. This is Xuân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Xuân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, her business to do well, and to vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her fast food store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 28-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as committed. She operates a retail business where she sells chickens and eggs. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy chicken feed and add to her stock of chickens. Her business goal is to be a better poultry keeper within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and add to her stock of chickens

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is a 34-year-old resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Sandy who is a butcher.  They have children. She and her husband manage their household and operate the business. They both work hard to meet  the family's daily needs.

Emelyn maintains a direct selling business to  sell clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue business operations, she requests 30,000 PHP to buy shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. 

Emelyn dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business. She can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: 0401 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Nhung operates a food stall/restaurant to sell fast food. Nhung has been involved in this business for 5 years.  The main hardship that Nhung faces in her business is the lack of capital.  She requests a loan to invest in her business.

Nhung is 55 years old and is married with 2 children.  She lives and works in the city of Thanh Hoa, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

Nhung is the group leader of the 0401 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. This is Nhung first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Nhung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, her children to find a good job, and her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase items for her fast food stall.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad manages a retail store and a hog raising business.  She has run her retail store for ten years.  Her spouse works as an air conditioning technician.

Soledad is thankful that her spouse supports her in running their businesses.

She would like 18,000 PHP to purchase grocery items and hog feed for her hog raising business.

She and her spouse  work hard to improve their living conditions and expand both the hog raising and retail store businesses.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for her store and feed to her hog raising business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 27 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Marites and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.

Marites is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 7,400 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Marites has been an NWTF borrower since 2013 and plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Marites can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: 15 Thôn Hậu Áng Công Liêm Group

texts.en:
Liên's work is selling rice. She is applying for a loan to purchase rice to resell. 

Liên is 47 years old and she is married and has three children. Liên is the group leader of the 15 thôn Hậu Áng Công Liêm solidarity group, which consists of seven members. 

In 2007, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid three loans from FPW.

Liên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more of the ingredients needed in her business. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her son. Her income is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her children are working to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other products needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her son. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Zenaida hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her son will finish college. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a 28 year old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

Milka operates a retail business where she sells chicken and eggs. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be finances. She will use the 10,000 Kenyan shilling (KES) loan to buy chicken feed and add to her stock of chickens. She hopes that in the future, she will be the best poultry keeper around. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and add to her stock of chickens

loans.name: Altynai

texts.ru: Алтынай 50 лет, замужем, есть 2 сына. С 2010 года Алтынай начала заниматься торговлей одежды и одежных принадлежностей, стартовав с 20,000 сом (KGS), Алтынай сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме около 25,000 сом (KGS). Алтынай имеет только положительные отзывы и репутацию, как в торговле, так и в личных отношениях. У Алтынай высшее образование,она очень доброжелательная и целеустремленная. За период ведения своей деятельности, она отремонтировала свой дом и выдала замуж дочь. В целях расширения ассортимента товаров на весенне-летний сезон, Алтынай обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), на полученные денежные средства Алтынай намерена купить одежду в ассортименте и реализовать ее в арендованном магазине на рынке города. Алтынай планирует вложить доходы от бизнеса в дальнейшее увеличение ассортимента товара, и дать достойное образование своим детям.
texts.en: Altynai is 50, married and has two sons.  In 2010, she started her own business selling clothing and clothing accessories with 20,000 som worth of capital.  She's managed to grow her business to the point where she makes nearly 25,000 som a month.  Since starting her business, she's renovated her home and seen her daughter married.  In order to offer a greater variety of wares this summer, Altynai is seeking a loan of 100,000 som from Bai-Tushum & Partners; she'll use the loan to buy a variety of clothing to be sold at her rented shop space in the town marketplace.  She plans on using any profits due to the loan to further increase the variety of wares she sells, as well as provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: stock her store with clothing

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy the ingredients she needed in her bakery. Her loan also helped in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday needs. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their family's everyday needs.

Jocelyn would like to apply for another 20,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, eggs, baking powder, shortening, and other ingredients needed in making bread. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn dreams that her business will last longer and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients like flour, sugar, eggs, baking powder, shortening, and other ingredients needed in making bread.

loans.name: Heather May

texts.en:
Heather May grows and harvests vegetables, work that she has done since she was married. She gets up early and has to go to the fields where she oversees her crops.

Heather May is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer, since she needs farm improvement. In the future, she wants to have a better house than she has now and to be able to give her children the education she did not have. She is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a 42 year old married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells bananas. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. 

Teresa describes her biggest business challenge to be finances. She will use the 15,000 Kenyan shilling (KES) loan to buy more stock of bananas. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bananas to resell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 56-year-old married man. He has five children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a vibrant location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. He hopes that in the future, he will buy two cows to start dairy farming. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es: Norma Isabel 30 años de edad casada con tres hijos menores de edad originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, zona donde predomina el comercio y donde existe uno de los ingenios mas grande del país, ubicado en el occidente del país, Norma se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendora, trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, es una microempresaria que se dedica a la elaboración de pastes de baño y destace de cerdos y sus derivados, como: nacatamales, frito, pepena, moronga, entre otros, sus comparas las realiza al contado en mercados de otro municipio para la elaboración de pastes y para los cerdos en comarcas aledañas, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, inicia su negocio con fondos propios para ayudar con los gastos del hogar el cual lo aprende por su mama quien administra otro igual que ella, uno de sus sueños es poder incrementar su capital de trabajo y mejorar su casa de habitación. el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de retazos de tela, hilos, agujas, esponjas, un lote de cerdos en pie.
texts.en: Norma Isabel is 30 and is married with three dependent children. She comes from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, which is an area where commerce predominates and where one of the  biggest mills in the west of the country is found.  Norma is a very enterprising woman who is hard-working and responsible, and who really wants to improve herself. She works making hand-trimmed loofah-style body scrubs, as well as butchering pigs to make pork derivatives such as nactamales [a meat and rice Nicaraguan delicacy], deep-fried snacks, cooked pork fat and black pudding. She buys supplies in cash from markets in another town in order to create the body scrubs, and buys pigs from neighbouring villages. She sells for cash and on credit and she has regular and occasional clients. She set up her business with her own money to help out with the household bills. She learnt the work from her mother, who runs a business similar to her own. One of her dreams is to be able to increase her working capital to make home improvements. She wants to invest the loan into working capital to buy fabric remnants, thread, needles, sponges and also a herd of live pigs,

loans.use: to invest in working capital to buy materials for making hand-trimmed loofah style body scrubs and also to buy a herd of pigs.

loans.name: 09 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
An is 52 years old, and is married with two children. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

An operates a food stall / restaurant selling tofu. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that An faces in her business is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

In 2013, An joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is now the group leader of the 09 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

With her business profit, An hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more beans to make tofu to resell.

loans.name: 05 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Thành has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Thành is 34 years old and is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Thành has been involved in her business for two years. The main hardship that Thành faces in her business is a lack of capital.

In 2013, Thành joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is now the group leader of the 05 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In the future, Thành hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is married and has one child. 

Kennedy describes himself to be honest. He operates a welding business where he makes metallic chairs, gates and other items and also does repairs. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stock of welding materials. His business goal is to own a big garage within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy stock of welding materials.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen has been helping her husband by managing her own piggery to make a living. For more than five years, the couple has earned well for the family and has sustained their living. 

Helen gained access to micro finance services after joining GDMPC. To improve the business, she took a new loan to buy feed for her pigs. 

In the future, Helen wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman and has seven children. 

Mary describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to own a big shop within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.use: buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: 01 Thôn 7- Hoằng Hải Group

texts.en:
Hợp is 32 years old and she is married with two children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Hợp works in agriculture, farming pigs. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

This is Hợp's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 01 Thôn 7- Hoằng Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

With her business profit, Hợp hopes to remodel her house, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Chinh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Chinh, 35 years old, is a person of  Thai ethnicity, which is major in the mountainous district of Mai Son, Son La province. She has been participated in the group activities since January 2001. She is living with her husband and her two sons. Her eldest son is at grade 10 and the youngest son is at Grade 7.

Income from livestock and poultry are the main income source of her family. However, this income is not large is always affected by many factors such as: weather, diseases, and output consumption.  So she worries about her family’s economy, and especially for her two sons' education make her family more difficult.  Therefore, Chinh wants to borrow a loan to cover her children’s education costs to reduce anxiety on her children’s education, to be dedicated to work to earn money for improvement of her family’s living conditions.

She is the leader of group with 3 members. The other members also hope a part of these loans will help their children have more good conditions for better education.

loans.use: to cover her children’s education costs

loans.name: Flor Alba

texts.es:
Flor es una mujer felizmente casada y tiene un hijo de 12 años.
Desde hace tres años inicio con un negocio en el que vende licores, frituras, bebidas y ofrece servicio de billar.
Trabaja junto a su esposo quien también es independiente y ofrece empleo a una señora por días, principalmente los fines de semana.
Ella desea surtir su negocio con más productos como licores y frituras, además de comprar algunos implementos para el billar para reemplazar unos que están en mal estado
Aprovechando la gran acogida que tiene su negocio y el buen servicio que ofrece desea aumentar sus ventas.
El problema es que no tiene el capital suficiente para realizar estas acciones, por eso acude a un préstamo para cumplir su objetivo.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener casa propia y ver a su hijo crecer como una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Flor is a happily married woman and has a 12 year old son.

She started her own business three years ago, selling liqueurs, fried food, drinks and offering a billiard service. She works with her husband who is also independent and they employ a lady on a daily basis, mainly on the weekends.

She wants to stock her business with more products such as liqueurs and fried food, as well as buy some implements for her billiards table to replace the ones that are in bad condition.

Taking advantage of the great reception that her business has and the good services they offer, she wants to increase their sales. The problem is she doesn't have sufficient capital to do this, so they are turning to a loan to reach their objective.

Her greatest dream is to be able to have her own house and to see her son grow into a good person.

loans.use: to buy liqueur and fried food to stock her business and replace implements for her billiards table.

loans.name: Tujenge Group

texts.fr: La cliente Munganga  est une commerçante depuis 2 ans et membre d’une association d’affaires «Tujenge»,  entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 32 ans et mère de 3 enfants, tous  étudient. Elle est vendeuse des articles divers et sociétaire d’une boutique. Elle  sollicite un crédit  auprès de Hekima  pour accroitre son entreprise.  Elle commença  avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un médecin. Elle va acheter  cartons de bombons, des biscuits, sucre, riz, huiles, savons en poudre, produits cosmétiques, 1 carton de cahiers, 5 boites de stylos, les allumettes, sel iodé, etc. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants et assurer leurs soins médicaux. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes  entrepreneurs exclues  du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: The customer, Munganga, has been a trader for the past two years and is a member of the Tujenge business association. She is a dynamic entrepreneur who is 32 years old and mother to three children, all of whom are studying. She sells a variety of products and is a member/shareholder of a shop. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She began with capital from her husband, who is a doctor. She is going to buy cartons of candy, biscuits, sugar, rice, oil, powdered soap, cosmetics, one carton of notebooks, five boxes of pens, matches, iodized salt, etc. In the future she would like to be able to educate and feed her children as well as to provide for their healthcare. She is therefore very grateful to Hekima for its support of female entrepreneurs who are excluded from the classic bank system.

loans.use: to buy cartons of candy, biscuits, sugar, rice, oil, powdered soap, cosmetics, a carton of notebooks, five boxes of pens, matches, iodized salt, etc.

loans.name: Gioconda Maria

texts.es:
Con una sonrisa pícara y afectuosa,  Gioconda atiende a sus clientes diariamente en su pequeño puesto de venta. En él, ofrece diversidad de artículos escolares, dulces, también comidas y bebidas.  Su sueño es que su negocio continúe creciendo para aumentar su capital y utilidades, de esa forma logrará satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Este préstamo planea invertirlo en la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos tales como: Cuadernos, Lapiceros, Reglas, Borradores entre otros. Su propósito es conseguir más clientela y ofrecerles  artículos  de excelente calidad.   Ella planea seguir trabajando de la mano de esta institución.
texts.en:
With a mischievous and affectionate smile, Gioconda serves her customers daily at her small sales place. In it, she offers a diverse range of school supplies, sweets, food and drinks. Her dream is to continue to grow her business to increase its capital and earnings, and thus satisfy the needs of her customers.

She plans to use the loan to buy a greater quantity of products such as notebooks, pencils, rulers, erasers, etc.

Her aim is to get more customers and offer the articles of excellent quality. She plans to continue working closely with this institution.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of products such as notebooks, pencils, rulers, erasers, etc.

loans.name: Asifiwe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Sauda est une commerçante présidente et membre d’une banque villageoise «Asifiwe», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 42ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est vendeuse d’huile de palme. Elle installe sa marchandise dans un marché de la place. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de Hekima. Jusqu'aujourd'hui, elle continue avec le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Son conjoint est un chauffeur. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 500 litres d’huile. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une belle maison, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie  fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique, surtout ; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: The customer, Sauda, is a trader and she is also president and a member of the Asifiwe Banc Villageois. She is a dynamic entrepreneur, who is 42 years old, married and mother to five children, who are all studying. She sells palm oil and lays out her goods in a local market. She began her business with a first loan from Hekima and she continues to run her business thanks to the IMF Hekima loan. She has been carrying out her business for the past ten years. Her husband is a driver. This new loan will be used to buy 500 liters of oil. She would like to be able to build a beautiful house, educate, clothe and  feed her children. Finally, she is extremely grateful to Hekima for enabling small businessmen and women who are excluded from the classic bank system to become autonomous, particularly during this difficult post-conflict period in the eastern region of the country.

loans.use: to buy 500 liters of oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay for workers to help with her coffee crops.

loans.name: Twendembele Group

texts.fr: La cliente Buhoro est une commerçante depuis 8 ans, présidente et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Twendembele», entrepreneur, âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants qui tous, étudient. Elle est vendeuse souliers usagés, elle étale son business dans le marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 50 paires de souliers. Son conjoint est un chauffeur. Elle débuta avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite  scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en  leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflit dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en: The customer, Buhoro, has been a trader for the past eight years and is the president and a member of the Twendembele business association. She is 35 years old, married and mother to six children, all of whom are studying. She sells used shoes and lays out her goods in the town's central market. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She is going to buy 50 pairs of shoes. Her husband is a driver and provided her with the capital to start her business. In the future she would like to be able to educate and feed her children. She is grateful to Hekima for having well chosen its objective to support female entrepreneurs who are exlcuded from the classic bank system, by granting them loans without any material guarantee, particularly during the post-conflict period in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 50 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Zabayo Group

texts.fr: La cliente Safi est une brave commerçante, présidente et membre du groupe d’affaires «Zabayo», senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 50 ans et mère de 9 enfants, dont 5 étudient et 4 autres sont déjà mariés. La cliente est une vendeuse  d’haricots. Elle installe sa marchandise à son domicile dans le quartier périphérique de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un enseignant. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 30 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 sacs d’haricots. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir  ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues de système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile  post conflits à l’Est du pays.Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leur bébés.
texts.en: The customer, Safi, is a courageous trader, who is also president and a member of the Zabayo business group. She is an experienced and dynamic entrepreneur who is 50 years old and mother to nine children, five of whom are studying and four others who are already married. The customer sells beans and lays out her goods at home in the outlying district of the town. She began her business with capital from her husband, who is a teacher. Later on she got a loan from IMF Hekima. She has been carrying out this business for the past 30 years and this new loan will be used to buy two sacks of beans. She would thereby like to increase her capital, educate and feed her children. Finally, she is extremely grateful to Hekima for enabling female entrepreneurs who are excluded from the classic bank system to become autonomous, partiuclarly during this difficult post-conflict period in the east of the country. It should be noted that some of the customers in the photo are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of beans.

loans.name: Noelia De Jesús

texts.es:
Noelia, a sus 57 años es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora con el sueño de poder salir delante de forma independiente.
Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas fritas como empanadas, pasteles de pollo y panzerotti, todos los días desde las horas de la mañana hasta la tarde.
Sus hijos han sido un gran apoyo para su progreso pues le han ayudado de forma económica y con trabajo.
Ella en estos momentos tiene su fritadora mala y esto le ha causado problemas ya que no ha podido trabajar de manera eficiente, por eso guarda la esperanza de poder tener dinero para arreglarla y así poder seguir ejerciendo su actividad.
Con su fritadora en buen estado podrá generar más ingresos para su hogar y podrá empezar a cumplir su sueño de tener otros puestos de trabajo y ofrecer empleos.
texts.en:
Noelia, 57, is a very enterprising and hardworking woman who dreams of succeeding independently. She makes a living selling fried food such as empanadas, chicken pastries, and panzerotti (filled pastries). She works every day from the morning until the afternoon. Her children have been a great support for her progress, helping her financially as well as with their work.

Her frying machine is in bad shape, which has caused problems because she has not been able to work efficiently. Therefore, she hopes to have money to fix it and continue working in her business.

With her frying machine in good condition, she will be able to generate a higher income for her household and begin to accomplish her goal of offering other employment opportunities.

loans.use: to repair her frying machine to prepare and sell food.

loans.name: Tumsifu Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Ngirishuti est une commerçant et membre du groupe d’affaires «Tumsifu», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 45 ans, veuve et mère de 6 enfants, qui 3 étudient et 3 autres qui n’étudient plus. La cliente est   vendeuse de la boisson. Elle étale sa marchandise dans une buvette du quartier commercial de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu du patron de son feu mari. Plus tard, il bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 11 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 caisses de Fanta sucré, 2 caisses  de bière Primus, 2 caisses de Miitzing, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser  et  nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: The customer, Ngirishuti, is a trader and a member of the Tumsifu business group. She is a dynamic entrepreneur, who is 45 years old, a widow and mother to six children, three of whom are studying and three of whom have finished their studies. The customer sells drinks and lays out her goods in a little bar in the commercial district of the town. She began her business with capital from her late husband. Later on, she got a loan from IMF Hekima. She has been carrying out this business for the past 11 years. This new loan will be used to buy two cases of sweet Fanta, two cases of Primus beer, two casses of Miitzing, etc. She would thereby like to be able to educate and feed her children. Finally she is extremely grateful to Hekima for enabling small businessmen and women who are excluded from the classic bank system to become more autonomous, particularly during this difficult post-conflict period in the eastern region of the country.

loans.use: to buy two cases of sweet Fanta, two cases of Primus beer, two cases of Miitzing, etc.

loans.name: Mayerling Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mayerling es una pequeña productora que vive al norte de Nicaragua, junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos con edades entre 8 y 17 años, los cuales estudian en la escuela de su comunidad. Su pequeña finca es de 7 hectáreas  de las cuales 3.2 son de café, rubro que es manejado bajo criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices, lo cual muestra el esfuerzo que esta emprendedora realiza por manejar de manera sostenible su pequeña finca.
Su familia es lo más importante para Mayerling, por lo que junto a su esposo lucha cada día para sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles mejores oportunidades para su bienestar. En el último año, su plantación de café fue afectada por la Roya, por lo cual ella está solicitando un préstamo que le permita renovar 0.7 hectárea de café, a fin de incrementar nuevamente la productividad de su finca y con ello mejorar los ingresos para su familia.
Ella considera que la disponibilidad de recursos, sumado al conocimiento que tiene de este rubro, así como el deseo de superación para su familia, son clave para lograr el éxito de esta actividad.
texts.en:
Mayerling is a small farmer who lives in the north of Nicaragua with her husband and three children, aged between 8 and 17, who are studying at the local school. Her small farm has an area of 7 hectares, of which 3.2 are coffee crops. Her farm is managed according to the certification criteria of Fair Trade, UTZ and C.A.F.E. Practices, which demonstrates the effort which this entrepreneur puts in to manage her small farm sustainably.

Mayerling's family is the most important thing to her, so she and her husband fight every day to provide for their children and give them better opportunities for their well-being. Last year, her coffee crops were affected by coffee rust, so she is applying for a loan to revitalize 0.7 hectares of coffee crops. Her goal is to increase her farm's productivity and thereby her income for her family.

She believes that the availability of resources, along with her knowledge of this field and her desire to overcome for her family, are key to her success in this business activity.

loans.use: to revitalize 0.7 hectares of coffee crops.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be business-oriented. He operates a carpentry shop where he makes tables, chairs and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy place and his primary customers are the general public. 

Peterson describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy timber and other carpentry materials. His business goal is to expand within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and save the rest.

loans.use: to buy timber and other carpentry materials

loans.name: 02 Đa Phạn Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xinh works in agriculture, farming poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Xinh is 46 years old and she is married with four children. Xinh is the group leader of the 02 Đa Phạn Hải Lộc solidarity group, which consists of eight members. 

In 2011, Xinh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Xinh has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Xinh has been involved in this business for seven years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Xinh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Herchel

texts.en: Herchel lives in Misamis Occidental with her family. To earn a living, she runs a general store selling goods in her local community. She has had this business for two years. Her husband works as a farmer and it is their main source of income. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods. In the future, she wants to have a better house than she has now and to be able to afford her children's education. She plans to expand her store in order to gain more income for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods.

loans.name: Nhóm 09 Thôn 3 Quảng Giao Group

texts.en:
Ly works in agriculture farming poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future. 

Ly is fifty-eight years old and married with one child. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 09 thôn 3 quảng giao solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2013, Ly joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Ly has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in her business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

She hopes her business will do well and that she can use the profits to keep her family healthy and happy and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace works hard to support her family. On November 8 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and been in NWTF since 2012. She is now requesting a PHP 3,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Mary Grace will be able to rebuild her devastated life more quickly.

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mylyn

texts.en:
Mylyn is 30 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Mylyn works very hard to provide for them.

Mylyn's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Mylyn has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Mylyn has taken a PHP 4,900 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Mylyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ý

texts.en:
Ý operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She is twenty-eight years old and married with two children, who are dependent on her. They live in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Ý's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in her food stall business for four years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine. This means that her family needs to share their neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet .

Ý hopes that her business will do well, and she hopes to use the profits to provide for her kids and keep her family healthy and happy.
