loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn operates a mobile store to make a living. Aside from this, she also helps her husband in their farm planting and harvesting crops. In the five years that she has managed her mobile store, she has sustained and supported her children's education. She sells using a vehicle so that she can drive to the places where she will earn more income. In order to offer more to her customers, she has taken a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve her business to ensure a better source of income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of bulbs, cables, and other hardware

loans.name: 04 Tây Hải-Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kỳ works in agriculture farming  cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cattle to raise and sell in future.

Kỳ is 59 years old and she is married with two children. Kỳ is the group leader of the 04 Tây Hải-Hoằng Thanh solidarity group, which consists of five members. Kỳ lives  in Hoang Hoa district, in a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2003, Kỳ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Kỳ has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Kỳ has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Kỳ hopes to travel for a vacation within the country, to build a new house, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Furahini Group

texts.fr: La cliente Faida, âgée de 40 ans est mariée à un soudeur et ensemble ils ont  6 enfants  dont seulement 4 sont scolarisés. Vice présidente du groupe de credit Furahini, elle étale sa marchandise à domicile. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter 10 tiges de savon, 2 cartons de stylo, 2 cartons de biscuits et 2 cartons de bonbon. Elle rêve ouvrir une grande boutique. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de tout cœur pour le travail de développement économique des femmes pauvres actives.
texts.en:
Hekima client, Faida, 40 years old, is married to a metal worker and together they have six children, of whom only four are enrolled in school. She is the vice president of the loan group called Furahini, and she displays and sells her merchandise at her home. She is requesting this loan to buy 10 long bars of soap, two cartons of ballpoint pens, two cartons of biscuits, and two cartons of bonbons. 

Faida dreams of opening a big store, and she thanks Hekima wholeheartedly for its economic development work with impoverished women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 10 long bars of soap, two cartons of ballpoint pens, two cartons of biscuits, and two cartons of bonbons.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 28 years old and has two children. Marilyn is married and has one child who is in school.

Marilyn and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Marilyn is taking out a housing loan amounting PHP 9,950 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been an NWTF borrower since 2009.

With your help, Marilyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
La motivación de su la familia impulso a Rosa a iniciar su negocio de venta de frescos y frijoles cocidos; la práctica y dedicación le han permitido continuar. Día a día, prepara los frescos más deliciosos del barrio. En un clima caluroso, un sorbo de sus riquísimos refrescos cae bien al gusto. Ella tiene 56 años de edad y tres hijos mayores, quienes le brindan apoyo a través de una pequeña ayuda económica. También, está a cargo de su mamá, mujer que le ha enseñado a desenvolverse, a ser luchadora y emprendedora.
Ella solicita el crédito para incrementar el capital de su producción, requiere comprar frutas y azúcar al por mayor, de manera que le permita aumentar la preparación de refrescos para obtener más clientelas y alcanzar más ganancias; al mismo tiempo necesita comprar frijoles, para venderlos cocidos. Es una mujer que está dispuesta a seguir trabajando, puesto que vela por la salud de su madre y un futuro próspero. Una de sus metas, es remodelar su cocina, el techo no presta las condiciones necesarias.
texts.en:
Motivation from her family encouraged Rosa to start her own business selling refreshments and cooked beans. Practice and dedication have allowed her to continue. Day by day, she prepares the most delicious soft drinks in the neighborhood. In such a hot climate, a sip of her delicious drinks hits the spot. She is 56 years old and has three older children, who support her with a small financial contribution. She is also responsible for taking care of her mother, who taught her to develop herself, to fight, and to be enterprising.

She has applied for a loan to increase her working capital. She needs to buy wholesale fruit and sugar in order to increase her production of drinks to obtain more clients and higher earnings. She also needs to buy beans so that she can cook and sell them. She is ready to continue working, since she is responsible for her mother's health and a prosperous future. One of her goals is to remodel her kitchen because the ceiling is not in good condition.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruit and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 30-year-old widow. She has five children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

Caroline will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of firewood. Her business goal is to own a motorcycle within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business, has been in NWTF since 2009, and is now requesting a PHP 6,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Perlita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Later on, Perlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 28-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows maize and she has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals. 

Jackline describes her biggest business challenge to be unfavorable weather conditions. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to excel within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis, es un pequeño productor de café del norte de Nicaragua. Trabaja bajo la certificación de FLO con la que ha logrado mejorar los ingresos para mantener a su esposa y dos hijos.  En su pequeña finca brinda 15 empleos temporales, con lo que, ayuda a la economía de su comunidad.
Desde joven soñó con ser cafetalero, es la herencia que sus padres le dejaron, y es la que desea dejar a sus hijos. Espera construir una buena base de finca en su finca, para que sus descendencias tengan mejores oportunidades para enfrentar sus dificultades económicas.
Para el aumento su la cosecha en sus cafetos, y la nutrición de los mismos, Luis se encuentra con un nuevo reto; y es que no cuenta con el capital necesario para la compra de insumos que potencializarán su pequeña finca, por lo que está solicitando una financiamiento para la compra de los mismos.
texts.en: Luis is a small coffee producer from the North of Nicaragua. He works with a Fairtrade certificate, with which he has been able to improve his income in order to support his wife and two children. In his small farm he gives 15 temporary jobs with which he helps the economy of his community. Since he was young he dreamed of being a coffee producer. This is the inheritance that his parents left him and that he wants to leave his children. He hopes to build a good based farm in his farm, so his descendants may have better opportunities to face financial difficulties. In order to increase the harvest of his coffee plants and their nutrition, Luis is facing a new challenge; it is that he does not have the needed capital to buy inputs, which would give the most of his small farm. Therefore, he is requesting financing in order to buy these inputs.

loans.use: To buy inputs, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Bololoke Group

texts.fr: La cliente Neema est vice présidente du groupe Bololoke. Agée de 36 ans, elle est mariée à un homme emploi  et mère de  8 enfants dont  7 scolarisés. Elle sollicite un credit pour acheter 2 cartons de savon, 1 carton de biscuit, 2 cartons de stylo et  2 boites de bonbon. Son rêve est celui d’ouvrir un grand magasin. Sur ceux, elle remercie Hekima.
texts.en:
Neema is the vice-president of the Bololoke group. She is 36 years old, married to an employed man, and a mother of eight children, of whom seven go to school.

Neema is seeking a loan to buy two boxes of soap, one box of cookies, two boxes of pencils, and two boxes of candy.

Her dream is to open a large shop.

Neema thanks Hekima [for their work].

loans.use: to buy two boxes of soap, one box of cookies, two boxes of pencils, and two boxes of candy

loans.name: Mukolo Group

texts.fr: Madame Byamungu, occupe la fonction de vice présidente au sein du groupe de credit Mukolo. Agée de 49 ans, est mère de 10 enfants dont  seulement  6 vont à l’école et mariée à un homme d’affaire. Elle sollicite un nouveau prêt pour acheter 250kg de farine de manioc. Son objectif est celui de la croissance de ses activités.  Pour cela, elle remercie Hekima d'avoir soutenu les femmes à faible revenue.
texts.en:
Byamungu is the vice president of the loan group Mukolo. She is 49 years old, married to a businessman, and a mother of 10 children. Six of the children go to school.

Byamungu is seeking a new loan to buy 250 kilograms of manioc flour. Her goal is to grow her business. 

For this reason, she thanks Hekima for supporting women with low incomes.

loans.use: to buy 250 kilograms of manioc flour

loans.name: 03Đông Ngọc-Hoằng Phong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyệt works in agriculture, raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future. Nguyệt has been involved in this business for 5 years.

Nguyệt is 33 years old and she is married with two children. Nguyệt is the group leader of the 03Đông Ngọc-Hoằng Phong solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. She lives with her two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, in a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Nguyệt joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business, Nguyệt hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Eugenia Leonor

texts.es:
La Señorita Eugenia forma parte del grupo de crédito Feria Libre, le gusta su grupo de crédito porque han formado una gran familia, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad goza de un clima frió, de un centro histórico el cual es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta bañada por 4 ríos, tiene varios lugares en donde se puede gozar de la naturaleza.
La Señorita. Eugenia tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su madre con quien comparte los gastos del hogar, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Eugenia es de profesión estilista, esta actividad la aprendió estudiando y hace 3 años tiene un salón de belleza en sociedad  con una tía, se dedica a su negocio de lunes a sábados sin un horario. El dinero de su crédito va a ser para comprar de productos como tintes, shampoo y artículos de belleza. Su meta es estudiar nutrición.
texts.en:
Eugenia is part of the Feria Libre credit group. She likes her credit group because they are like a big family. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which has a cold climate. The historical center is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Four rivers run through the city and there are many places where one can enjoy nature.

Eugenia, 24, is single and lives with her mother, with whom she shares the household expenses. They do not have their own house, so they rent one. Eugenia works as a stylist. She learned about this business activity by studying. For three years, she has had a beauty salon along with her aunt. She works from Monday to Saturday without a fixed schedule. She will use this loan to buy products such as hair dye, shampoo, and beauty products. Her goal is to study nutrition.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, shampoo, and beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of washing soap, maize flour, sugar and other items

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is a 25-year-old single man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells cooking oil, sugar, toothpaste, bread and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. 

Duncan describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, toothpaste and other items. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, toothpaste and other items

loans.name: Jessy

texts.en:
Jessy is a 31-year-old married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be industrious. He operates a farm where he grows maize. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is in a favorable location and his primary customers are locals. 

Jessy describes his biggest business challenge to be poor weather. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. His business goal is to expand within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 26-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be determined.

She operates a retail business where she sells fruit. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be operating the business in a temporary structure.

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fruit. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will have a successful family and business. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock to her business and repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruit

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 60 years old and married with one child. Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Virginia has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Virginia has taken a 7,200 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.  She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Virginia is committed to rebuild her devastated life and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 52 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Agnes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Agnes has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Agnes aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ria

texts.en:
Ria has a live-in woman partner with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ria is 27 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Ria's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. Ria is taking out a 9,500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Ria has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Ria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Trinida

texts.en:
Trinida works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and been in NWTF since 2014.  She is now requesting a 2,500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Trinida will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.  Trinida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Muungano Group

texts.fr: Madame Mwenge, presidente  du groupe de credit  Muungano est âgée de 42 ans, mariée à un employé et mère de 5 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Femme d’une forte capacité, elle sollicite ce nouveau credit pour acheter un ballot de friperie. Son rêve est de réhabiliter sa maison et agrandir son entreprise. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour lui avoir donné un coup de main.
texts.en:
Mwenge, president of the loan group Muungano, is 42 years old, married to an employed man, and a mother of five children, who all go to school.

A woman of great ability, Mwenge seeks a new loan to buy a bale of used clothing.

Her dream is to renovate her home and expand her business.

Mwenge thanks Hekima for helping her.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothing

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kibibi femme à grande vision, est vice –présidente de l’association d’affaire Umoja. Mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous,  est mariée à un enseignant. Vendeuse au marché public, elle sollicite ce nouveau credit pour acheter 5 ballots de friperie. Son objectif  est de devenir une grande commerçante. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de tout cœur.
texts.en: Hekima client Kibibi is a woman of grand vision and vice president of the business group called Umoja. She is the mother of six children who are all enrolled in school. Her husband is a teacher. A trader at the public market, she is requesting this new loan to buy five bales of used clothing. Her goal is to become an important merchant. She thanks Hekima wholeheartedly.

loans.use: to buy five bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Tuungane Group

texts.fr: Madame Machozi est trésorière du groupe de credit Tuungane.  Mariée  à un enseignant de la place, elle est âgée de 47ans et mère de 5 enfants  dont 4 scolarisés. Le nouveau credit sollicité va lui permettre d’acheter  des poisons frais. Elle rêve devenir une grande commerçante et  scolarise ses enfants jusqu’au niveau supérieur. Enfin, elle remercie Hekima  de faciliter la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Machozi is the treasurer of the loan group Tuungane. Married to a local teacher, she is 47 years old and a mother of five children. Four of the children go to school.

This new loan that Machozi seeks will allow her to buy fresh fish.

She dreams of becoming an important merchant and to see her children go far in their education.

Finally, Machozi thanks Hekima who has helped to facilitate her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Shukrani Group

texts.fr: Madame Byabagula est vice-présidente dans l’association de credit Shukrani. Femme expérimentée dans la vente des souliers usagés  depuis 1991 est mariée à un homme sans profession. Elle sollicite un credit pour l’achat 1sac de 100kg des souliers usagés. La mévente est le seul obstacle que rencontre son activité. Elle rêve la croissance de ses affaires et offrir une meilleur vie à sa famille. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima.
texts.en: Madame Byabagula is the vice president of the loan group called Shukrani. A woman having experience selling used shoes since 1991, she is married to a man who has no trade. She is requesting this loan to buy one sack of 100 kg of used shoes. A slump in sales is the only obstacle her business encounters. She dreams of growing her business and offering a better life to her family, so she thanks Hekima.

loans.use: to buy one sack of 100 kg of used shoes.

loans.name: Imara/panzi Group

texts.fr: Madame Kabala occupe le poste de presidente dans le groupe de credit Imara/Panzi. Agée de 32 ans, mariée à un homme d’affaire  est mère de 7 enfants tous scolarisées. Elle est vendeuse des fruits depuis 2000 au marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite ce credit pour s’approvisionner  en 2 bassins d’avocat et 3 regimes de banane. Son objectif est d’acheter une parcelle. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien qu’elle apporte aux femmes.
texts.en:
Kabala is the president of the loan group Imara/Panzi. She is 32 years old, married to a businessman, and a mother of seven children, who all go to school. 

Kabala has been selling fruits since 2000 at a central town market.

She is seeking this loan to procure two baskets of avocados and three lots of bananas.

Her goal is to buy a piece of land [one day].

Kabala thanks Hekima for their support of women.

loans.use: to buy 2 baskets of avocados and 3 lots of bananas

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 32-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells drinks, cooking fat, sugar, wheat flour, bread, washing soap and other household items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. 

Caroline describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital to expand the business. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, wheat flour, cooking fat, drinks and other items she sells. Her business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a pickup to ease delivery of her products. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans were paid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her shop to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, wheat flour, cooking fat, drinks and other items she sells

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is married. To help her husband, she  operates a fish vending business while her husband does fishing to earn a living. Over more than five years in running the business, they have earned well for the family.  Juliet took out a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy new fishing nets to be used for fishing.  In the future, she wants improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is a married woman who sells woven nipa (palm frond mats used in house construction) in their village while her husband is earning from farming. As you can imagine from her photo, she sells sturdy manufactured products made with her own hand. Juvelyn also buys some of the mats from her neighbor to sell in town.  She says, she is satisfied with her business income since she has many customers who visit her place to make purchases. 

Even so, Juvelyn is asking for a loan in order enlarge her business venture since she expects an increase in demand this summer. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more palm fronds and woven products to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more palm leaves and woven products to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are individuals. 

Jane describes her biggest business challenge to be finances. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to add M-pesa float, i.e., money for customers to withdraw. Her business goal is to have many M-pesa outlets within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own agency outlets. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float, i.e., money for customers to withdraw

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 48 years old and married with four children.

Judy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Judy has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Judy aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Stella

texts.es:
Ella es Rosa Stella, tiene 19  años de Bogotá, está en 4 semestre de enfermería se siente muy contenta de estar estudiando este técnico porque es las rotaciones a aprendido mucho y ha encontrado personas maravillosas que le han enseñado, la familia está conformada por 3 hermanos, la mamá y el sobrino ella es la menor, el papá murió hace 12 años cuando ella tan solo tenía 7 años, sufrió mucho por la pérdida del padre, pero lo fue superando con el tiempo, la  mamá los sacó adelante con mucho sacrificio por que hizo de papá y mamá en una etapa muy difícil que fue el crecimiento de ellos, hoy en día son unas personas consientes de la vida con metas y proyectos en mente para ahora ser ellos los que ayuden a la mamá, rosa le da gracias a la madre por estarle pagando el estudio y apoyándola en lo que a ella le gusta, porque eso es lo que ellos necesitan para poder salir adelante, una familia que les de concejos y alientos para culminar los proyectos, quiere ser una buena enfermera, tener méritos en el trabajo y destacarse por lo que hace y por la forma de ser, uno de los sueños es conocer muchos países y culturas diferentes y también quiere estudiar inglés para ir a trabajar a Estados Unidos y tener una buena estabilidad económica, ahora que la mamá no vive con ella se ha dado cuenta que no es nada fácil porque. 
Puede decir que tiene la familia más hermosa, porque son muy unidos y están más  pendientes uno del otro, la mamá más hermosa porque los quiere y los cuida mucho y espera que siga así por muchos años más. 
Con este técnico tendrá un futuro asegurado y la satisfacción de que el tiempo no fue desperdiciado si no aprovechado para el desarrollo personal e integral y seguir estudiando en esta área de la salud que es lo que a ella le gusta hacer ayudar a las personas que necesiten de los cuidados.

Ella necesita el convenio kiva ya que es su último semestre de prácticas y los gastos se incrementan un poco y con la ayuda de kiva los gastos le serian un poco más económicos.
texts.en:
Rosa Stella is 19 years old and is from Bogotá, Colombia.  She is in her 4th semester of nursing and she feels very happy to be studying this field because in her rotations she is learning a lot and has encountered wonderful people who have taught her.  Her family is made up of 3 siblings, her mother, and her nephew.  Rosa Stella is the youngest.  Her father died 12 years ago when she was only 7.  She suffered a lot due to the loss of her father, but she has managed to overcome with time.  Her mother was able to help the children get ahead through great sacrifice because she functioned as mother and father during a very difficult stage, during their maturation.  Today they are people who are aware of their lives with goals and projects in mind so that now they can be the ones to help their mother.  Rosa gives thanks to her mother for paying for her studies and for supporting her interests, because that is what children need in order to get ahead -- a family that gives good advice and inspiration to finish projects. Rosa wants to be a good nurse, to achieve success in her work and to distinguish herself for what she does and for her way of being.  One of her dreams is to visit many countries and different cultures and also to study English in order to go and work in the U.S. and have a good stable income.  Now that her mother no longer lives with her, she has realized that this is not an easy task.

She can say that she has the most wonderful family because they are very close and very concerned for each other.  She has the most beautiful mother because it is evident that she loves her children and cares for them and Rosa hopes that this continues for many years.

With this career Rosa will have a secure future and the satisfaction that the time she invested was not wasted but rather invested in personal development.  She will continue studying in this area of healthcare, which is what she likes, in order to help people in need of care. 

She needs a loan from Kiva since it is her last semester of rotations and the expenses have increased and with Kiva's help the expenses will be a bit more manageable.

loans.use: To pay a semester of tuition for nursing school.

loans.name: Mufariji Group

texts.fr: La cliente Muliri est une commerçante, conseillère et membre du collectif d’affaires «Mufariji», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 50 ans, veuve et mère de 7 enfants, dont 6 étudient et  1 qui a fini ses études. La cliente est une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe sa marchandise  dans le marché  périphérique de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de ses parents. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 30 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter  un demi-sac d’haricots et la farine de manioc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, nourrir  ses enfants et leurs assurer les soins médicaux. En définitif, elle remercie  fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues de système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Muliri is a merchant, advisor, and member of the business group Mufariji. She is also a dynamic entrepreneur. At age 50, she is a widow and a mother of seven children. Six of the children go to school while one has already finished school.

Muliri sells basic foodstuffs. She displays her goods in a market at the edge of town. She started this business with funds she received from her parents. Later, she benefited from a loan through the micro-finance institution Hekima. Muliri has been in business now for 30 years.

This new loan will be used to buy a half a sac of beans and some manioc flour.

In the future, Muliri would like to increase her capital, education and feed her children, and ensure their health needs.

Muliri thanks Hekima for helping female entrepreneurs, who lack access to traditional financial services, become independent; especially during this difficult post conflict time in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy half a sac of beans and manioc flour

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 38-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be talkative. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for 18 years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are the general public. 

Alice will use the Kes 98,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her sixth loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Ucayali y para poder salir adelante trabaja como empleado en una empresa de seguridad como cajero, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede estudiar la carrera de contabilidad.

Carlos esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo podrá realizar mejoras en la la vivienda donde habita y de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida para su familia y así seguir trabajando par poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Poder tener un mejor empleo y apoyar a su padres”.
texts.en:
Carlos is 23 years old and lives in the city of Ucayali. To get ahead, he works in a security company as a cashier for about 9 hours a day and as a result of his work he is able to pursue his studies in accounting.

Carlos is grateful to the Kiva lenders; thanks to their great support, he can make improvements to the house where he lives and thus improve the quality of life for his family. By doing this, he can continue working towards fulfilling his big dream: "to have a better job and support his parents."

loans.use: to make improvements to a house

loans.name: Ahadi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Julienne est une commerçante et membre d’une plateforme d’affaires «Ahadi», âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère des 7 enfants, qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse de friperie (habillement dame) depuis 10 ans. Elle installe ses marchandises  dans un marché animé de la place. Elle  sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle démarra ses activités par de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint, lui aussi est un commerçant. Elle va acheter 1 ballon de friperie dame. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes  entrepreneurs exclues  du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Julienne is a retailer and a member of the business group 'Ahadi'.  She is 32 years old, married and mother to seven children, who all attend school.  She has been selling second-hand, women's clothing for ten years now, from a busy local market.

Julienne has requested this loan from the field partner, Hekima, in order to expand her business.  Her husband is also a retailer, and she started her business with money provided by him.  She plans to use her loan to buy one bale of second-hand women's clothing.

In the future, Julienne would like to increase her working capital, and educate, clothe and feed her children.  She is grateful to Hekima for the support they provide to women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the classic banking system.

loans.use: to buy 1 bale of women's second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Michael Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Solange est une vaillante commerçante depuis 8 ans, présidente et membre d’un groupe d’Affaires «Michael» âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont 4 etudient et 4 autres sont encore gosses. Elle est vendeuse du carburant. Elle installe sa marchandise aux croisées des avenues animées de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Son conjoint, lui aussi est commerçant. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir pour acheter 100 litres d'essence et 100 litres de gasoil. Elle avait reçu son premier fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son activité, construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en:
Solange has been a determined retailer for eight years now.  She is a member, and president of the business group 'Michael'.  Solange is 37 years old, married and mother to eight children, four of whom currently attend school and four of whom are too young for school.  

Solange sells fuel at the crossroads of busy avenues in her town.  She has requested this loan from the field partner, Hekima, in order to expand her business.  Her husband is also a retailer and he provided the initial funds for Solange to start her business.  She plans to use her loan to buy 100 litres of petrol and 100 litres of diesel.

In the future, Solange would like to expand her business, build a house and feed and educate her children.  She is grateful to Hekima for the support that they offer to non-bankable, women entrepreneurs, through their unsecured loan system.

loans.use: to buy 100 litres of petrol and 100 litres of diesel for resale.

loans.name: Pacifique Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ndalengwa est une commerçante, présidente et membre d’une banque villageoise «Pacifique », senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 47 ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants qui  tous étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse des pagnes. Elle étale ses marchandises au marché animée de la ville. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 17 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle débuta avec le premier capital reçu de  son champ, après récolte agricole. Son conjoint est un cultivateur. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 25 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une  maison pour sa famille,  scolariser, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Ndalengwa is a merchant, a dynamic and experienced entrepreneur, and a member and the president of the banque villageoise Pacifique. She is 47 years old, married to a farmer, and a mother of nine children. All the children go to school.

Ndalengwa has been selling pagnes [bright, colorful fabric] for 17 years. She displays her goods in a busy town market. She started this business with funds she earned from harvesting a field of crops. 

This new loan will serve to buy 25 lengths of pagnes.

One day, Ndalengwa hopes to build a house for her family and to feed and school her children.

Finally, she strongly thanks Hekima for helping female entrepreneurs, who lack access to banking services, become independent; especially in this moment of post conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 25 lengths of pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit operates a farm, growing and harvesting vegetables and rice for sale.  Over many years helping her husband, she has earned better income for the family. She was very happy recently, looking at her farm which physically could give better produce in the future. 

To improve the farm, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase seedlings and organic fertilizer. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jack

texts.en:
Jack is a 40-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as philanthropic. 

He operates a retail business where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are the general public. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a deep freezer for milk storage. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer for milk storage.

loans.name: Sakaria

texts.en:
Sakaria is a 42-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself as strict. 

He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 16 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are the general public. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his sixth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Tusonge Mbele Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwamba est une brave commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaires «Tusonge Mbele», senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 60 ans, responsable et mère de 4 enfants, dont 2 étudie et autres qui sont déjà mariés. La cliente est vendeuse de la boisson sucrée. Elle installe sa marchandise dans une buvette chez elle à la maison dans un quartier animé de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital fait d’une épargne. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 24 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter  10 caisses de Fanta sucré, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser  et  nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie  fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des  petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Mwamba is a determined retailer and a senior member of the business group 'Tusonge Mbele'.  She is 60 years old and mother to four children, two of whom are studying and two of whom are already married.  

Mwamba has been selling soft drinks from a stall at her home in a busy district of her town for 24 years now.  She started her business with money from her savings, and now works with the field partner, Hekima.  She plans to use her loan to buy ten crates of soft drinks such as Fanta.  In this way she hopes to be able to feed and educate her children.

Mwamba is very grateful to Hekima for helping small entrepreneurs, who are excluded from the classic banking system, to become independent.  This is especially important during this difficult time following the conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks such as Fanta, for resale.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, she also helps her husband in their farm, planting and harvesting crops. 

For five years in managing the store, she was able to sustain and support her children’s education. 

In order to offer more to her customers, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Angelita

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa forma parte del grupo de crédito Feria Libre, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad goza de un clima frió, de un centro histórico el cual es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta bañada por 4 ríos, tiene varios lugares en donde se puede gozar de la naturaleza.

La Señora Rosa tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad, están casados y viven independientes, sus tres hijos solteros están en el colegio, su esposo labora muy duro en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es herencia de sus padres.

Doña Rosa se dedica a la venta de mariscos, actividad que la desempeña desde hace 9 años, este trabajo le gusta porque le da el tiempo de estar con su familia. 
Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de pescado y mariscos, este nuevo crédito también es para invertir en pescado y mariscos para continuar con su negocio.  Le gusta su grupo de crédito por la solidaridad y unión de todas las socias.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a member of the Feria Libre loan group. The members live in Cuenca which enjoys a cool climate. Its historic centre has been recognized as a World Heritage Site. The town has four rivers and several places where people can go to enjoy nature.

Sra. Rosa is 44 years old, married, and has six children. Three of them are already adults; they are married and live independently. Her three single children are in school. Her husband works very hard as a construction worker. The house that they live in was inherited from her parents.

Rosa has sold shellfish for nine years. It's a job she enjoys as it gives her enough spare time to spend with her family. She used the money from a previous loan to buy fish and shellfish, and this loan too will be used to buy fish and shellfish. Rosa enjoys being part of her loan group for the commitment and friendship of all the members.

loans.use: to buy fish and seafood.

loans.name: Las Orquideas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las Orquídeas está formado por 12 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida como La Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, gracias a la belleza de su arquitectura es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones, son personas muy amables y de un corazón cálido como las socias quienes son personas luchadoras, muy trabajadores quienes con su sacrificio aportan a la economía de sus hogares y sacan adelante a sus familias.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Melba, es una socia amable, gentil que forma parte del grupo de crédito Las Orquídeas, este es su tercer crédito que lo realiza a lado de sus amigas y compañera de este grupo en donde es la presidenta, lo que más le gusta es la solidaridad y el apoyo que cada uno de los miembros aporta.
La Señora. Melba tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 16 años de edad que está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Melba trabaja en varias actividades que le ayudan a mejorar su estabilidad económica, cría y vende perros de raza, también se dedica a la limpieza de casas medio día y el resto de su tiempo labora cuidando viveros. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de alimento para perros y pagar la instalación del agua potable en su vivienda. Su meta es tener un hostal.
texts.en:
The "Las Orquídeas" loan group has twelve members who live around Cuenca, a city also known as "La Santa Ana de Los 4 Ríos". With beautiful architecture that brought the city to be named a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1999, the people here keep up traditions and culture. The locals are very friendly and warm; the members of "Las Orquídeas" loan group are plucky, hard-working women who, with sacrifice, are supporting their households and helping their families to prosper.

One member of this group is Melba. She is friendly and kind. This is the third loan that she will be taking out alongside her friends and fellow group-members. Melba is president of the group and what she likes most about it is the solidarity and support that every member brings.

Melba is 32 years old and is a single mother to her 16-year-old son, who studying at one of the city schools. Melba owns the house where she and her son live.

Melba works in various jobs that help her to improve her financial stability. She raises and sells pedigree dogs, and also makes a living cleaning houses part-time; she spends the rest of her time looking after plants. This loan will be used to buy dog food and to install running water on her home. Melba's goal is to open up a hostel.

loans.use: to buy dog food and to install running water.

loans.name: La Vida Plena  (Paute) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito La Vida Plena esta formado por 11 socias y 2 socios, viven en Uzhupud en el cantón Paute, son personas muy unidas que están trabajando a diario para forjar un mejor futuro para sus hijos y familias, se caracterizan también por mantener sus tradiciones, cultura y buen humor. En el cantón Paute se dedican a la floricultura por su clima templado, es propicio para la siembra de una gran variedad de frutas, trabajan en la agricultura y cría de animales, su gente también se dedican al comercio en especial a la venta de pollos asados al carbón que un plato típico. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Sonia, tiene 31 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido un hijo de 11 años que está estudiando en la escuela¡ del sector, su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que vive es de un familiar que les prestó.
Doña Sonia pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa donde se dedica al cuidado de su hogar y  de su hijo,  para ayudarle a su esposo económicamente se dedica a la cría de cuyes a los que los vende en su cantón. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de cuyes de mejor calidad. Su sueño es que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
The La Vida Plena credit group is made up of 11 women and 2 men. They live in Uzhupud in the Paute canton. They are very close and working every day to forge a better future for their children and families. It is also notable for its traditions, culture and good humor. In the Paute canton, they grow flowers because of its mild climate. It is also apt for growing a variety of fruit and they work in agriculture and raising animals. The people also work in trade, especially selling chicken roasted over a grill, which is a traditional dish.
 
One of the members of this group is Sonia. She is 31 years old and in a common law marriage. She has an 11 year old son who is in the local school. Her husband works as a bricklayer and the house they live in belongs to a relative, who lent it to them. 

Sonia spends most of her time in the house where she takes care of the home and her son. In order to help her husband financially, she raises guinea pigs that she sells in her canton. She will invest the money from the loan in buying the best quality guinea pigs. Her dream is for her son to go to graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of eggs.

loans.name: Safina Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kitunyema est une commerçante, conseillère et membre du collectif d’affaires «Safina»,  entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 58 ans, femme vivant seule et mère de 2 enfants, qui sont tous mariés. La cliente est une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe sa marchandise dans un dépôt du marché de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de ses parents. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 25 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 13 sacs de farine de manioc. Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et la construire, scolariser,  nourrir ses  petits fils. En définitif, elle remercie  fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues de système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile  post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: The customer, Kitunyema, is a trader and also an advisor and member of the Safina business association. She is a dynamic entrepreneur, who is 58 years old. She lives by herself and has two children, who are both married. The customer sells groceries and lays out her goods on a stall in the town market. She began her business with an initial capital given to her by her parents. Later on she received a loan from IMF Hekima. She began her business 25 years ago. This new loan will be used to buy 13 sacks of cassava flour. She thereby hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and build on it, as well as to educate and feed her grandsons. Finally, she is extremely grateful to Hekima for making female entrepreneurs, who are exlcuded from classic banks, autonomous, particularly during this difficult post-conflict period in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 13 sacks of cassava flour.

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Kalivanda est une Couturière depuis 12 ans, secrétaire et membre d’un groupe d’Affaires «Faida» âgée de 36 ans, veuve et mère de 4 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle s’occupe du tricotage et sociétaire d’un atelier, chez elle a don domicile. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir pour acheter des nouveaux matériels: Tissus, ficelles, machine de tricotage etc. Elle démarra avec de fonds reçu de son mari lors de son vivant. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire un atelier pour initier, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en: The customer, Kalivanda, has been a seamstress for the past 12 years, and she is also secretary and member of the Faida business group. She is 36 years old, a widow and mother to four children, who are all studying. She takes care of knitting and is a member/shareholder of a workshop which is in her home. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her business, and this new loan will be used to buy new materials: fabrics, yarns, knitting machine etc. She began her business with capital her husband gave her when he was alive. In the future she would like to build a workshop to initiate a business in, and also to educate and feed her children. She thanks Hekima for its support to female entrepreneurs by granting them loans without any material guarantee.

loans.use: to buy new materials: fabrics, yarns, knitting machine, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A loan of $1,000 is offered to Maria to improve her business. She has a car and many people come to use her car every day. She will use the loan to repair her car. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Maria independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. 

She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To repair her car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta y compra de artesania, la socia vende diferentes tipos de muñecas, chompas entre otros a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder agrandar su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas, muñecas entre otros.
La socia está agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is still working buying and selling hand made crafts. She sells different types of dolls, sweaters and more to all of her customers who ask her for them. She has been doing this business for years and its brings her personal and financial satisfaction. She wants to expand her business and that is a way she will get her family ahead. She is asking for the loan to buy sweaters, dolls and more. 

She is grateful for the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, dolls and more.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel vive en el distrito de pueblo nuevo, es un hombre muy trabajador, sobre todo porque es padre de familia y para el el poder darle a sus un futuro mejor es lo mas importante. Es por ello que cada día trabaja con mucho empeño en su pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de animales como vacas, cerdos, ovejas; asi como también trabaja como obre agrícola asimismo su esposa vende productos como cerveza y gaseosas, con lo cual tiene un ingreso extra y de esta manera pueden salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo.

Daniel esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá solventar los gastos de estudios de su hija, quien esta estudiando la carrera técnica de farmacia, de esta manera su hija seguira estudiando y podrá seguir trabajando y esforzándose para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Ver a su hija hecha una profesional”.
texts.en:
Daniel lives in the "Pueblo Nuevo" district. He is a very hard-working man, above all because he is a father and the most important thing for him is that he gives his children a better future. To do this, Daniel is very determined at his little business raising and selling animals, such as pigs, cows and sheep. He also works as a farm labourer. Daniel's wife sells products such as beers and fizzy drinks, giving the family an extra income and allowing them to get ahead with a lot of effort.

Daniel is grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to their support, he will be able to cover the costs of his daughter's higher education. She is studying to be a pharmacist and with this loan will continue to do so. Daniel wants to work and put in the effort to make a his great dream - of seeing his daughter have a profession - come true.

loans.use: to pay higher education costs.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar, tiene la edad  de 30 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y su hijo, los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de frijol de buena calidad, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Oscar is 30 years old. He lives with his wife and his son and they are his main priority. With his loan, he intends to buy fertilizer and other products to apply to his crops so they will have good growth. He also wants to buy high quality bean seeds and pay for the labor to apply the products and help with the crops when they have developed. In this way, he can ensure good work. What he intends on doing is taking advantage of the good weather and soil conditions in the area and also putting into practice his several years' experience of managing basic grains. In addition, he plans on buying the best products of the best quality so that his crops will develop well and be healthy so he can have a good harvest, and a good production in the short term. With the income from the harvest that he hopes to obtain, he wants to help his family's well being and education, meet some family goals, and keep investing in more crops. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had any other loans before with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better conditions and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Amkeni Group

texts.fr: La cliente Malei est une commerçante et membre d’une plateforme d’affaires «Amkeni», entrepreneur, âgée de 60 ans et mère de 6 enfants dont 2 étudient et 4 sont mariés.  La cliente est  une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires (pomme de terre). Elle installe sa marchandise dans un marché de la place. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu dans la ristourne. Son conjoint est un agent de sécurité dans  la police Nationale. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 24 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 200 kilogrammes de pomme de terre. Ainsi, elle compte acheter une parcelle, construire et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie  fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: The customer, Malei, is a trader and a member of the Amkeni business platform. She is a 60-year old entrepreneur and has six children, two of whom are studying and four who are married. The customer sells food products (potatoes) and lays out her goods in a local market. She began her business with an initial capital received from a "ristourne" (a revolving communal fund whereby each member contributes periodically an agreed amount and this is passed on in rotation to other members). Her husband is a security agent in the National Police. Later on she got a loan from IMF Hekima. She has been carrying out this business for 24 years and this new loan will be used to buy 200 kilos of potatoes. She thereby hopes to be able to buy a plot of land, build on it and feed her children. Finally, she is extremely grateful to Hekima for making female entrepreneurs, who cannot access banks, autonomous, particularly during this critical period of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 200 kilos of potatoes.

loans.name: Nayade Teresa

texts.es:
Nayade Teresa es una joven estudiante de mercadeo, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Nayade tengo 21 años de edad y resido en San Cristóbal al Sur de la cuidad de Santo Domingo.  Actualmente vivo con mis padres y soy la mayor de tres hermanos.
Los ingresos que actualmente recibe mi hogar son a través del trabajo de mi madre y el mío, pero estos no son bastos para lo que exige mi hogar, contando que resido fuera de la ciudad y tengo muchos gastos de transporte para trasladarme de mi provincia a la misma.
Actualmente estoy en mi quinto cuatrimestre de la carrera Licenciatura en Mercadotecnia en una de las mejores universidades que imparte esta carrera que es la Universidad Apec, esta carrera me gusta porque me ayuda a desarrollarme como negociante y así poder crear en un futuro mi propio negocio que es la fuente de la que quiero vivir cuando me independice ya que es bueno siempre aparte de recibir ingresos por empleo el tener sus propios ingresos para cubrir imprevistos como los que ha atravesado mi familia últimamente.
Sin la ayuda de este préstamo, no podré seguir mis estudios universitarios ya que actualmente no cuento con los ingresos necesarios para cubrirlos.
Cursando mi segundo cuatrimestre en la universidad  me vi en la necesidad de tomar un préstamo para poder continuar mis estudios, confiando en que la situación económica de mi familia mejoraría, pero ahora en mi quinto cuatrimestre me veo en la situación de no poderlo seguir utilizando ya que el dinero que debo pagar para saldar el mismo es muy elevado y no me permitiría cubrir los gastos de transporte que es para lo que tengo destinado parte de mis ingresos. Me veo expuesta nuevamente a tener que paralizar mis estudios sino consigo los fondos necesarios para cubrir los cuatrimestres que me hacen falta, por eso es importante para mi poder contar con ustedes, para poder continuar mis estudios, echar adelante y cumplir las metas  que me he trazado como es el hacerme un profesional para aportarle a mi sociedad con buenos conocimientos y ayudar a mi familia a echar para adelante.
texts.en:
Nayade Teresa is a young marketing student. She is seeking a loan to be able to cover her education costs. This is her story:

My name is Nayade Teresa, I am 21 years old and I live in San Cristobal, south of the city of Santo Domingo. I currently live with my parents, and I am the eldest of three siblings. The income that my household obtains is through my work and my mother's work, but it is not enough for the needs of my household considering that we live outside of the city and I have a lot of transportation costs to to travel from my province to the city. 

I am currently in my fifth quarter of my marketing degree at one of the best univeristies, Apec University. I enjoy this field because it allows me to develop as a negotiator, and be able to in the future create my own business that can become my way to earn a living when I become independent because it is always good to not only earn an income from your job, but to also have your own income to cover unforeseen expenses like the ones that my family has had to experience lately. 

Without the help of this loan, I will not be able to continue my education as at the moment, I do not have the resources to cover the expenses. When I began my second quarter at the university, I found myself in need of taking out a loan to continue my education, believing that my family's financial situation would improve. However, now in my fifth quarter, I find myself in a situation where I will not be able to continue because the money that I need to pay back the first loan is a lot, and I would not be able to cover my transportation costs for which I have designated part of my income. 

I find myself again having to put my education on hold if I do not find the necessary resources to cover my final quarters. For this reason, it is important for me to be able to count on you so that I can continue my education, charge ahead, and reach the goals I have set for myself such as becoming a professional so that I can contribute to my society with my knowledge and help my family get ahead.

loans.use: with higher education costs.

loans.name: Carmen Isabel

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 50 años, es una pequeña productora de café en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. Toda su vida ha estado relacionada a esta actividad junto a su familia, la cual ha venido mejorando y ahora maneja bajo criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo.

En los últimos años, su plantación de café ha sido afectada con problemas de antracnosis, lo cual ha disminuido la productividad de su cafetal y con ello los ingresos de su familia. Como medida, ella está gestionando recursos de inversión, y en este caso un crédito para garantizar las actividades de mantenimiento de su cafetal y lograr una buena cosecha en este ciclo.

Esta es la principal actividad económica de Carmen y su mayor deseo es poder continuar trabajando en este rubro ya que está segura tiene un gran potencial económico con el cual puede garantizar el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen is 50 years old and is a small-time coffee producer in a community in the north of Nicaragua. Carmen has been involved in this work with her family all of her life. She has improved her abilities to grow coffee over the years and now works under a Fairtrade certificate.

In recent years, Carmen's coffee plantation has been affected by problems such as disease, which has reduced the yield and the family's income. To mitigate problems, Carmen is managing her investments and is taking out a loan in order to look after her crops and have a good harvest this season.

Coffee growing is Carmen's most important work and her greatest wish is to continue working in this area as she is sure that, financially, it has a lot of potential and that, with it, she will be able to look after her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: La señora Dionisia tiene 43 años, tiene tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa  al por mayor y menor ella tiene su puesto de venta en la populosa feria de la 16 de Julio  de la ciudad de el Alto, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Dionisia,  va a usar este préstamo para compra de ropa al por mayor como se acerca la temporada de invierno comprara chamarras y chompas su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Dionisia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la feria muchas personas se dedican a la venta de ropa y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz ya agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para crecer en su actividad, mejorara sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dionisia is 43 years old and has three children. She sells clothing in wholesale and retail. She has her stall in the busy "16 de Julio" fair in the city of el Alto. This is her first loan with the institution. Dionisia will use the loan to purchase clothing in bulk as winter is coming. She will purchase jackets and sweaters. Her reason for seeking this loan is to increase her inventory. 

Dionisia faces challenges in her business including competition since in the fair there are many people who work selling clothing. She will use these benefits to continue purchasing merchandise that will allow her to generate more income. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity that she is being given to grow in her business, increase her earnings, and increase her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase winter clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda owns and operates a nipa-weaving (palm-weaving) business making roofing materials. She earns well from this and has been able to sustain the business. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying raw materials.

Aside from this, Melinda also has a farm – their main source of income. To make farm improvements and to prepare for the next planting season, she took out a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business selling clothes, shoes, mattresses and bags. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in an area with good potential, and her primary customers are locals.

Alice describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use this 60,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more stock of clothes, shoes and other items. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be a prominent businessperson. This is her fourth loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes, shoes and other items

loans.name: Meljane

texts.en: Meljane lives in Misamis Occidental with her family. She runs a general store selling goods in their local community to earn a living. She has had this business for more than 2 years. She took out a loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy additional stock, such as canned goods, noodles and spices. She plans to expand her store in order to gain more income for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy additional stock, such as canned goods, noodles and spices.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 26-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells basins, jugs and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a developing area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

Grace will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of basins, jugs and other items that she sells. She hopes that in the future, her business will be successful and that she will be able to sustain her family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of basins, jugs and other items she that sells

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.en:
Since childhood, Zaynura dreamed of becoming a successfully business lady. She learnt sewing from a sewer in her parent’s house. So, she began her business sewing eleven years ago. 

Zaynura is divorced with no children, and she lives alone. Zaynura has a workshop where she provides services for her clients. She sews national women clothes. Many locals prefer her service because she sews with high quality. Also, she has some pupils whom she teaches to sew. 

Zaynura has two sewing machines. She is going to buy an embroidery machine and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni (TJS). She hopes this loan will help her to develop her business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine for her sewing machine

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna offers Liquified Petroleum Gas (LPG) within her locality. She has been doing this kind of business for five years. She also engaged herself in direct selling businesses, particularly cosmetic products (AVON) and Natasha (shoes, sandals, dresses, blouses, wallets, bags, slippers and belts). With her determination to have a better way of living and let her only child finish her studies, she and her husband work together to obtain greater income. 

Myrna wants to focus on selling Liquified Petroleum Gas (LPG); that's why she's asking for financial assistance amounting to 13,000 PHP. She hopes that lenders will approve her requested amount of loan in order to realize her goals someday.

loans.use: to purchase eight pieces of Liquifed Petroleum Gas (LPG) to be sell

loans.name: Nanie

texts.en: Nanie earns a living from selling snacks, while her husband does farming. For two years, Nanie has earned well and sustained the living. She has also purchased some home improvements. To improve the business, Nanie borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy raw ingredients to prepare snacks for sale. She hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare snacks for sale

loans.name: Twizamure Group

texts.fr:
François fait partie du groupe  Twizamure et  habite à Gitega. Il  a 64 ans et est marié à Mbonimpa, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  6 enfants.  

Il fait le commerce de boutique (sel,savon,riz,...) depuis 4 ans. 

Il est à  son cinquième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’articles en grande quantité (sel, savons,riz, …)   à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
François is a member of the Twizamure Group, and lives in Gitega.  He is 64 years old and married to Mbonimpa who is a farmer.  Together they have six children.  He has been selling various products in his shop (salt, soap, rice, etc) for four years now. 

This will be the fifth loan for François, with the field partner, Turame.  He plans to use his loan to increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of products (salt, soap, rice, etc) for sale in his shop.  In this way, he hopes to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of products (salt, soap, etc) for resale.

loans.name: Turwanybukene Group

texts.fr:
Léonore fait partie du groupe  Turwanyubukene et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a 47 ans et est mariée à Minani, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants.  

Elle fait le commerce de farine de manioc   depuis 20 ans. 

Elle est à  son  vingt –et-unième crédits à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une  grande quantité  de farine de manioc   à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Léonore is a member of the Turwanyubukene Group and lives in Gitega.  She is 47 years old and married to Minani, a retailer.  Together they have five children.  She has been selling cassava flour for twenty years now.  

This will be Léonore's twenty-first loan with the field partner, Turame.  She plans to use her loan to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of cassava flour, which she will sell in order to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to increase her business capital and buy a large quantity of cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a 41-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. Sally has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy and competitive place and her primary customers are walk-ins and permanent customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity. 

Sally will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of maize. Her business goal is to be a supplier of cereals within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: buy more stocks of maize

loans.name: Espérance Group

texts.fr: La cliente Barole est une vaillante commerçante depuis 7 ans et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Espérance», entrepreneur, dynamique âgée de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 11 enfants, dont 6 étudient et 5 autres sont déjà mariés. Elle est vendeuse souliers usagés. Elle installe son business dans un marché centre de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 3 sacs de souliers. Son conjoint est un retraité de l’administration publique. Elle avait débuté avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflits dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en:
Barole has been a determined retailer for seven years now, and is a member of the business group 'Espérance' (Hope).  She is 54 years old, married and mother to eleven children, of whom six are studying and five are already married.  She sells second-hand shoes at a market in the centre of town.
