Barole has requested this loan from the field partner, Hekima, in order to expand her business.  She plans to use her loan to buy three bags of second-hand shoes.  Her husband has retired from his job in public administration,  she started her business with money provided by him.

In the future, Barole would like to continue to educate and feed her children.  She is grateful to Hekima for choosing to work with women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the classic banking system, and for offering unsecured loans.  This is particularly important during this period following the conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of second-hand shoes for resale.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: Gulchehra was born in 1976. She is a kind woman with a good soul. Since childhood she was a very hardworking girl. Now, Gulchehra is divorced and has no children. She lives alone. Gulchehra dreams to be happy. She works in a state organization because she is a higher-educated woman. Gulchehra has a small salary which is not enough for improving living conditions. She wants to repair the fence of her house, but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy soil, cement, etc. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy soil, cement, etc. for repairing her house’s fence

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda joined GDMPC this year to have an easy access to financial services. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC in addition to her capital. The money taken is intended to buy additional seedlings and organic fertilizer in order to improve the farm. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Nilda expects an increase in sales so as to expand her farm and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional seedlings and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en: To earn his living, Norberto settled in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines together with his child. Over the past two years, Norberto was able to run his retail store that absolutely met the market primary demands. The business is still doing well and is giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. Recently, Norberto took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell in order to increase sales. He expects an increase in sales so as to expand his business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods

loans.name: Vyukadukore Group

texts.fr:
Rose fait partie du groupe Vyukadukore et habite à Bujumbura. C’est une veuve de  45 ans. Elle a 2 enfants l’un a 20 ans et l’autre 31 ans, tous étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 1 orphelin qui étudie.

Elle fait le commerce du charbon de bois  depuis 20 ans.

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de charbon de bois  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années  prochaines, elle voudrait  avoir sa propre maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Rose belongs to the Vyukadukore group and lives in Bujumbura. She is a 45-year old widow and has two children, one who is 20 years old and the other 31; both of them are studying. She also has an orphan in her care who is studying.

She has been selling charcoal for the past 20 years and is on her fourth loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan she is granted, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of charcoal to resell, so that she can earn more money.

In the coming years she would like to have her own house and see her children through their studies.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of charcoal to resell so that she can make more money.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is 49 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Pacita has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from a general store. Pacita is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 50 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Elenita has been farming rice for ten years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Urwego Group

texts.fr:
M. Florence  fait partie du groupe Urwego et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle  a 40 ans  et est mariée  à  Pie une fonctionnaire. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 17  à 21 ans  dont 3 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de bière, de limonade et de brochette dans son bistrot  depuis 8  ans. 

Elle est  à son cinquième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de caisse de bière, et de limonade à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, elle voudrait  faire le commerce de  charbon de bois  comme une deuxième activité  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Florence is a member of the Urwego Group and lives in Bujumbura.  She is 40 years old and married to Pie who is a civil servant.  Together they have five children aged between seventeen and twenty-one years old.  Three of their children are currently studying.  

Florence has been selling beer, lemonade and food on skewers in her bistro for eight years.  This will be her fifth loan with the field partner, Turame.  She plans to use her loan to increase her working capital and buy many crates of beer and lemonade for resale.  In this way, she hopes to improve her earnings.

In the coming years, Florence would like to diversify and begin selling charcoal as well.  She would also like to see her children continue to study.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy many crates of beer and lemonade for resale.

loans.name: Gatimakeza Group

texts.fr:
Siméon  fait partie du groupe Gatimakeza et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 33 ans  et est marié  à  Aline, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 1  à 6 ans  dont 2 étudient.

Il fait le commerce des habits   depuis  10  ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, il  voudrait  faire le commerce de riz, de haricot comme une deuxième activité  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Siméon is a member of the Gatimakeza Group and lives in Bujumbura.  He is 33 years old and married to Aline who is a retailer.  Together they have three children aged from one to six years old.  Two of their children currently attend school.

Siméon has been selling clothing for ten years now.  This will be his first loan with the field partner, Turame.  He plans to use his loan to increase his working capital and buy many items of clothing for resale.  In this way, he hopes to be able to increase his earnings.

In the coming years, Siméon would like to diversify and begin selling rice and beans.  He would also like to see all his children study.

loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy many items of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Tuvyumvakumwe Group

texts.fr:
Daniel  fait partie du groupe  Tuvyumvakumwe et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 45 ans  et est marié  à  chantal,une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 9 enfants âgés de 1 à 23 ans  dont 6 étudient.

Il fait le commerce des oeufs  depuis  13  ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’œufs à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, il  voudrait  importer des poules  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Daniel belongs to the Tuvyumvakumwe group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 45 years old and married to Chantal, a trader. They have nine children together, aged between one and 23 years old; six of the children are studying.

He has been trading in eggs for the past 13 years and this is his first loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he is granted, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large number of eggs which he will resell to make more money.

In the coming years he would like to import hens and see his children through their studies.

loans.use: to increases his capital and buy a large quantity of eggs for resale, so he can earn more.

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en:
Vugar was born in 1986. He is single and lives in the Baku region with his parents. Vugar’s family are internally displaced persons from the city of Lachin. Vugar graduated from music school in piano. For 3 years he has been teaching special piano lessons. 

Vugar needs to tune and repair his piano. For this reason, he has applied for a loan from Komak in the amount of 600 AZN. He sends great thanks to Kiva and all lenders for their help. In the future, he wants to open a music school and provide music education to his students.

loans.use: to tune and repair his piano

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en: Vergie has been operating her own general store while her husband farms to make a living. For the past two years, she has been able to maintain and sustain her store. She always finds many ways to augment their living. To improve her sales, Vergie is requesting a new loan to buy more grocery goods to sell. She plans to save a portion of the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a married man. He has seven children.  He operates a farm where he grows maize.

Moses describes himself to be industrious.  He has been involved in this business for one year. 

His primary customers are other farmers.  He describes his biggest business challenge as a shortage of rain. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer.  His business goal is to be a supplier of farm products within five years.  Moses hopes that in the future, he will have a store to sell his products.  

Moses will use the anticipated profits to buy more land for farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Noriko

texts.en: Noriko owns and operates a farm to earn a living, planting and harvesting bananas to sell in the local community. She and her husband have been in this business for more than seven years. With her income, she has been able to maintain and sustain her farm and support the family's needs. Recently, Noriko took a new loan from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer and new seedlings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and new seedlings

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 50 years old and married with five children, one attends school.

Julieta works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell.

Julieta has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has run the general store for five years and earns additional income by fattening pigs.

Julieta aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kapsabet, a small town adjacent to Kakamega County.  Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest.  Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. 

The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping.

Ruth is married and has eight children.  Both she and her husband are farmers for 30 years and currently growi horticultural crops.  They also keep dairy cattle.  

Ruth is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey, provide her with Honey for medicine and the bees will aid in pollinating their crops.

This is Ruth's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds to start a business.  Ruth's hopes to buy a car for transporting milk from her farm to the market.

loans.use: to buy beehives and materials for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, over-sewing machine, iron, table, and air conditioner.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 45-year-old married woman with 7 children. She describes herself as industrious. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows, which produce milk for her to sell, and she also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a conducive environment and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenges as poor weather and the fluctuation of prices. 

Mary will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and animal feeds. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a business that will change the fortune of the family. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM, and her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to increase her farmland.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and animal feeds

loans.name: Mashudi

texts.en:
Mashudi is a 51-year-old married man with 5 children. He describes himself as polite and kind. He operates a farm where he grows maize and beans, and he has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in an area with water. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. 

Mashudi will use the requested loan of 50,000 KES to buy fertilizer. His business goal is to become a well-known farmer in the region within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM, and his previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a computer .

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is 57 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Enriquita is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Jasmin

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Ma. Jasmin works hard to support her family. She has a business selling personal products in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Ma. Jasmin is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy more body lotion, perfume, and other personal products.

Ma. Jasmin has been sustaining her business activities through her ten previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more body lotion, perfume, and other personal products.

loans.name: Niyera Group

texts.fr:
Ferdinand  fait partie du groupe  Niyera et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 41 ans  et est marié  à  Chantal, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 3 à 13 ans  dont 2 étudient.

Il fait le commerce du charbon de bois  depuis  13  ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de charbon de bois  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, il  voudrait  acheter une parcelle en ville et construire une maison  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Ferdinand, age 41, is a member of the group Niyera and he lives in Bujumbura. He is married to a merchant named Chantal, and they have three children ages 3 to 13, two of whom go to school. 

Ferdinand has been selling charcoal for 13 years, and he is seeking this first loan from Turame to strengthen his working capital. He plans to buy a large supply of charcoal to bolster his sales and revenue. 

In the coming years, he would like to buy some land in the city and build a house. He also wants to see his children pursue their education.

loans.use: to strengthen his working capital, and buy a large supply of charcoal to bolster his sales and revenue.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius lives in Kapsabet, a small town adjacent to Kakamega County.  Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. 

Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops.  The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping.

Pius is married and has four children.  He is a photographer.  He undertakes farming with his wife as well.  They have been farming for 32 years and currently grow maize and vegetables.  They also keep poultry, dairy cattle and fish on their farm. 

Pius is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income through the sale of honey, provide him with honey for medicine, and the bees will aid in pollinating their crops.

This is Pius' first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds to pay school fees for his children.  Pius' hopes to become a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy beehives materials for honey production.

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en:
Elisha lives in Kapsabet, a small town adjacent to Kakamega County.  Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border.  

It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping.  It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Elisha is married and has six children.  He is a business man and undertakes farming with his wife as well.  They have been farming for 20 years and currently growi maize, tea and bananas on their farm.  Elisha is excited about beekeeping as it does not require much input and it will earn income from the sale of honey.

This is Elisha’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to expand his business.  Elisha’s hopes to do well in business.

loans.use: to buy beehives and materials for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a loan to pay for his children's education.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel lives in Kapsabet, a small town near Kakamega County.  Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest.  Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping.

Joel is married and has eight children.  He runs a small business and he undertakes farming with his wife as well.  They have been farming for 27 years and currently grow tea and bananas.  They also rear cattle.  

Joel is excited about beekeeping, as it does not require a lot of inputs and it will earn him some income.

This is Joel’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds to buy beehives. Joel’s hope for the future is to expand his farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives materials for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new computer.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en: Titus is a 35-year-old single man who describes himself to be polite and kind. For four years, he has operated a farm where he grows maize and rice. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy farming supplies. His business goal is to be the best farmer in his community within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. He will use the anticipated profits from his loan to open a retail business.

loans.use: buy farm supplies

loans.name: Kanama Group

texts.fr:
Oscar  fait partie du groupe Kanama  et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 32 ans  et est marié  à  Fabiola, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de  3 mois à 12 ans  dont 3 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (huile de palme, riz, haricot,…)   depuis  14  ans. 

C’est son premier    crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d’articles de sa boutique (huile de palme. Riz, haricot,…)  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, il  voudrait  avoir un grand capital  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Oscar, age 32, is a member of the group Kanama and he lives in Bujumbura. He is married to a merchant named Fabiola, and they have five children aged 3 months to 12 years old, three of whom go to school. 

Oscar has been a shopkeeper  for 14 years, selling goods such as palm oil, rice, beans, etc. He is seeking this first loan from Turame to strengthen his working capital. He plans to buy a large supply of merchandise for his shop to bolster his sales and revenue.

In the coming years, he would like to further bolster his capital. He also wants to see his children pursue their education.

loans.use: to strengthen his working capital and stock up on merchandise for his shop (palm oil, rice, beans) to bolster his sales and revenue.

loans.name: Suzita

texts.en:
Suzita is 39 years old and married with six children. Four of her children are in school and she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Suzita has had a fishing business in the Philippines for 10 years and has requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, Suzita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ubucuti Group

texts.fr:
Adidja  fait partie du groupe Ubucuti  et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle  a 38 ans  et est mariée  à  Ismaël, un mécanicien. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de  7  à 20 ans, tous étudient.

Elle fait le commerce du thé, du lait, pains,…   dans son cafeteria depuis  14  ans. 

C’est son premier    crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande  de sucre pour préparer du thé, de farine pour préparer du pain,…  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, elle voudrait  avoir  la capacité de satisfaire les besoins familiaux (alimentation, soins de sante, scolarisation des enfants.)
texts.en:
Adidja, age 38, is a member of the group Ubucuti and she lives in Bujumbura. She is married to a mechanic named Ismaël, and they have five children ages 7 to 20 years old who all go to school. 

For the past 14 years, Adidja has been running a coffee shop where she sells tea, milk, bread products, etc. She is seeking this first loan from Turame to strengthen her working capital. She plans to stock up on sugar for the tea and flour for the bread in order to bolster her sales and revenue.

In the coming years, she would like to be able to support the family’s needs (food, healthcare, children’s tuition).

loans.use: to strengthen her working capital and stock up on sugar for the tea and flour for the bread in order to bolster her sales and revenue.

loans.name: Carlos Rafael

texts.es: Carlos Rafael, tiene la edad  de 30 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y su hijo, los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de frijol de buena calidad, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Carlos Rafael is 30 years old and married. He lives with his wife and child, who are his main priorities. With this loan he plans to buy fertilizer and other products to help his crops to germinate quality bean seeds. He also wants to pay for labor to apply the products and take care of the plantation once the plants start to grow. In this way he can assure that a good job is done.

He wants to take advantage of good soil and climatic conditions that his area has for growing and put in practice the several years experience he has growing basic grains. Plus he can buy better products of higher quality and ensure that his plantation develops properly and healthily to have an adequate harvest and in the short term produce a lot.

With the income from the harvest he plans to use it for the well-being and studies of his family and fulfill some family goals and continue to invest in his crops. This is the first loan he has had from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any loans from the State banks and FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better conditions and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Ababivyi Group

texts.fr:
Joël fait partie du groupe Ababivyi  et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle  a 36 ans  et est mariée  à  Christine, un planton. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de  1  à  13 ans, dont 2  étudient.
Il a sous sa charge 2 orphelins qui étudient.

Il  fait  le commerce d’huile de palme  depuis  14  ans. 

Il est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande  quantité d’huile de palme  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, il voudrait  acheter  une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en: Joël is a part of the Ababivyi group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 36 years old, and is married to Christine, an orderly. Together, they have three children, between 1 and 13 years old, two of whom are in school. He also has two orphans in his care who are in school. He has sold palm oil for 14 years. He is on his fourth loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan he receives, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of palm oil to resell at a profit. In the coming years, he would like to buy a plot of land and to see his children educated.

loans.use: increase his capital and buy a large quantity of palm oil to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Juán Eduardo

texts.es: Juán Eduardo, tiene la edad  de 49 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes que le den un buen rendimiento tomando en cuenta las características del suelo que cuenta para hacer la siembra y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de frijol de buena calidad, además pagar mano de obra en la preparación del suelo para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de y en asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Juán Eduardo is 49 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children who are his main priorities. He plans to buy fertilizer with the loan which will give him a good harvest given the soil qualities that he has to seed and the other products to apply to the seeds.. Then he can germinate well with quality bean seed and pay for labor to prepare the earth and apply the products and help with the plantation after seeding. In this way he will ensure good crop management. He wants to take advantage of the good soils and climatic conditions that the zone has for this crop and take advantage of his several years experience growing basic grains.  Plus he can buy better and higher quality products so his plantation has a healthy and abundant development and in the short term produce a good harvest and good production. He plans to use the revenues from the harvest on the well-being and education of his family, fulfill some family goals and invest more in his crops. This is the first loan he has had from FUDECOSUR. He has not had loans from the State banks and FUDECOSUR has offered him this loan with better conditions and much lower rates of interest.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 45 years old. She is widowed and has been blessed with four children. She has been selling chicken for the past 20 years. She currently makes an estimated monthly income of 14,600 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

She would like a loan of 15,000 KES, through which she will buy more chicken for sale. Her future dream is to have an expanded business.

loans.use: to buy more chicken for selling

loans.name: Truc's Group

texts.en: Truc is 47 years old and lives with her children and her husband. Her husband works as a painter. For the past five years, Truc has been running a shop making and selling clothes to earn an income to support her family. She is the Group Leader of a 7-member loan group that live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is in the middle of the first row, wearing a striped blouse. Each of the other group members is requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. Truc is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality and greater variety of material and clothing to sell at her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy materials and clothes for selling at her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Jose Secundino

texts.es: José tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 5 años y 3 años de edad. José trabaja como cobrador de transporte colectivo y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar por lo que no recibe ingresos por su trabajo. José desea terminar las mejoras de su vivienda dado que necesita repellar las paredes antes de que el invierno llegue y las deteriore. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y pago de la mano de obra que le realizará la mejora para proteger su inmueble.
texts.en:
José is 25 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two children, aged 3 and 5. José works as a conductor on public transportation. This is how he earns his living and supports his household. His wife does the housework so she does not receive money for her labor.

José wants to complete the improvements on his house as he needs to plaster the walls before the winter arrives and deteriorates them. So he has requested a loan from FUSAI to buy cement and sand and pay for labor to carry out this work to protect his house.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand and to pay for labor to plaster the walls of his house.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a 37-year-old lady from Kisumu, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married and supports 3 people in her family. She has 3 children who are 11, 9 and 3 years old.

She has a security firm which she has been operating for the last 3 years and which has employed 15 guards. She is taking her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase uniforms for her security guards. Rhoda will use the anticipated income to plow back into the business.

Rhoda's dream is to expand her security firm to provide service within other regions.

loans.use: to purchase uniforms for her security guards.

loans.name: Geruncia

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Geruncia works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  Geruncia is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of medicines to sell.

Geruncia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of medicines to sell.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a 41-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as visionary and focused. She operates a photo studio where she does photography and camera sales. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area ideal for the business. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a camera and printers and to pay business premises rent. Her business goal is to have a large studio within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a camera and printers and pay business premises rent

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 32-year-old man. He has one child. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a grocery store where he sells fruits. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of customers. 

He will use the 40,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of fruits. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will live better. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen lives in Kapan city in Syunik region. She graduated Yerevan State Conservatory in the Theoretical faculty. Since 1983 until now she has worked at Kapan State College of Arts. Helen is not married, and she lives with her retired mother. She is a very talented, artistic person, and her pupils at the college love and respect her very much. 

Helen also has pupils whom she gives private courses at her house: piano lessons and history of arts. As she says, music helps her to see life as colorful and meaningful, and if she would choose her profession for the second time, she would surely again become musician.

She asks for this loan in an amount of 200,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer, which will help her to be aware of any innovation and news in the world of music.

loans.use: to buy a computer, which will help her to be aware of any innovation and news in the world of music

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her coffee crops for this season.

loans.name: Dushigikire Group

texts.fr:
Pascal fait partie du groupe Dushigikire  et  habite à  Bubanza. Il a 62 ans  et est marié  à Georgette, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants âgés de  4 à 13 ans  dont 6 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de  maïs    depuis  14  ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité  de maïs  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, il  voudrait  faire de l’agriculture et de l’élevage  et voir ses enfants étudier
texts.en: Pascal is part of the Dushigikire group and lives in Bubanza. He is 62 years old and is married to Georgette, a farmer. Together they have eight children between the ages of 4 and 13, six of whom are in school. He has sold corn for 14 years. He is on his second loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan that he obtains, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of corn to resell for a profit. In the coming years, he would like to farm and raise livestock and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of corn to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en: Jemimah is a 41 year old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from three to ten years. She describes herself as capable. She operates a retail business where she sells electronics and spare parts. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the 100,000 KES loan to buy more stock of electronics. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock. She hopes that she will have a bright future.

loans.use: buy more stock of electronics for her business

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a 43-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be efficient. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough resources. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to have a mini supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the future, her business will grow and she will improve her family living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 46 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

Mary Grace is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan of 22,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Mary Grace has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed eleven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Grace would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: Aileen is 41 years old and married and has three children, who are in school. Aileen is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Aileen has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Aileen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion is 38 years old and married; she has two children, who are in school. Salvacion is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Salvacion has been raising pigs for 15 years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Salvacion would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva lives in Kampala. She is married with five children, four of whom go to school.  She doesn’t have any additional family members. She sells second hand clothes. She operates her business from home and sells on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last two years. She works seven days a week.  She gets additional income from rental houses. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy more bales of second hand clothes. Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying for utility bills, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a lady of 59 years. She is a widow and a mother of three children. She owns rental houses in Huruma on the outskirts of Kiambu. She has been in this business for 20 years now and gets a monthly income of 60,000 shillings.

This will be Susan's third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the entire loan to renovate the rental houses. In the future, Susan wants to be a prosperous businesswoman.

loans.use: To renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be visionary and focused. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows, which produce milk for her to sell, and grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a productive and promising place and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more cows and animal feed. Her business goal is to be a successful dairy farmer within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will invest the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to buy more cows and animal feed

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 58 years old from Naivasha and is married. They have four children who are aged between 10 years and 18 years old.

Peter has a baking business that he has been running for many years and has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him buy flour, cooking fat and other ingredients.

Peter hopes to expand his business in the near future and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy flour, cooking fat, etc. for his business

loans.name: Aires

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Aires works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Aires is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase ingredients like chicken, hot dogs, meat, and seasonings for her food production business. 

Aires has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like chicken, hot dogs, meat, and seasonings for her food production business

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a mixed farmer; she lives in the Chuka area of eastern Kenya with her husband and three children, who are between the ages of 19 and 6 years. She has a half-acre plot of land, which she has been tilling for the past 15 years. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs, tea, mixed crops, and a retail business. In farming her biggest challenge is marketing her farm produce.

With this loan, Daisy says that she will purchase a dairy goat for more milk production. This will boost her income and enable her to pay school fees for her children and better their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy goat.

loans.name: Kalekye

texts.en:
Kalekye is 60 years old, married, and together with her spouse is blessed with 3 children.  She makes a monthly estimated income of 15,500 KES.  She would like to request a loan of 5,000 KES through which she will buy feed for her cattle.

Kalekye has been rearing cattle for the past 20 years.  She anticipates that through her profits, she will improve her family's standard of living.  In future she hopes to be a successful livestock farmer.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Corsine

texts.en:
Corsine is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Corsine is 32 years old and has three children who are in school.

Corsine has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Corsine requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Corsine has been in this business for seven years. Corsine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Gifurwe Group

texts.fr:
Férdinand  fait partie du groupe Gifurwe et  habite à  Bubanza. Il a 32 ans  et est marié  à  Pascasie, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de  1 à 9 ans  dont 1 étudie.

Il fait le commerce de l’huile de palme depuis  12 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d’huile de palme  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, il  voudrait  construire une maison   et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Férdinand is a member of Gifurwe Group and lives in Bubanza. He is 32 years old and is married to Pascasie, a shopkeeper. Together they have five children, ranging in age from 1 to 9 years old, one of whom attends school.

Férdinand has been selling palm oil for 12 years. He is on his second loan from Turame. With this Kiva loan, he will increase his capital and purchase a large amount of palm oil to sell in order to earn more.

In the future, Férdinand would like to build a house and see his children attend school.

loans.use: To increase his capital and purchase a large amount of palm oil to sell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
Marte has broken her arm while at work more than two times and she has been in excruciating pain for nearly three months now. She has had two surgical procedures so far and metal plates have been placed in her arm to connect the bones, yet to no avail. She is now scheduled for another procedure and hopes that this will be the final one.  For this she needs your compassion as she has spent so much money up until now and has no money left to pay for the upcoming procedure. The amount she is requesting is 250,000 ALL. She would very much appreciate your financial help.

Marte has been working as a cemetery worker in her town for a very long time and the photograph of her was taken there. She is a 56-year-old married mother of two children.

loans.use: to pay for a surgical procedure on her arm that has been broken more than twice

loans.name: Itabariro Group

texts.fr:
Béatrice  fait partie du groupe  Itabariro et  habite à  Cibitoke. Elle a 33 ans  et est mariée  à  Moshi. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de  5 à 7 ans  dont 1 étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de  haricot et du riz   depuis  4  ans. 

C’est son premier  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de riz et de haricot à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, elle  voudrait  construire une maison et faire le commerce des habits et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Béatrice is a member of Itabariro Group and lives in Cibitoke. She is 33 years old and is married to Moshi. Together they have three children, ranging in age from 5 to 7 years, one of whom attends school.

Béatrice has been selling beans and rice for four years. This is her first [loan] with Turame. With the Kiva loan she is receiving, she will increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of rice and beans to sell in order to earn more.

In the future, Béatrice would like to build a house, sell clothing, and see her children attend school.

loans.use: To increase her capital and to purchase a large quantity of rice and beans to sell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 32 years old. She is married and together with her husband she has been blessed with 3 children.She has been doing dairy farming for 5 years now.

She makes an estimated monthly income of 16,450 KES. She has successfully repaid all her previous loans. She would like a loan of 15,694 KES, with which she will use to pay for her children's school fees.  

She anticipates that she will pay for her loan with her business's profits and continue paying for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Ndatwa Group

texts.fr:
Athanase  fait partie du groupe Ndatwa  et  habite à  Cibitoke. Il a 51 ans  et est marié  à Chantal, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de  4 à 18 ans  dont 6 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge 2 enfants qui étudient.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (haricot, riz, sel,…)     depuis  20  ans. 

C’est son premier crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d’articles de sa boutique (haricot, riz, sel,…)  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, il  voudrait  faire le commerce de pagnes  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Athanase is a member of the Ndatwa group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 51 years old and married to Chantal, a farmer. They have seven children together, ranging from four to 18 years of age. Six of their children are in school. Athanase also has two other children in his care, both in school.
He has been selling grocery items (beans, rice, salt etc) for 20 years. This is his first loan with Turame. Thanks to  his Kiva loan, he will increase his capital and buy large quantities of groceries for his store (beans, rice, salt etc) so as to earn more revenue. In the years to come, he would like to start selling traditional "pagnes" cloth and ensure that his children can study.

loans.use: to stock up groceries to resell in his store and earn more revenue.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is a 57-year-old single woman from the village of Misaktsieli, Georgia.  She lives alone and is involved in agricultural activity.  Particularly, Manana cultivates a plot of agricultural land where maize is grown.  Seasonally she sells the harvested products at a local market. Her living condition falls in to the category of the subsistence poor because she has no source of income besides her seasonal harvest.  Therefore, she lives in poverty.   

Manana lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require a stable income and business experience.  The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled her to obtain a loan of 1,500 GEL and start dairy farming.  Manana will purchase a milk cow, produce milk products, and sell them locally.  This will give her a chance to have a more stable income and manage financial difficulties more effectively.  Manana will be really grateful for your help, for giving her the chance at a better life.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 34 years old. She is married, and together with her husband, they have been blessed with four children. She has been running her hotel [restaurant] for 11 years now. She currently makes an estimated monthly income of 28,600 Kenyan shillings. She would like a loan to buy utensils and stock, such as baking flour, salt and sugar.

Ruth anticipates paying for her children's school fees with her profits. Ruth hopes that in future she will have a stable home.

loans.use: to buy utensils and stock, such as baking flour, salt and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and farming tools

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en: Tereza lives in Kampala. She is married with six children, two of whom go to school.  She has two additional family members (grandchildren). She is a poultry farmer. She operates her business from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 21 years. She works seven days a week.  She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy chicks, poultry feed, vaccines, and feeding trays. Her business challenges include the changing prices of poultry feed and poultry diseases. Her goals and aspirations are to own 3,000 laying birds and to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more poultry feed, vaccines and feeding trays.

loans.name: Boezemwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme POGBI ANNE MARIE représente le groupe BOEZEMWENDE. S.CLARISSE se porte bien mais elle ne fait plus partie du groupe. Mariée, elle est mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 02semaines. 03 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend du sel  depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. 
Elle veut s’acheter 08sacs de sel de 25kg.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et mieux entretenir ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pogbi Anne Marie is representing Boezemwende Group. Mrs. S. Clarisse [the group's previous featured borrower] is doing well but is no longer a member of the group. Mrs. Pogbi Anne Marie is married and the mother of five children. The eldest is 14 years old and the youngest is two weeks old. Three [of the children] attend school.

Mrs. Pogbi Anne Marie has been selling salt for three years. She gets her supplies from the local market. She wants to purchase eight 25kg sacks of salt.

Mrs. Pogbi Anne Marie wants to reinvest her profits in her business. Her goal is to expand her business and better care for her children.

loans.use: To purchase eight 25kg sacks of salt.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a married woman. She has seven children with ages ranging between 8 and 32 years old. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes, peas, and cabbages. She has been involved in this business for 30 years. Her business is located in a productive place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to do large-scale farming within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a large scale farmer. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a single woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be strong and God fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells green maize. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are market shoppers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of green maize to sell. Her business goal is to very productive and expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of green maize to sell

loans.name: Nhom 01 Thôn 01 Quảng Đại Group

texts.en:
Nam works in agriculture, raising food. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. 

Nam is 30 years old and married with two children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the Nhom 01 Thôn 01 Quảng Dại solidarity group. 

In 2013, Nam joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nam has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nam has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Nam hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 59 years old and widowed with four children. With one child still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Felisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, biscuits, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, biscuits, etc. 

Felisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Gaudiosa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Gaudiosa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is a married woman with one child. She describes herself to be strong and determined. She operates a retail business where she sells green maize. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenges to be the harsh climate and high product prices. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of green maize to sell. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a big cereal shop. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her son.

loans.use: to buy more stock of green maize

loans.name: Jesús Daniel

texts.es: Jesús Daniel, tiene la edad  de 19 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres y sus hermanos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes que le den un buen rendimiento en el desarrollo del cultivo y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de frijol de buena calidad, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo en la conservación de suelos para evitar la erosión del suelo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Jesús Daniel, 19 years old, is single and lives with his parents and siblings who are his main priority. With his loan, he plans to buy fertilizer which gives him good results in developing his crops and other products to use in sowing his crops and germinating them well, and high quality bean seeds, as well as pay labor costs for applying the products and assistance on the farm once it has been developed. In this way, he would assure himself of doing a good job in conserving the soil to avoid soil erosion. What he wants to do is take advantage of the good climatic conditions and soil that are present in the area for this crop, and also to apply his experience in growing basic grains. In addition, he can buy better and higher quality products, so that his farm has a healthy and abundant harvest, and to have a good production in the short-term. With the income that he hopes to get from this harvest, he wants to use it for the well-being and education of his family and to accomplish some family goals and to continue investing more in his crops. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has never had any other loans in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: plant beans

loans.name: 05 Thôn 5 Quảng Đại Group

texts.en:
Sáu works in farming. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultrys to raise and sell in the future.

In 2013, Sáu joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) to improve her  business. Sáu has successfully repaid two loans from FPW. She is the leader of a six-member group, the 05 Thôn 5 Quảng Đại solidarity group. 

Sáu is 41 years old, and she is married with two children. With her business profit, Sáu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and to build a new house. She wants her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultrys to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Nueva Esperanza” conformada por 06 socios entusiastas y responsables. Juana  de 48 años de edad soltera. Ella cuenta con un centro educativo inicial. Con el anhelo de seguir ambientando nuevas aulas de estudio. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de carpetas de estudio, pinturas y lijas. El grupo  “Nueva Esperanza” está agradecido con las personas que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Juana es la segunda del lado derecho y viste polo rosado.
texts.en: This is the group "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) that has six enthusiastic and responsible members.  Juana, 48 years old, is single. She has a kindergarten, with the desire to continue decorating new classrooms. She asked for the loan to buy student desks, paintings, and sandpaper. The group "Nueva Esperanza" is thankful for the people who have made this loan possible, since it allows them to continue improving. Juana is the second from the right wearing a pink shirt.

loans.use: buy student desks, paintings, and sandpaper.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta 3º grado, esta casada y su esposo es jornalero, quienes tiene 5 hijos y 3 viven con ellos que estudian 8º, 5º y 2º grado; y con su pareja se encarga de la manutención de sus hijos.

 La señora tiene una venta de panadería desde hace 4 años y aprendió el oficio ya que su madre le enseño, el oficio lo hace en casa y la venta igualmente la hace en su vivienda, en ocasiones sale a vender en la comunidad. 

El crédito es para mejorar la vivienda ya que una pared de su casa se esta cayendo, puesto que es de adobe y esta casi expuesta al aire libre y con el invierno se puede caer, comprara cemento, mayas, arena y pago de mano de obra. 

Planea que su negocio poco a poco vaya creciendo y tener un local cerca de su casa donde pueda tener mayor espacio para realizar el oficio y que sus hijos terminen de estudiar.
texts.en:
Martha is 39 years old, she studied until the third grade, she is married and her husband is a day labourer. They have five children, three of which live with them and study in 8th, 5th and 2nd grades. Alongside her partner she undertakes the support of her children.

She has had a bakery for 4 years and her mother taught her how to do this work. She bakes in her house and also sells from home. On occasion she goes out and sells in the community.

The loan is to improve her home. One of the walls of her house is falling down, as it is made of adobe and is exposed to the elements and in winter can fall down. She will buy cement, wire mesh, sand and pay for the labour. 

She plans for her business to grow little by little and to have a shop close to her home where she can have more space to carry out her work, and for her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy cement, wire mesh, sand and pay for labour in order to improve her home, as a wall of her house is falling down.

loans.name: Ederson Rolando

texts.es: Ederson un joven de 19 años que estudia, actualmente cursa el 3to ciclo de la carrera de Refrigeración. Decidió estudiar dicha carrera pues siempre pensó en emprender su propio negocio y por ser de mayor demanda. Actualmente apoya a sus padres lo que le  permite cubrir parte de sus estudios. Agradece a sus padres por el apoyo moral y económico que siempre le brindaron. Ser un profesional competitivo es su mayor anhelo. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para el pago de su matrícula y pensión de estudios. Ederson agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por apoyar a jóvenes como el que buscan  superarse cada día.
texts.en: Ederson is a young man aged 19 who is currently studying for the third term of a Refrigeration course. He decided to take this course because he always wanted to set up his own business and because it is more in demand. Currently he is supporting his parents, which means he can only pay for part of his education. He is grateful to his parents for the moral and economic support they have always given him. His greatest wish is to become a competitive professional. He will use the requested loan to pay for his enrollment and tuition. Ederson is grateful to Kiva lenders for supporting young people like him who daily look to improve themselves.

loans.use: to pay enrollment and tuition

loans.name: Ada Litza

texts.es:
La Sra. Ada es una persona  muy  emprendedora vive con sus hijas en una comunidad al sur de Honduras.
Su negocio es una  pulpería desde hace más de 15  años. El préstamo Ada lo necesita para la compra  de churros,  refrescos,  pan, café,  azúcar, maíz,  frijoles, etc. Con el crédito  ella espera  el aumento de sus ventas debido a que contara con más capital fresco y  que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan,  y así cubrir sus necesidades, así mismo espera que mejore su situación económica en el hogar y que se ve reflejada con esta inversión.
En unos años Ada espera con que su negocio  este posicionado como el más grande y  conocido de la zona, y poder seguir apoyando a  su familia  a que se convierta en personas de bien  para la sociedad y con mejores oportunidades.

Choluteca, Honduras –  Abril  del 2014
texts.en:
Señora Ada is a very resourceful person who lives with her daughters in a community in southern Honduras. She has run a grocery store for over 15 years. 

Señora Ada is applying for a loan to purchase doughnuts, soft drinks, bread, coffee, sugar, corn, beans, and other goods. She expects that increasing her working capital will allow her to offer her customers a greater variety of goods and thus increase sales. More income will help Señora Ada improve her family's financial situation. 

Señora Ada is hopeful that within a few years her store will be the largest and best-known in the area. She also hopes that she'll be able to continue supporting her family and help her children become upstanding citizens with greater opportunities than she has had. 

Choluteca, Honduras –  April 2014

loans.use: to purchase doughnuts, soft drinks, bread, coffee, sugar, corn, beans, and other goods for her business.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is single and has  operated a candle making business in the Philippines for 10 years now.  She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like wax and cord for her business.

In the future, Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wax and cord for her business.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel Antonio, tiene la edad  de 56 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de frijol de buena calidad, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio is 56  years old, married and lives with his wife and children who are his highest priority. With his loan, he plans to buy fertilizers and other products to apply when he sows seeds - in order to achieve good germination - and to buy good quality bean seeds. He will also pay labourers to apply the products and to help with planting once the seeds have developed, thus ensuring that the job is done well. 

He aims to take advantage of the good climate and soil conditions that the zone offers for this crop, and also put into practice several years of experience in handling basic grains. He will also be able to buy the best products of the best quality so that his planting develops well and is healthy as well as providing a sufficient harvest and quickly giving significant production.

He wants to use the income from the expected harvest on his family's welfare and studies, on meeting some family goals and to continue investing more in crops. It is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered the loan with better facilities and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to sow bean seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant chili peppers

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
La Sra.  Ana Julia  una persona emprendedora  honesta  y seria, vive con su esposo y sus  hijos  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y venta  de  ganado.
Doña Ana el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de ganado.  Con el préstamo ella espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más  animales  que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos, con esto mejorar la situación  económica  de su  familia.
Doña Ana  espera que  en unos 3 años  su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la zona, así seguir  apoyando a su familia, y que sus nietos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas honesta  y con principios y valores.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Abril   del   2014
texts.en:
Doña Ana Julia is a resourceful, trustworthy, and earnest person. She lives with her husband and children in southern Honduras, and runs a business buying and selling livestock. 

Doña Ana is applying for a loan to purchase livestock. She expects that her sales will increase when she has more animals to offer her customers and can care for a larger herd. Higher  livestock sales will improve her family's finances. 

Doña Ana is hopeful that her business will continue to expand and grow stronger over the next three years to the point that she'll be the largest and best-known livestock seller in the area. She hopes that she'll be able to continue supporting her family and that her grandchildren will complete their education and grow up to be honest, principled people who have strong values. 
 
Choluteca, Honduras –  April 2014

loans.use: to purchase livestock for her business.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a mixed farmer living in the rich highlands of Litein, where there is always a lot of rain hence more production. She is married and has two children of school-going age. She has been farming for the past 15 years. She produces and sells milk, eggs and horticultural crops. In farming, her biggest challenge is lack of enough funds for her farming projects.

Juliana says that this loan will help her to construct a greenhouse, which will enable her to plant more horticultural crops. This will yield more income for her and thus enable her to do other farming projects and educate her children better. It will also improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata is a 52-year-old married woman with 3 children.  She describes herself as experienced, and for 5 years she has operated a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, salt, and other items.  Her business is located in a conducive location and her primary customers are local residents.  Consolata describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough personnel in the shop.  She will use the 90,000 KES loan to buy a motorcycle. Her business goal is to venture in to a transport business within 5 years.  She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.  She hopes that her future will be bright.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Zhanylbubu

texts.ru: Жанылбубу 49 лет, замужем, мать 6 детей школьного возраста. У Жанылбубу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, начав свою деятельность в 1993 году. Благодаря целеустремленности, упорству и трудолюбию Жанылбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 50 овец, 6 коз и 4 кобылы. Все условия для содержания скота имеются, корма и сено заготовлены. Жанылбубу продает молочные продукты, такие как: топленое масло, курут, кефир, также продает мясо и скот. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жанылбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота, также для увеличения ежемесячного дохода от продажи молочных продуктов. Доходы от кредита Жанылбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на обучение детей в университете.
texts.en: Zhanylbubu is 49 years old, married, and a mother to six children who are elementary-school aged. Zhanylbubu has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she practices animal breeding. She started this business in 1993. Thanks to Zhanylbubu's determination, perseverance and hard work, she currently has 3 milk cows, 50 sheep, 6 goats and 4 mares on her farm. She has all of the necessary conditions for housing cattle. The feed and hay has already been gathered. Zhanylbubu sells dairy products such as cooking butter, cheese balls, and kefir. She also sells meat and cattle. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further development of her business, Zhanylbubu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the size of her herd as well as to increase her monthly income from the sale of dairy products. Zhanylbubu plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her children's university educations.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Girselda Esmeralda

texts.es:
Griselda de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, esta casada y su esposo es motorista de camiones. Tienen 3 hijos que viven con ellos y estudian 1º año de bachillerato y 8º grado y el otro trabaja, nadie más vive con ellos. Desde hace 12 años desempeña la labor de cocinera en la escuela de la comunidad; además tiene una venta de bisutería en casa, y en los tiempos libres sale a vender a las zonas cercanas de la comunidad y el horario es de 7.00 am a 4.30 pm. 

El crédito es para mejorar su vivienda, ya que quiere construir una habitación y va a comprar específicamente bloques y cemento, al construir la habitación a sus hijos tendrán mejor privacidad y espacio propio.

 El sueño principal es que sus hijos sean profesionales y además en un futuro seguir construyendo su vivienda para estar más cómodos.
texts.en:
Griselda is 39 years old and has a secondary school education. She is married and her husband is a truck driver. They have three children who live with them; one is in the first year of secondary school, one is in eighth grade, and the other works. No one else lives with them. 

For twelve years, she has worked as a cook in the community school. In addition, she sells costume jewelry from her home; in her free time, she goes out to sell in nearby zones of the community. Her schedule is from 7:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

The loan is to improve her residence; she wants to build a bedroom. Specifically, she wants to buy concrete blocks and cement. When she builds her children a bedroom, they will have better privacy and their own space.
