Her main dream is for her children to be professionals; also, in the future, she would like to to continue the construction of her house in order to be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy concrete blocks and cement to construct a bedroom for her children

loans.name: Lourdes Rossana

texts.es:
Lourdes tiene 31 años, vive en el distrito de pueblo nuevo, y cada día se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante, ya que es madre de 3 hijos de 11, 5 y 2 años; a quienes quiere muchísimo y por los cuales daría la vida, ya que son lo más importante para ella. Lourdes trabaja en su pequeño negocio de fabricación y venta de esteras, con lo cual puede tener un ingreso para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Lourdes esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar carrizo, el cual es un material que se utiliza para la confección de esteras y de esta manera poder mejorar su negocio y seguir esforzándose para trabajar en busca de hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Hacer crecer su negocio y darle una profesión a aus hijos”.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 31 years old and lives in the Pueblo Nuevo district. She is a mother of 3 children, aged 2, 5 and 11 years old whom she loves a lot and would give her life for. They are of up-most importance to her. She tries every day to get ahead. Lourdes works in her small business of making and selling mats from which she generates an income to pay her household expenses.

Lourdes is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to their support she can buy reeds which is a material she uses in the fabrication of mats. By doing this she can improve her business and continue to work on achieving her big dream which is to grow her business and educate her children to become professionals.





Lourdes esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar carrizo, el cual es un material que se utiliza para la confección de esteras y de esta manera poder mejorar su negocio y seguir esforzándose para trabajar en busca de hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Hacer crecer su negocio y darle una profesión a aus hijos”.

loans.use: to buy reeds.

loans.name: Djamadjigui Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Djamadjigui vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Missira l’un des quartiers de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier de Missira. Elles font le petit commerce, de condiment, de restauration et de fruit et légume. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Fatoumata (2éme  femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiment dans le quartier de Missira. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité suffisante de condiment avec les grossistes de Ségou  pour la satisfaction de la demande clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte dans le marché  et à la maison.
 Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 27 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour prendre en charge une partie de la famille et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four members of the group Djamadjigui are women who live in nuclear families. They average 45 years of age and five children each, and they all live in the district of Missira, in the city of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another as neighbors, through ties of marriage and kinship, and from the income-generating activities that they conduct in Missira such as the sale of condiments, fruits and vegetables, as well as restaurant services.  

To strengthen their working capital, the group joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance program, with which they have started their 2nd group loan cycle. 

Fatoumata (standing 2nd from the left) is a leading seller of condiments in Missira. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of condiments from Ségou wholesalers, which will help her to meet customer demand. She sells from her home and at the market for cash, although often on credit, to a mixed clientele.  

Fatoumata expects to earn an average monthly profit of 27,000 FCFA, which she will use to support a portion of her family’s needs and to bolster her capital.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Anavita

texts.es: Anavita, tiene la edad  de 52 años, está casada, vive con su esposo  que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Anavita is 52 years old, she is married and lives with her husband who is her main priority. 

With her loan she wants to buy fertilisers, fungicides and pay labour costs to care for coffee crops, as well as buy some coffee seedlings for reseeding at the beginning of the rains. The aim of this is to increase the density of plants, as well as take advantage of the good fertility of the ground and the climatic and other conditions which favour coffee cultivation. 

With these crop improvements she hopes to make a small profit and thus improve the living conditions of her family, invest a little more in the cultivated area and also achieve some of her goals.

It is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans before from state owned banks, but
FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: care for coffee crops.

loans.name: Aminta

texts.es:
Aminta de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta 2º grado, esta casada y su esposo es agricultor. Tienen 3 hijos y todos viven con la mamá de Aminta, por motivos de que la escuela donde estudian queda cerca y van a 8º y 5º grado y el otro hijo trabaja. 

Desde hace 3 años Aminta tiene una venta de pupusas y lo hace 2 veces a la semana, además tiene una venta de frutas y verduras que con su esposo se va a vender con el carro a las comunidades. 

El crédito lo solicita para invertirlo en los dos negocios; en la venta de pupusas quiere comprar mesas y sillas para que los clientes se sientan cómodos y comprar al por mayor frutas y verduras de toda clase. Uno de sus sueños es que sus hijos terminen el bachillerato por lo menos, y para el negocio que siga creciendo y con las ganancias desea poner un local en el mercado.
texts.en:
Aminta is 40 years old and has a second grade education. She is married and her husband is a farmer. They have three children, and they all live with Aminta's mom because the school that they attend is nearby. They are in eighth and fifth grade, and their other son works.

For three years, Aminta has had a business selling pupusa [thick corn tortillas stuffed with meat, cheese and beans]. She does this twice a week. In addition, she has a fruit and vegetable business; she and her husband go to communities to sell from their car.

She is requesting the loan to invest in both businesses. For her pupusa sales, she wants to buy tables and chairs so that her customers feel comfortable. She also wants to buy all kinds of fruits and vegetables at wholesale.

One of her dreams is for her children to finish secondary school at the least, and for her business to continue growing. With the profits, she would like to set up a stand in the market.

loans.use: to invest in her two businesses. For her pupusa sales, she wants to buy tables and chairs so that her customers feel comfortable. She also wants to buy all kinds of fruits and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Shahnoza is 30 years old. She is married and is bringing up three children. Her children are little. Her husband is a dentist. Shahnoza lives with her husband and children in a house of her husband’s parents. 

Shahnoza is an entrepreneur. She provides services to local people to sew their clothes. Shahnoza has been busy with this business for more than six years. She sews national style and also European style clothes. Shahnoza developed her business little by little. At first, it was so difficult for her to develop because her children were little and she looked after them. Now, she has a good opportunity to develop her business. She works hard now. 

She is going to repair her house, as her house is old and needs repairing. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy building materials, such as cement, wood, paint, etc., for repairing the house. She hopes this loan will make her living condition better.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as cement, wood, paint, etc., for repairing her house.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Kampala. She is married with four children, two of whom go to school.  She takes care of two additional family members (brother and sister). 

She sells charcoal on a retail basis from the market. She has been in business for the last twenty years. Jane works seven days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses. 

She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy bags of charcoal. 

Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to get more capital so as to serve more customers. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen used the loan money he received well, as he was able to buy buckets, basins, jugs, etc. as he had planned. He is now taking another loan to enable him to boost his other business, which is selling boiled eggs to his customers. He hopes to be an egg distributor in the near future.

loans.use: To boost his other business of selling boiled eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat flour.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 58 years old and from the Engineer area in Nyandarua South. He is married. They have four children who are aged between 21 years and 11 years old. His spouse is a farmer.

James is a farmer, and has applied for his fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use on his farm.

He hopes to get a big loan to boost his business and family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela, a 42-year-old married mother of five, describes herself to be determined. For three years she has been operating a retail business selling clothes.  Her enterprise is located in a vibrant location, and her primary customers are from many walks of life. Her biggest challenge is a lack of capital. 

Pamela will use this Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes to sell. This will be her third loan with SMEP DTM; her previous two have been fully repaid. 

Pamela's business goal is to own a big shop within five years. She also hopes that in the future, she will further her education.

loans.use: buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Percy Veranda

texts.en:
Percy Veranda, a 63-year-old married mother of five, is a very hard working entrepreneur. For 31 years now, she has operated a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Percy Veranda has requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a 27-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as patient. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes, and has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a vibrant place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. 

She will use this 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a permanent house. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTML. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Mazen Group

texts.en:
This group is called Mazen. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB.

Anisa is the group's leader. She is a 30-year-old married woman with three children. She lives with her family in their own house. Her husband works as a builder. He earns good profits from this business but most of what he earns goes to the expenses of the family. 

Their home lacks many home appliances, such as a refrigerator and other appliances. She decided to help her husband improve the living standards of the family. As a result, she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a refrigerator for the house to keep water cold.

Anisa looks forward to opening a savings account in AMB. She hopes to purchase all home appliances for the house in order to make her house more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for the house to keep water cold.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 59 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

She has borrowed and paid off 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 6 years and also earns an income from sewing. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is 40 years old and lives with her children in the village of Siznak in the Syunik region. Gohar for some time worked at the Kapan factory as a worker, but since 2011, she has had her small business of clothes trading at her house. 

Gohar is divorced, and she just works night and day to provide for her two children. Her daughter is 20 years old, and she gives hairdressing services at their house, and her son is still in school.   

Gohar has a little farm, where she breeds 5 cows, 2 calves and a bull. She sells a great amount of milk and macun (Armenian national dairy product). Her farm brings rather good income, which solves the major part of their financial problems, so Gohar has serious intentions to develop it.

She needs this loan in the amount of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy hay and fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy hay and fodder for her farm cattle in order to develop her farm.

loans.name: Carmen Dario

texts.es:
El joven Carmen  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive   con sus 2 hijos y esposa  en el  sur de Honduras.
Su negocio es la  venta  de gasolina desde hace más de 2 años.
Carmen el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  (gasolina) Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes.
El joven Carmen  espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de  los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona, y  seguir  apoyando que sus padres e hijos   ya  que  son de  escasos recurso  económicos. 	

Choluteca, Honduras  –  Abril   del   2014
texts.en:
The young Carmen is a responsible, hard-working and honest person. He lives with his 2 children and wife in the south of Honduras. For the last 2 years, his business has been selling gasoline.

Carmen needs the loan to purchase more gasoline. With this loan he hopes that sales at his business will increase, once he has more product to offer, and he hopes to attend to his customers better.

The young Carmen hopes to cover his necessities and improve his quality of life and that of his family a little. Over the next few years, he wants his business to continue growing, becoming one of the largest and most recognized businesses in his zone. Carmen intends to continue helping his parents and children, since they have scarce economic resources.

Choluteca, Honduras -- April 2014

loans.use: to buy gasoline and diesel for his business.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
From Cameroon, Solange is a 38-year-old divorced mother of five children; the oldest, 12, is in secondary school, while the youngest, four, is in primary school. 

Solange has been selling clothes for over three years, which makes her very experienced and her business stable. Her enterprise is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. 

This loan to purchase more clothing will increase her turnover by 12 percent and her profit by 29 percent.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 33-year-old married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells drinks, beauty products, bread, water and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more bread, sugar, drinks and other items she sells. She hopes that in the future, she will build a permanent house. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid off successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more bread, sugar, drinks and other items she sells.

loans.name: Suela

texts.en:
30-year-old Suela is shown in the photograph with her 20-year-old sister, Ermira (wearing scarf), who needs two immediate surgeries; one for her eyes and one for her nose. The problem with her vision has been getting worse and doctors have recommended that she have a procedure as soon as possible.  

They both work in a fish factory in their village, but the pay is not enough to cover such expenses all at once. They live with their father, who has a pension income that is approximately $40/month. 

Their village has a mild climate supporting almost all types of veggies and citrus, olive groves and also apples. Residents of this village are all from the same faith (Catholic) and have been such for generations, unlike most of the villages in Albania whose residents come from two or more faiths, especially during the recent years after the collapse of the regime.

loans.use: to cover her sister's eye and nose surgery.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 21 years old, from Nyandarua South, and is married. They have one child who is one year old. Cecilia has a farming business that she has been running for the past three years. She has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to buy fertilizers and seedlings. She hopes to improve her business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en:
Lusia is 48 years old and married. Together with her spouse they have been blessed with seven children. She is a farmer in Kangundo town where she plants cash crops such as maize and beans to sell. Her husband also provides additional income. Lusia also supports four people in her family. 

Lusia will be using the loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds for planting. This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she has paid back her previous loans successfully.

Her future hope is to become a large scale farmer and see all her children get a good education.

loans.use: To boost her farming by buying fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Gulhayo

texts.en:
Gulhayo is one of the best sewers in her region. She is 22 years old, not married and lives with her parents. Five years ago, Gulhayo began her business sewing women's clothes. She serves clients in her house where she has a workshop. Thanks to her good service, Gulhayo has regular clients. She also has some pupils whom she teaches sewing. 

Now, Gulhayo plans to repair her workshop as it is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc. for repairing her workshop. She hopes this loan will help her to make better the condition of her workshop. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc. for repairing her workshop.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a single man of 33 years. He runs a food stall in Banana on the outskirts of Kiambu. He has been in this business for four years now and gets a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

This will be Paul's first loan with VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the entire loan amount to buy stock like cooking oil, rice, tomatoes, potatoes, etc. for his business. In the future, he wants to be a successful businessman. He also desires to meet his family's needs without much stress.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, tomatoes, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 59 years old, comes from Nyandarua South and is married. Together they have three children who are aged between five and 18 years. Nancy is a farmer and has been in this business for the past twenty years. Nancy has applied for her third loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy seedlings and fertilizers. She hopes to expand her farming business and boost her earnings.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetable stock, and pay school fees

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old. She is married and together they have been given 3 children. She currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 113,000 by selling secondhand clothes. She has been running her business for 4 years now.

She would like a loan of KES 54,000 which she will use to buy more secondhand clothes to sell to customers in her area.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be business oriented. He operates a barber shop where he cuts hair. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are males. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy a hair cutting machine. His business goal is to open another barber shop within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: buy a hair cutting machine.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 49-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be visionary and productive. She operates a farm where she grows tea and maize. She has been involved in this business for 16 years. Her business is located in a fertile and productive place. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be low prices. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for farm labor. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for farm labor.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is a 25-year-old married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be visionary and focused. He operates a welding business where he makes metallic gates and other items.. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an area ideal for the business and his primary customers are individuals and schools. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy welding materials and also pay rent. His business goal is to be a successful businessman within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. He will use the anticipated profits to meet family needs and to invest.

loans.use: to buy welding materials and also pay rent.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a Kiva borrower. She has six children, and describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she cooks potato chips for sale. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a populated place and her primary customers are frequent. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

She will use this 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of potatoes. She hopes that in the future she will have a good lifestyle.

loans.use: buy more stock of potatoes.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Clarita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling personal collection products. Clarita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers 

Clarita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Benia

texts.en:
Benia lives in a rural area. He is 50 years old and married with 6 children. He has started buying manure for his coffee plantation to increase his yields and earn income. He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to help him buy manure for his plantation to better his yields and increase his income. 

His challenge is that none of children has a job which still makes them dependents, therefore increasing his expenses since he still provides their basic needs. He hopes to see all his children work and construct him a better house. He thanks UGAFODE for the support.

loans.use: To buy organic manure.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en: Hanifa was born in 1954. She is widowed. Her husband died in 1993. Her family's living condition was poor. She decided to start a business and to find a source of income. Hanifa began her business selling shoes. She has sold men's and women's shoes for more than 21 years and has great experience. She sells goods in a local market where she has a selling place. Hanifa every season renews the assortment of her goods. She is asking for a loan of 2000 TJS to buy men's and women's shoes for the new season. She is a repeat client of IMON and Kiva. She thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's shoes for the new season

loans.name: Latevi

texts.fr: Latévi âgé de 39ans est revendeur de profession. Il a pour femme une revendeuse et père de 02 enfants. En 1993, il a démarré comme activité la vente de radio auto, caméra et autres sous un hangar. N’arrivant plus à satisfaire les clients à cause du manque de marchandises, il fait une demande à WAGES pour acheter des radio auto, caméra et autres. Il espère épargner  pour avoir d’autres points de vente et fonder une famille financièrement stable.
texts.en:
Latévi, who is 39, is a retailer by trade. His wife is also a retailer; they have two children.

In 1993, he started a business selling car radios, cameras, and other items, from a shed. As he can no longer meet demand because he does not have enough merchandise, he is requesting help from WAGES to purchase car radios, cameras, and other items.

He is hoping to save enough to open other locations and start a financially-stable family.

loans.use: to buy car radios, cameras, and more.

loans.name: Aouh

texts.fr: Aouh est une femme de 45ans. Il a  pour mari un carreaulleur  et mère d’un enfant de 21ans qui va à l’école. Afin d’aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle a démarré la vente des chaussures et des liqueurs. Elle s’approvisionne généralement au Grand marché de Lomé. Pour pouvoir agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille, elle fait son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Le profit réalisé lui servira d’atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en:
Aouh is a 45-year-old woman. Her husband installs tile, and she has a 21-year-old child who goes to school.

To help her spouse with household expenses, she started selling shoes and liqueurs. She usually gets her supplies from the Great Market in Lomé. To grow her business and improve her family’s living conditions, she is getting her first loan from Wages. She will use it to buy merchandise. Profits will be used to reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy shoes and liqueurs.

loans.name: Djatougbé

texts.fr: Djatougbé vit avec son mari et leurs enfants à Lomé. Âgée de 49ans, elle revend des condiments(tomates, piments...) à domicile. Pour satisfaire ses clients, elle fait sa demande à WAGES. Le profit lui permettra d'acheter plus de marchandises et d'améliorer les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Djatougbé lives with her husband and children in Lomé. She is 49 years old. She sells condiments (tomatoes, peppers, etc.) out of her home. To meet customer demand, she is applying for a loan from WAGES.

Profits will allow her to buy more merchandise and better provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a man of 31 years. He is married to Ruth and a father of one child. He is a mechanic and has been in this business for four years now. He earns  a monthly income of 7,000 shillings.

This will be Eric's first loan with VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the entire loan to buy new machines for his business. He wants to be a successful businessman in the future in order to provide his family's needs in a sustainable way.

loans.use: To purchase machines for the garage

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells sweets, paper bags and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sweets, paper bags and other items. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a good life. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sweets, paper bags and other items

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows which produce milk to sell. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. 

He describes his biggest business challenges to be the lack of animal feeds during the dry season and the lack of finances to buy them. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of animal feeds. His business goal is to have a good and productive breed of cows within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of animal feeds.

loans.name: Jactone

texts.en:
Jactone is a 30 year old married man with 2 children.  He describes himself as focused.  He has operated a retail business selling building stones for 5 years.  His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more building stones for resale.  His business goal is to expand within 5 years and he hopes that in the future, he will have a good life.  He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more building stones for resale.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is 30 years old and he lives in Stepanavan city in the Lori region. He is a contractual serviceman with the frontier troops and he is also the father of two nice school-aged children. His work is a shift job, and the days he is free to be with his wife he is engaged in farming. On his farm he has 2 cows, 2 bulls and a calf.  

Since he is the only breadwinner in his family, he tries his best to develop his farm and make it richer with cattle, but these are still just plans since he lacks the money to realize them.  Now his family has another urgent and more important problem to solve than the farm enlargement. Arman’s wife feels very weak and unhealthy and the doctor instructed her to be urgently operated upon.

This loan is greatly needed by Arman as soon as it is possible, in order to pay for his wife’s operation. He thanks all lenders beforehand and wishes all of them to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to pay for his wife’s operation.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri lives with her husband and 8-year-old daughter in the town of Sisian, Armenia.  Her husband drives a taxi using his own car. The family's only income comes from taxi driving so it is very important for them.

Meri requested this loan to be able to repair the car and purchase 4 new tires.  The car is really damaged and needs to be repaired so Meri's husband will  be able to continue taxi driving.  She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International.  The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to repair the car and purchase 4 tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap and salt to sell.

loans.name: Nora Leonor

texts.en:
Nora Leonor is 39 years old and married with one child who is in school. Nora Leonor works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nora Leonor has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Djekafo vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Missira l’un des quartiers de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier de Missira. Elles font le petit commerce de condiment et  de restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  5éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Hawa (2éme  femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse condiment de tout genre le quartier de Missira et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité suffisante de condiment de tout genre chez les grossistes dans les marchés de Ségou et à Bamako  pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte dans le marché et à la maison.
 Madame Hawa espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  40 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour aider son mari et augmenter son fonds de commerce. Elle espère continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four members of the Djekafo group are women living in nuclear families. On the average, they are 45 years old, with three children. They all live in  Missira, a neighborhood in the town of Segou (the fourth administrative district of Mali).
They know each other as neighbors, relatives by blood or marriage, or through their work in Missira. They work as vendors selling condiments and cooked dishes. With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group members have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fifth solidarity loan cycle.

Mrs. Hawa (the second one standing from left to right in the photo) is a well-known vendor of condiments of various kinds in her neighborhood and nearby areas. She plans to user her loan to stock up on various condiments from wholesalers at the markets if Segou and Bamako, in order to meet customer demand. She sells for cash and often on credit, to a mixed clientele, at the marketplace as well as out of her home.
With this loan, Mrs. Hawa plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 40,000 West African francs, which will be used to help her husband and increase her working capital. She hopes to continue collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Las Pioneras Group

texts.es: Jacinta es integrante del grupo “Las Pioneras” conformada por 06  mujeres responsables, la gran mayoría de ellas vecinas de la zona. Jacinta se dedica a la venta de jugo de naranja, como actividad segundaria vende comidas por las tardes. Se siente feliz pues gracias a su esfuerzo puede seguir apoyando a su familia. A futuro le gustaría poner una tienda de abarrotes. El crédito solicitado lo destinará para la compra de naranjas. Jacinta tiene  52 años de edad casada con 01 hijo dependiente. El grupo “Las Pioneras” agradece el crédito brindado. Jacinta se encuentra sentada es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo azul.
texts.en: Jacinta is 52, married, and has one dependent son. In the photo she is the one seated first on the right wearing a blue polo shirt. She is a member of Las Pioneras group, which is made up of 6 responsible women, the majority of whom are local to the area. She work selling orange juice and, as a secondary activity, she sells food in the evenings . She is happy because, thanks to her efforts, she can continue to support her family. In the future she would like to set up a grocery store. She will use the requested loan to buy oranges. Las Pioneras group is grateful for the loans that are provided.

loans.use: to buy oranges.

loans.name: Confotte

texts.fr: Confotte est une femme au foyer âgée de 46ans. Mariée à un médecin, elle a 03 enfants en charge. Deux d’entre eux sont scolarisés. Elle  revend des céréales à domicile et s’approvisionne à Lomé et ses environs. Le second crédit demandé à WAGES lui permettra d’acheter des céréales afin de satisfaire ses clients. A l’avenir, elle souhaite faire le commerce de mercerie et assurer l’éducation de la famille.
texts.en:
Confotte is a 46-year-old housewife. She is married to a doctor and has three children under her supervision - two of whom go to school. 

She sells cereals out of her home and buys her supplies in and around Lomé. This second loan from WAGES will allow her buy cereals in order to satisfy her clients. 

In the future, she hopes to have a dry goods store and to secure her family's education.

loans.use: buy bags of cereals.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Jeune femme, Dédé pour subvenir à ses besoins  revend des produits de beauté  de façon ambulante.  Elle est à son second crédit et cet argent l’aidera à acheter des produits de beauté pour revendre aux clients. Elle souhaite développer son activité et fonder une famille à l’avenir. Dédé a démarré en 2011.
texts.en:
Dédé is a young woman who resell cosmetics door-to-door to provide for herself. This is her second loan; this money will help her purchase cosmetics to retail.

In the future, she hopes to grow her business and start a family. She got her professional start in 2011.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Héfumé

texts.fr: Femme de 49ans, madame Héfumé est mère de 02 enfants dont 01 scolarisé. Pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, elle a démarré en 2009 la vente des produits d'alimentation générale. Confrontée par moment à la concurrence, elle sollicite un troisième crédit à WAGES pour s'approvisionner en marchandises. Madame Héfumé espère agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Madame Héfumé is 49 years old and the mother of two children (one of whom goes to school). 

She started selling general food products in 2009 in order to meet the needs of her family. She is dealing with competition right now, and is asking for a third loan from WAGES in order to buy her supplies. 

Madame Héfumé hopes to grow her business and improve her family's life conditions.

loans.use: to buy general food products for her store.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Revendeuse d’ustensiles de cuisine et de pagnes à domicile, Julienne a un enfant âgé de 30ans qui ne va plus à l’école. Elle est âgée de 47ans. Elle fait son troisième crédit à WAGES pour acheter des ustensiles de cuisine et des pagnes afin de revendre aux clients et tirer de bénéfice. Ses achats se font au Grand marché et au Port autonome de Lomé. Avec les profits qu’elle va tirer de ses ventes, elle veut améliorer la taille de son activité et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Julienne retails kitchen utensils and “pagne” cloth from her house. She has a thirty-year-old child who no longer goes to school. She is 47 years old.

This is her third loan from WAGES. She will purchase kitchen utensils and “pagne” cloth to retail and generate revenues. She purchases from the Great Market and at the Autonomous Port of Lome.

With profits from her sales, she wants to improve her business size and take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils and 'pagne' cloth to sell

loans.name: Urunani Group

texts.fr:
Suavis fait partie du groupe Urunani  et  habite à  Cibitoke. Elle a 35 ans  et est mariée  à Edmond, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants  dont 3 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de bière de banane    depuis  10  ans. 

Elle  est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes pour préparer de la bière de banane   à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, elle  voudrait  faire de l’agriculture et de l’élevage  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Suavis belongs to group Urunani and lives in Cibitoke. She is 35 years old and married to Edmond, a farmer. Together, they have six children; three are in school.

She has been selling banana beer for ten years.

This is her fifth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan, she will increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of bananas with which to prepare banana beer. She will resell it and increase her earnings.

In the coming years, she would like to farm, raise cattle, and see her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of bananas to make banana beer.

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en: Proscovia is a 33-year-old, married lady with two children, one of whom goes to school. She deals in a produce business seven days a week and eleven hours a day, located in the market. Proscovia hopes to expand her business into new markets, though she is disturbed by competition and high license fees. Proscovia is a hardworking woman who is asking for a loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en: Phiona is a 30-year-old, married woman with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling clothes for five years located in the market, working four days a week and eight hours a day. Phiona hopes to provide better services to her customers, however, lack of enough capital is challenge she faces. Phiona is a hardworking and honest woman who intends to use the loan to buy clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a Kiva borrower. She has four children with ages ranging from 5 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells poultry. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a populated area, and her primary customers are frequent customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stocks of poultry. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of poultry.

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.en: Sylvie is a Cameroonian divorced woman, with a 5 year-old child in primary school. She has been in this business for over 15 years, which makes her very experienced, and her business profitable. Her business is likely to succeed, because it located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be use to increase her turnover from four hundred and fifty thousand to five hundred and fifty thousand FCFA.

loans.use: to buy communication credit and other small items like biscuits, candies, bonbons, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 52 years old and married with one child, who is in school. Carmencita works very hard to provide for them.

Carmencita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, snack foods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Carmencita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a widow with two children, one of whom goes to school. Mary has a retail business located in the rural area and does farming for additional income. Mary is in need of money to buy millet flour, soap and sugar to sell and hopes to expand her business. However, she complains of competition and inadequate capital. Mary is a hardworking woman and appreciates the services being offered.

loans.use: To buy millet flour, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Salia

texts.ru: Салия, 62 года, вдова, мать 6 детей. Все дети взрослые, самостоятельные, активно помогают по хозяйству. У Салии- среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода она занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав свою деятельность в 1994 году. Благодаря целеустремленности, упорству и трудолюбию Салии, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 2 теленка и 1 лошадь. Все условия для содержания скота есть, корма и сено заготовлены. Салия продает молочные продукты. Дополнительно занимается полеводством, выращивает картофель, кукурузу и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Салия обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку телят и овец  для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Салия планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и хочет накопить средства на строительство дома для сына.
texts.en: Salia is 62 years old, a widow, and the mother of six. All her children are already independent adults and help her out on the farm. She has received secondary education.  As a source of additional income for her family, Salia has been raising livestock and growing produce since 1994. Thanks to Salia's dedication, resilience and hard work, her farm now includes three dairy cows, two calves and one horse. She has all the necessary conditions for keeping livestock, and has fodder and hay stocked up. Salia sells dairy products. In addition, she grows farm produce: potatoes, corn and clover. Her monthly revenue is approximately 10,000 KGS.   In order to develop her farm further,  Salia has turned to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan to increase her livestock headcount by buying calves and sheep. Salia plans to use the revenues from her loan for an additional increase of livestock. She would also like to save up for building a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy calves and sheep.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a Kiva borrower. She has four children with ages ranging from 5 years to 14 years. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells poultry. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are frequent customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stocks of poultry. She hopes that in the future, she will have frequent cash flow. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of poultry.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 59 years old and a widow with one child who is in school. Carmen works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more grocery products to sell.

Carmen has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, rice, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: José Celestino

texts.es:
José es casado su esposa se dedica al comercio.

Él tiene 43 años de edad es empleado, trabaja de seguridad tiene 6 años de trabajar en la empresa, aparte de ser empleado posee un cafetín en donde  vende productos básicos.

 El crédito lo utilizara para instalar el techo en una habitación y comprar cemento. 

Desea que su esposa se encuentre en buen estado y que pueda vivir en buenas condiciones son los sueños de él y estar siempre juntos a su familia.
texts.en:
José is married, and his wife devotes herself to commerce.

He is 43 years old and employed.  He has been working in security for a company for six years.  Besides having this job, he has a snack bar where he sells basic products.

He will use the loan to install a roof on his home and to buy cement.  He wants his wife to find it in good condition and to be able to live in good conditions.  

This is his dream, and he also dreams of always being together with his family.

loans.use: to install a roof on his home and to buy cement.

loans.name: Tunu Group

texts.en:
Nasma is a member of Tunu group and joined so as to improve her life by obtaining a loan from Tujijenge. She is in her early 30s and has a daughter who is in school. Nasma, who is single, makes a living for her family by running a business selling a variety of items (fabrics, sarongs and Muslim type of dresses called dera). She runs her business door to door from 9am to 5pm per working day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is her second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy her business items. She used the previous loan to buy clothes in demand by her customers. She has paid back her entire loan successfully. Nasma earned a profit, which she used to cover school fees for her daughter and household expenses. She dreams to be a successful woman.

Nasma will share this loan with her loan group, Tunu, which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy items for her business.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme de 52ans. Elle est mariée à un retraité et mère de famille. Elle est revendeuse de pure water (eau minérale mise en sachet) et d'alimentation générale depuis 1997. Son troisième crédit lui permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins de ses clients. Elle veut récréer une autre activité (ouverture d’une boutique d’alimentation générale) et assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afi is a 52-year-old woman. Her husband is retired and she has children.

She has retailed “pure water,” mineral water sold in pouches, and groceries since 1997. Her third loan will allow her to procure merchandises to answer customer demand. She also wants to create a new business (opening a grocery store) and guarantee a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase 'pure water' to sell.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.fr: Marié et père de famille,  Monsieur Ferdinand est un revendeur d’articles  de quincaillerie âgé de 36 ans. Il dispose de sa boutique et emploie une personne. Il sollicite un troisiéme crédit à WAGES pour acheter d’autres articles de quincaillerie  pouvant lui permettre de devenir plus tard un grossiste. Il espère  ainsi utiliser le profit qu’il tirera de son commerce  pour assurer  les études  de ses enfants et leur épanouissement.
texts.en:
Mr. Ferdinand is a 36-year-old married man and father. He owns his own shop and has one employee.

He is requesting a third loan from WAGES to purchase more hardware items, allowing him in time to become a wholesaler. This way, he hopes to use revenues from his business to insure that his children get an education and are fulfilled.

loans.use: to purchase hardware items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to take the motor bike for service.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a man of 44 years who is married to Prisca and is a father of four children. He has been in the photography business for ten years now. He gets a monthly income of 40,000.

This will be George's fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya; he plans to use the entire amount to purchase picture frames, music CDs and videos. In the future, he wants to be a prosperous business man.

loans.use: To buy picture frames, music CDs and videos

loans.name: Bérékiou

texts.fr: Bérékiou  âgée de 48ans vit avec son conjoint cuisiner et leurs 02 enfants  à Lomé.  Elle exerce cette activité depuis 2000 et s’y plait bien car cela lui procure des revenus lui permettant de contribuer aux besoins de la famille. Son second crédit lui servira d’acheter des balles de friperies. Elle souhaite élargir son commerce et assurer l’éducation et la santé de la famille.
texts.en: Bérékiou is 48 years old. She lives with her husband, a cook, and their two children in Lomé. She has been in this business since 2000 and likes it because  the revenue allows her to help provide for her family. Her second loan will be used to buy some bales of used clothing. She would like to expand her business and provide for the cost of education and healthcare for her family.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Elom

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 28ans, Elom est revendeuse de céréales au marché, s’approvisionne à Blitta et Notsé. Pour  renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un second crédit  pour acheter des sacs de céréales.  Elle espère avoir plusieurs points de vente et mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en: Elom is a 28-year old woman who resells cereals at the marketplace. She stocks up in Blitta and Notse. To bolster her business, she is seeking a second loan to buy bags of cereals. She hopes to open new points of sale and be able to support herself in a better way.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 39 years old. She is married, and together she and her husband have been blessed with three children. She also has two adult dependents. 

She has been running her business for the past four years now. She currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 40,000. She would like a loan of KES 110,000, through which she will buy stock of products like cups, plates and basins. 

She hopes that her anticipated profits will go towards funding her children's school fees. 

In the future, she dreams of having a successful business.

loans.use: to add more stock like baskets, basins, plates and cups.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is a 28-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells rice. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as being lack of capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of rice. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of rice.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice

loans.name: Ernida

texts.en: Ernida is 58 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell. Ernida has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from farming rice. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en:
Macrina works hard to support her family. Macrina is married, and has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional shirts, pants and other items to sell. Macrina has been in this business for two years now. In the future, Macrina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
.

loans.use: to purchase additional shirts, pants and other items to sell.

loans.name: Xhevat

texts.en:
This is Xhevat with his goats grazing! 

Xhevat is a father of four. He is requesting lenders' financial help to prepare agricultural land of five dynym for planting watermelons and six dynym for planting corn; he wants to buy the seeds as well. Kindly note that one dynym is equal to 1,000 square meters.
  
Agriculture/livestock is his favorite activity. He doesn’t do it because he has to do it; he does it because he loves it, according to him. Xhevat has 25 goats, ten baby goats at the moment, and 200 chickens. He sells not only raw milk from his goats to a nearby dairy farm, but he also sells eggs and baby goats and little chickens. 

Xhevat and his family live in rural northern Albania.

loans.use: to buy watermelon and corn seeds, and to prepare the agricultural land for planting.

loans.name: Anima

texts.en:
Anima is a 34-year-old rural housewife, who lives with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter) in the small village of Tekatuli in Jalpaiguri district. She completed education up to grade 9, and her husband completed up to grade 8. Being less educated, she is very much enthusiastic to educate her children, and they are now in grades 5 and 2.

Her husband is a farmer, who sells vegetables in the local market. Anima helps her husband with agricultural activities. But, due to lack of variety in production, her husband is now unable to meet local people's demands, and because of this, his income is inconsistent. That is why Anima applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS). She plans to cultivate jute on their farmland, and she will use the loan to purchase jute seeds and fertilizers.

Anima has chosen this crop as it is in great demand in the present market and the farming process is less expensive. Moreover, it is a very profitable crop. She hopes she can earn a steady income from this business and manage her family's financial expenses with her business profit. She wants to give her children better education in better schools so that they can build good careers in the future.

Anima really wants to thank BJS and Kiva for funding her.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for farming jute.

loans.name: Anjali

texts.en:
Anjali is 48 years old, a rural housewife who lives with her husband, Shankar, and two grown up children in Maynaguri of Jalpaiguri district. They live in their own house. Both Anjali and her husband completed secondary education. One of their children is a student and is in college, and the other is a student of grade 12.

Anjali's husband is associated with a small business. He purchases ladies’ garments from a wholesale market and sells to the small shop owners of the local market. Now Anjali is interested to engage herself in a business of sewing garments because she knows that if her husband works alone for the family, they will not be able to meet the growing household expenses and their children's educational expenses. She wants to stitch small clothing like shirts, trousers, frocks and ladies’ garments. She wants to work hard with her husband to provide additional income for the family.

Now Anjali has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase a sewing machine, thread, cloth, buttons, etc. in order to start a tailoring business. Her neighbors will be her main customers.

She hopes to grow the business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through hard work.

She gives her thanks to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to start  a tailoring business.

loans.name: Al-Rrabi@ Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Rrabi@. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are hardworking and enterprising women. They took a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Hanan is the group's leader. She is 26 years old, married, and has one daughter who is six years old.  Her husband is employed as a soldier in the army. His salary is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. For this reason, Hanan decided to help him with these family expenses. She has started her business opening a grocery store in her area. One of Hanan's goals is to continue to grow her business. Unfortunately, she couldn't meet all the demands of her customers, and her income is still low. For this reason, Hanan applied for a loan of 50,000 YER in order to purchase more goods and items for her grocery store, to attract more customers.  Hanan hopes to earn large profits so that she can improve her savings, in order to obtain a big loan and further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods and items for her grocery store, in order to attract more customers.

loans.name: María Benita

texts.es:
Achuapa es un pequeño Municipio donde existen personas emprendedoras con deseo de superar en su vida, es aquí donde habita la joven María Benita. 

María Benita Es una joven de 41 años de edad madre soltera cuenta con dos hijo bajo su cargo, con lo poco que ella gana a duras penas ayuda a mantener el sustento diario a sus dos hijitos que tanto ama y estima. 

Trabaja en una empresa de construcción como asistente teniendo 3 años de laborar bajo este cargo, hoy en día se dio cuenta a través de Ceprodel que Kiva le podía financiar un crédito Para la construcción de su vivienda y que estas dos empresa piensan en el desarrollo de los pobres como es el de maría Benita.
Viendo la necesidad que presenta y debido a los problemas que ha enfrentado y siendo que su salario es bajo únicamente solicitara para empezar a construir una piensa para lograr a obtener en un futuro su propia vivienda.    

Se dirigió con toda amabilidad a la oficina de ceprodel a solicitar un pequeño préstamo para la compra de: Zin, Cemento Y Ladrillo esto para ella sería de gran importancia, le ayudaría mucho a construir un pequeño cuarto donde podrá vivir con sus dos hijitos.  

 Agrádese a Dios de Todo corazón por a verse encontrado con Kiva Y Ceprodel Para que esto le brinde la mano amigable en este pequeño crédito que le ayudara mucho en poder empezar a construir su pequeña vivienda.
texts.en:
María Benita lives in Achuapa a small municipality with some enterprising people who want to get ahead. María Benita is a 41 year old single mother who has two children who are dependent on her. The little she makes working hard manages to help support the daily sustenance of her two children who she loves so much. She works for a construction company as an assistant and has done this work for 3 years.

In these days she has realized that through Ceprodel and Kiva she can get a loan to build her house as these two institutes think about the development of poor people like her, María Benita. Knowing her present needs and due to the problems she faces with her salary being so low she is only asking to start the first step of what will in the future be her home.

So she has come with all courtesy to the offices of Ceprodel to ask for a small loan to buy zinc sheeting, cement and bricks. This is of great importance to her as it will help her build a small room where she can live with her two children. She thanks God with all her heart for helping her find Kiva and Ceprodel which is offering a kind hand to help her to begin to build her small house.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting, cement and bricks.

loans.name: Maclean

texts.en:
Maclean lives in Kampala. She is married with three children, two of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. 

Maclean sells fruits and vegetables. She operates her business at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the past ten years. She works seven days a week. Maclean has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX to buy passion fruit, cabbage, pineapple, watermelon, onions, and tomatoes. Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Maclean's goal and aspiration is to buy/build a residential house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more passion fruit, cabbage pineapple, watermelon, onions and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.fr:
Madame Agnès est âgée de  41 ans, mariée et  mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit avec sa famille dans la ville de Koutiala. Elle est transformatrice de noix de néré en Soumbala, qu’elle vend. Elle exerce cette activité il y’a  plus de 10 ans. Au Mali, le Soumbala est l’un des condiments les plus importants et très prisé par les femmes, pour  cela cette  activité lui procure beaucoup de bénéfices car elle peut vendre beaucoup dans la semaine.  
Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’élargir son activité, Agnès a sollicité la collaboration avec  l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de 4 ans.   elle est à son 5ème  prêt  individuel dont les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter de noix de néré en qualité et en quantité, les transformer en Soumbala (Condiments)  et les vend en  détail  à une clientèle d’hommes et femmes  au comptant.  
Elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 110.000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le  remboursement de son prêt, subvenir à ses besoins et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Agnès is 41 years old, married, and a mother of three. She lives with her family in the city of Koutiala. She processes locust bean seeds into “soumbala” (a condiment) for retail. She has been in this business for over ten years. In Mali, soumbala is one of the most important condiments and is very valued by women. Because of this, her business is very profitable, since she can sell a lot every week.

To increase her working capital and grow her business, Agnès requested a collaboration with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso over four years ago. This is her fifth individual loan; previous loans were paid back in time. With this loan, she is planning to purchase a large quantity of quality locust bean seeds, process them into soumbala, and retail them for cash to a mixed-gender clientele.

She is counting on a monthly profit of 110,000 XOF, which she will use to pay back her loan, provide for her needs, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy locust bean seeds.

loans.name: Ameyo

texts.fr: Ameyo âgée de 33ans vit avec son conjoint qui exerce la même activité (la vente des friperies) qu’elle et leurs 02 enfants  de 04 et 02ans à Lomé.  Elle mène cette activité depuis 2004 et s’y plait bien car cela lui procure des revenus lui permettant de contribuer aux besoins de la famille. Son second crédit lui servira d’acheter des balles de friperies. Elle souhaite élargir son commerce et assurer l’éducation et la santé de la famille.
texts.en: Ameyo is 33 years old. She lives in Lomé with her husband, who is in the same line of business as she (selling used clothing), and their two children, two and four years of age.  She has been in this business since 2004 and likes it because the revenues allow her to help provide for her family. Her second loan will allow her to buy bales of used clothing. She would like to expand her business and provide for the education and healthcare of her children.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane has operated her fruit stand for ten years. She is thankful because through her hard work and determination in life she was able to sustain their basic necessities. Her previous loan has been of great help in improving her fruit stand business. Now, she wants to maintain her business through continuous access to financial services from lenders.

Mary Jane is asking for another loan amounting to 17,000 PHP. She will use this loan in buying stocks of watermelons, Mexican turnips (singkamas) and pineapples.This loan amount will impact her ability to increase her income and educate her two children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of pineapple and watermelon to sell

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 28-year-old gentleman from Katito, married to Winnie, who is also a business lady in the same town. They have 3 children aged 13, 9 and 2 years.

Fredrick has borrowed a loan of KES 30,000 with VisionFund Kenya to use for buying supplies in bulk. The profits will be used to repay the loan as well as making some savings. His dream is to prosper.

loans.use: Fredrick will use the loan to buy supplies in bulk for his shop

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 37 years old and lives in Agarak village in the Lori region. He is married, and he lives with his retired parents, wife and two school-aged sons. 

Karen works at a private company as a milk density control specialist. At the same time, he owns a cute farm with two cows and two bulls. On his plot of land, he cultivates potatoes, which he sells to resellers. The milk and meat that Karen manages to sell is not much, and he greatly wants to enlarge his farm and his income from it as well.

Karen asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy several bulls to make his farm richer, and also animal fodder for his all farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy several bulls to make his farm richer, and also animal fodder for his all farm cattle.

loans.name: Flordepaz

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Flordepaz works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Flordepaz is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell at her general store, like shampoo and groceries.

Flordepaz has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money for expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy items, such as shampoo and groceries, for sale at her store.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a farmer living in the Litein area of South rift Kenya with her husband and 3 children. She loves farming and has been doing it for 4 years. Her primary sources of income are milk, horticulture and cash crops, and she also has a retail business. In farming, her biggest challenge is lack of funds for her farming projects.

Jackline chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer training before giving out loans to farmers. This loan will enable her to purchase poultry for more production of eggs; thus, her income will increase. This will enable her to cater to the needs of her family well.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Visitacion works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from the direct sale of Avon products. Visitacion is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, canned goods, etc. for her restaurant business.

Visitacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 57 years old and married with six children, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Marivic runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Marivic has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as rice, snack food and other groceries. 

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is 47-years-old and is from Nyandarua South. She is married and has eight children between the ages of 20 years and 3 years old. Her spouse is also a farmer.

Lydiah is a farmer and has applied for her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy seedlings and fertilizers to use for her farm.

She hopes to boost her farming business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly lives in Kampala. She is married with four children, one of whom goes to school.  She has additional family members. She operates a mobile money service. She operates her business on a retail basis from the market. She has been in this business for the last eight years. She works six days a week.  She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX to buy airtime and to load mobile money on her mobile phone. Her business challenges includes network problems, and limited profits on airtime. Her goal and aspiration is to own a fully stocked mobile money shop, and to buy rental houses. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more airtime and to load mobile money on her mobile phone.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Evelyn requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like rice, snack foods, noodles and other groceries. Evelyn has been in this business for 25 years.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, snack foods, noodles and other groceries for sale at her store.

loans.name: Arjina

texts.en:
Arjina is a hardworking lady who stays with her husband, Ajizul. Both are energetic. Both of them attended school until grade 4. They have two school-going children (one son and one daughter) in grade 7 and grade 6. They live in their own house in a small village, Mouyamari, in Jalpaiguri district.

Ajina's husband has a business of selling spices. He buys spices from wholesale markets and sells in the local market. Arjina is a housewife. She also helps her husband after managing the household. The income from their business is not up to the mark, due to non-availability of varieties of stock. So, they cannot supply as per the customers' demand.  
 
Arjina heard from her friend that Kiva’s partner, BJS, gives loans to empower rural women. She has applied for a loan from them to purchase many varieties of spices, mustard oil, etc. so that they can fulfill their customers' demand as well as enhance their business.

This loan will help her family financially to overcome the financial stringency, which at present they are facing, and she will be able to provide good education and other curricular activities to her children. Moreover, she wants to grow her business to be a good entrepreneur. 

She is thankful and grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a large variety of spices to increase the business.

loans.name: Elne

texts.en:
Elne is 54 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, chips, spices, soft drinks, etc.

Elne has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, chips, spices, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 45 years old. He has been running his business for the past 12 years. He is married and he and his wife have been blessed with three children. 

Charles currently makes an estimated monthly income of 35,600 KES and would like to obtain a loan of 36,000 KES, with which he will buy more charcoal in bulk to sell to his customers. 

He hopes to have a blessed future.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a candy-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Annabelle is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her candy-making business.

Annabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her candy-making business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a 68-year-old married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she keeps poultry. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more poultry and feed. Her business goal is to own two dairy cows within five years.

loans.use: to buy more poultry and feed.

loans.name: Manzese B Group

texts.en:
Christina is in her early 30’s and is married. She and her husband have two sons who are at school.
