She is doing great, and for the sake of her family life, Christina has decided to open a small project of fish selling. She goes a distance from home to the fish market, where she buys fresh fish (ocean fishes) and fries them at home. It takes about three hours to complete her market route, and then she turns back to home. After she has fried her fishes, she starts and sells, up to 4:00 P.M. daily. Christina is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is her first loan request from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy more fish to meet her customers’ demands. She dreams of building a nice family house. Christina will share this loan with her loan group “Manzese B,” which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fish to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet lives in the rich highlands of Litein area of South rift Kenya. She lives with her husband and four children, all of school going age. She has been doing farming for six years, with her primary income source being milk, horticulture, and cash crops. She really enjoys farming, but her biggest challenge is lack of sufficient funds.

Janet says that KIVA loans do improve the livelihoods of smallholder farmers, and so this loan will enable her to construct a greenhouse for her horticultural crops. This will really improve crop production and thus increase sales, and there will be an increase in her income. This will enable her give her children a better education.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy canned food and pasta for resale.

loans.name: Maria Cristabel

texts.es: María es una mujer de 54 años de edad con espíritu emprendedor quien se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace 20 años en el mercado central de su localidad. María reside en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos, dos de los cuales son mayores de edad y le colaboran con la economía del hogar. María desea construir un cuarto para cocina frente a su vivienda por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro y para pagar la mano de obra que realizará la construcción.
texts.en:
Maria is a 54 year old woman with an enterprising spirit who has sold vegetables for the last 20 years in the central market in her area. Maria lives in her own home with her husband and her 5 children, 2 of whom are adults and help her with costs around the house.

Maria wants to build a room for a kitchen in front of her home, which is why she has made the decision to request this loan from FUSAI to purchase materials such as bricks, cement, sand, iron, and the cost of the labor to build the kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand, iron, and to pay the cost of labor needed to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her charcoal business. Editha has been in this business for six years. She also earns income from farming rice. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: José Osmin

texts.es:
José de 39 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno grado,  es acompañado su esposa es comerciante tiene un hijo que está estudiando. 

José también es empleado  y trabaja en una planta desde hace 10 años, aparte de eso se dedica a la agricultura en los ratos libres de su empleo.
El préstamo que está solicitando, es para instalar unan tienda en su casa, comprara lo más básico como arroz, frijoles, maíz, sal, golosinas, etc.  Y tener más ingresos, será satisfecha una necesidad ya que tendrá más ingresos del negocio.
texts.en:
José is 39 years old. He studied until the ninth grade. His wife is a shopkeeper and he has one school age son.
José is also employed. He has worked at a factory for ten years. He also farms in his free time. 
The loan he is requesting is for installing a store in his home. He will purchase basics like rice, beans, corn, salt, candy, etc. By having more profits, he will satisfy a need for his business.

loans.use: install a store in his home and purchase basics like corn, beans, rice, salt and candy.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмире 40 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей школьного возраста. Супруг и дети активно помогают по хозяйству. У Гульмиры - среднее образование, на протяжении 16 лет занимается животноводством. Целеустремленность и трудолюбие  Гульмиры  позволили ей развить хозяйство до: 1 дойной коровы, 5 овец и 1 лошади. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом  в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота и ежемесячного дохода от продажи молочных продуктов. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества дойных коров, и хочет накопить средства на покупку бытовой техники.
texts.en: Gulmira is 40, married and the mother of 5 school-aged children.  Her husband and children actively help her tend to their farm.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and has been farming livestock for 16 years.  Gulmira's goal-oriented nature and love of hard work have enabled her to grow her farm to its current state; she has a dairy cow, 5 sheep and a horse, and makes around 10,000 som per month.  To further develop her farm, Gulmira is seeking a loan of 30,000 som from Bai-Tushum & Partners to buy more cows.  This will allow her to make more money each month from selling milk; money which will not only go towards buying even more dairy cows, but will help her afford some new home appliances as well.

loans.use: buy cows for her farm

loans.name: Lhesvy

texts.en: Lhesvy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines for 2 years. She earns additional income from a general store. Lhesvy is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Lhesvy dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан 62 года, вдова, мать 8 детей, все дети взрослые, самостоятельные и живут отдельно. У Анаркан - среднее образование, она знает конкретно, чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. Анаркан в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав с покупки скота в 1970 году. Благодаря упорному труду Анаркан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 1 нетель и 10 овец. Для содержания скота есть все условия: сарай для содержания и отгонные пастбища. Сено и корма для скота заготовлены в достаточном количестве. Дойных коров содержит круглогодично дома, присматривают сами, а овец выгоняет на пастбища. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анаркан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Анаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и хочет накопить средства на обучение младшего сына.
texts.en: Anarkan is a 62-year-old widow and the mother of 8 children.  All her children are grown up, financially independent and live on their own.  She has the equivalent of a high school education, and is the sort of person who knows exactly what they want in life and stops at nothing to get it.  She raises livestock for a living and has been doing so since 1970, starting with an initial purchase of animals.  Thanks to her persistence, she currently has a dairy cow, a calf, a heifer and 10 sheep, and makes nearly 10,000 som per month.  She has everything she needs for raising livestock: she has a livestock shed and pastures nearby to graze her animals, and has ample stores of hay and other fodder on hand as well.  She keeps her dairy cows at her home year-round as they're self-sufficient and can look after themselves, while her sheep need to be driven out to pasture.  To further develop her farm, Anarkan is seeking a loan of 30,000 som from Bai-Tushum & Partners to buy more sheep.  She plans on using any profits due to the loan to continue to buy more livestock, as well as to set aside money for her youngest son's education.

loans.use: buy sheep

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane lives in the town of Vanadzor with her husband and parents-in-law. She has two sons who left the country last year and now are migrant workers who hope to find a job and help sustain their family. Gayane has earned a living for the last five years by making a large variety of cookies, cakes and other sweets in her house. She fills orders from people who live in her area and provides high-quality service. She is requesting a loan which is very important to her and her business. She plans to use it to buy a stove which she badly needs for her work. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The program provides business start-up loans, with easy repayment terms, to businesses that do not have access to more standard credit products.

loans.use: to buy a stove to make cookies and cakes.

loans.name: Emelitina

texts.es:
La Sra. Emelitina es una persona honesta, responsable vive con  sus  hijos en un municipio al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  elaboración de  tortillas.
Emelitina el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de (maíz  y leña) Con el préstamo ella espera  el aumento de las ventas debido a que contara con más materia  prima  en  esta  temporada alta que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan y así cubrir sus necesidades, así mismo desea  que  mejore el estilo  de vida, y  Se vea reflejado  con esta inversión.
Emelitina en unos años ella sueña con que  su negocio este posicionado como el más grande y conocido como única de su municipio  y poder seguir apoyando a  sus hijos  a que se conviertan en personas de bien.

Choluteca, Honduras – Abril   del   2014
texts.en:
Emelitina is an honest and responsible person. She lives with her children in a town in the south of Honduras. She makes a living making tortillas.

Emelitina needs a loan to buy corn and wood. She hopes that with the loan her sales will increase since she will have more raw materials during this high season to offer the customers that visit her and that way cover her necessities. She wishes for her quality of life to improve, reflecting this investment.

Emelitina dreams that in a few years her business will be considered the largest and best known in her town so that she can continue to encourage her children to become good people.

Choluteca, Honduras – April 2014

loans.use: to buy corn and wood for her business.

loans.name: Melanimfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Melanimfa works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables and a general store. Melanimfa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more kilos of dried fish to sell for her business.

Melanimfa has successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Melanimfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of dried fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerard, 31 years old, is a hardworking man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is married and has 1 child aged 2 years, not attending school. Gerald has been selling produce, farming for development and fighting poverty. Gerald hopes to grow his business and is asking for a loan to buy beans, rice and maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice and maize for selling.

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila is 53 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising chickens in the Philippines. Prescila is borrowing 28000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Prescila has been raising chickens for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala. She is single and has 2 children, both attending school. Sarah takes care of 1 additional family member (mother). For the last 2 years, Sarah has operated a retail shop from the market, working seven days a week.  

Sarah has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 to buy sugar, rice, flour, cooking oil and boxes of soap. Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Sarah's goal and aspiration is to buy a fridge to sell cold drinks. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Sarah's major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice, cooking oil and boxes of soap.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a single mother with six children and three of them go to school. She is not taking care of any other family members. She has been operating a retail shop for basic commodities for four years, working seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy crates of soda and beer to sell. She has no other source of income. Her major business challenges include thieves. She aspires to have a fully stocked retail shop and later become a wholesaler. She joined MCDT because of the success that her friends have attained since they became MCDT members. She rents a house with access to electricity, but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Ligaya works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Ligaya is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase stocks such as canned goods, milk, coffee, eggs, etc. to sell.

Ligaya successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Ligaya has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks such as canned goods, milk, coffee, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Marina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  Marina is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, spices, cream, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Marina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, spices, cream, etc.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lina works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from poultry. Lina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  buy feed and vitamins for her pigs in her pig fattening business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Angeles works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from manicures, pedicures and a general store. Angeles is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Angeles has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna, 46 years old, is married and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Edna's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Edna is taking out a bridge loan of PHP 5,000 to restart her general store business. She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. Edna is committed to rebuild and, in the future, would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Musisi

texts.en: Musisi is a seventy-four-year-old married male; he deals in the agriculture business six days a week and six hours a day in the rural area, plus pension as additional income. Musisi hopes to construct a commercial house, however, pests and diseases are challenges he faces. Musisi is a hardworking man. Musisi want money to buy farm inputs like sprays for his gardens.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like sprays for his gardens.

loans.name: Gulzhan

texts.ru: Гулжан 55 лет, разведена, мать 3 детей. Все дети активно помогают по хозяйству. У Гулжан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и растениеводством, начав свою деятельность в 2011 году, с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря целеустремленности, упорству и трудолюбию Гулжан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 теленок, 18 коз и 8 овец. Также Гулжан арендует 2 ГА земли, где хочет посеять клевер. Гулжан продает молочные продукты, ее ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулжан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коз и коров для увеличения поголовья скота, также для увеличения ежемесячного дохода от продажи молочных продуктов. Дополнительно часть полученного кредита Гулжан хочет потратить на покупку семян клевера. Доходы от кредита Гулжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на постройку большого сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Gulzhan is 55 years old, widowed and a mother of three children.  All of her kids help out around the farm.  Gulzhan has a high school education and her main source of income comes from farming and raising livestock.  She began her business in 2011 with 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her dedication, persistence and diligence, Gulzhan currently has one calf, 18 goats and 8 sheep.  Gulzhan also has 2 hectares of land where she wants to grow clover.  Gulzhan makes 12,000 som (KGS) per month in selling milk products.

In order to expand her business, Gulzhan turned to the bank of Bai Tushum for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional goats and cows.  This will expand her herd and increase her income from selling milk products.  In addition, Gulzhan wants to use part of the loan for the purchasing of clover seeds.  Part of the profits, Gulzhan is planning to reinvest into increasing the headcount of her livestock and to save the rest for the building of a barn to house her animals.

loans.use: To buy goats, cows and some clover seed

loans.name: Zaira

texts.en:
Zaira, 60 years old, is a widow from the city of Rustavi. She lives with her student grandson. The family's only source of income is Zaira's work, doing clothing alterations for private orders. Zaira generates an insignificant income and it's difficult for her to manage all of the family's financial difficulties. 

Zaira has a great desire to expand her activity and that's why she requested a loan. She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  Zaira will use the requested money to purchase a special sewing machine for pillows, blankets and sheets and sell the sewn items at a good price. With the support of the Start Up program, Zaira will get an opportunity to expand her own business and tackle her financial difficulties more effectively. She is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To purchase a special sewing machine

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
Rosa de 53 años de edad,  estudio hasta segundo grado,  está acompañada su compañero de vida esta pensionado.  Tienen dos hijos del cual 1 estudia en la escuela  y  el otro trabaja.

 Rosa vende tortillas y papas fritas desde hace 15 años siempre a trabajado en el negocio o en el mercado. El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar papas, salsas, quesos, gas.

Ella desea poder hacer su negocio mas grande y  darle el estudio a su hijo que estudia y dejarles un capital o patrimonio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 53 years old. She studied until the second grade. She has a life partner who is retired. She has two children, one is studying and the other is working. 

Rose has sold tortillas and french fries for 15 years, always working at her business or in the market. The loan she is requesting is for purchasing potatoes, sauces, cheese and gas. 

She wants to be able to maker her business larger,  allow her son to study and leave her children an inheritance.

loans.use: purchase potatoes, sauces, cheese and gas.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana sigue dedicándose a brindar su negocio de restaurante, la socia continua ofreciendo desayunos, almuerzos  y cenas ,la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose e a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales ,la socia desea que su negocio crezca siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz,aceite entre otros.
La socia está feliz con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana continues to dedicate herself to her restaurant business, where she offers breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The borrower has worked in this business for quite a while, and it brings her both economic and personal satisfaction. She would like her business to grow, since it is the way that she provides for her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, cooking oil, and other items.

The borrower is happy with the loan she has received, and is committed to making her loan payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking oil, and other items

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a single mother with six children, all attending school. She also takes care of her parents. Mariam has been selling green bananas in the market for 13 years, working seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more green bananas for sale. 

Mariam has no other source of income. Her major business challenge is thieves. Mariam aspires to acquire her own land to grow green bananas and become a wholesaler. She joined MCDT because of the confidence and trust the old members had in the organization. Mariam rents a house with access to neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 36-year-old married male with four children, who all go to school. He used his previous loan to buy sugar and rice to sell. John has been in this business (general store) for six years, working six days a week and eight hours a day. His business is located in a rural area. John also has a motorcycle transport business and does farming for additional income. John's main business challenges are weather and price fluctuations.

John is a hardworking man who needs a loan to buy Blue Band (margarine) and shoe polish  to sell. He hopes to construct a residential house.

loans.use: to buy Blue Band (margarine) and shoe polish  to sell.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en: Caren is married and has 4 children. She describes herself as focused. Caren operates a retail business, selling maize flour, bread, eggs and other items. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. Caren describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to add stock of wheat flour, maize flour and other items. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. Caren hopes that, in the future, she will have a good life. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to add stock of wheat flour, maize flour and other items

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru: Дамире 57 лет, замужем, есть 3 взрослых детей. У Дамиры высшее образование, много лет проработала в школе преподавателем, сейчас на пенсии и занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Дамиры, она смогла развить и расширить свою деятельность до 2 дойных коров, 2 телят и 8 овец, также есть 1,00 ГА земли, где Дамира выращивает картофель для собственного потребления и реализации. В совокупности ее ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сомов (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дамира обратилась в Банк "Бай –Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита позволят Дамире расширить ее бизнес и построить большой сарай для скота.
texts.en:
Damira is 57 years old, married and has three grown children.  Damira has a university education and she spent many years working as a teacher in school.  Currently, she is retired and spends her time by raising livestock, a business that she started in with 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Damira's persistently hard work, she was able to expand her business to include 2 milk cows, 2 calves and 8 sheep.  She also has one hectare of land where she grows potatoes for herself and for sale to others.  

Damira's total monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS).  In order to expand her business, Damira turned to the bank of Bai Tushum for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves.  Profits from her business will allow Damira to expand her enterprise and to build a large barn for her animals.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Dora Isabel

texts.es:
Dora de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto  grado,  está acompañada su esposo se dedica a la música en un  mariachi, sus hijos no estudian, tiene un negocio de venta de golosinas, sodas, frescos, frutas etc., desde hace 10 años este lo tiene enfrente de la escuela de su cantón.
El préstamo que está solicitando,  es para comprar gaseosas,  golosinas y mejorar un poco la vivienda, comprar lamina, adobe, cemento.
 Sueña con que su negocio sea más grande y poder aumentar sus ganancias para darle a su familia una casa digna y propia.
texts.en:
Dora is 44 years old. She attended school until sixth grade. She is married, and her husband makes a living playing music in a mariachi band. Her children do not attend school. She has had a business that sells candy, sodas, fresh fruit, etc. for the past 10 years in front of the school in her neighborhood.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy sodas and candy and to improve her home a bit by purchasing metal sheets, adobe, and cement. She dreams that her business will grow so she can increase her profits in order to give her family their own decent house.

loans.use: to buy sodas and candy and to improve her home a bit by purchasing metal sheets, adobe, and cement.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives alone in Vanadzor town. Her two daughters are married and live with their families alone. 
Marine has been involved in the retail business for already 15 years. She trades with clothing, purchasing clothing from Yerevan town and reselling it to her customers. The requested loan is very important for Marine. It will enable her to acquire a new stock of clothing for her customers. Marine has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
This hard-working business woman will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for clothing supplies for reselling to customers.

loans.name: Altynkul

texts.ru: Алтынкул, 57 лет, вдова,есть 5 взрослых и уже самостоятельных детей, они активно помогают по хозяйству. У Алтынкул- средне-специальное медицинское образование, по специальности работает до сих пор, в качестве дополнительного дохода она занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав свою деятельность в 1977 году. Благодаря целеустремленности, упорству и трудолюбию Алтынкул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок и 8 овец. Все условия для содержания скота есть, корма и сено заготовлены. Алтынкул продает молочные продукты. Дополнительно занимается полеводством, на собственных 1,40 ГА выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Алтынкул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота и дохода от продажи молочных продуктов. Доходы от кредита Алтынкул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на строительство дома для сына.
texts.en:
Altynkul is 57 years old, a widow and has five grown sons, all of whom help out around the farm.  Altynkul has medical education and is currently working in this field.  For supplemental income, she raises livestock and farms.  Altynkul began her farming business in 1977.  Thanks to her persistence, hard work and diligence, currently, Altynkul has one milk cow, one calf and 8 sheep.  She maintains all of the necessities for keeping and feeding livestock on her premises, including hay.  

For income, Altynkul sells milk products and grows beans on her own plot of land of 1.4 hectares.  Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to grow her business, Altynkul turned to the bank of Bai Tushum for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS), for the purchasing of additional cows to increase her production of milk products.  Profits from her business, Altynkul is planning to reinvest into increasing her herd and also to save some for building a house for her son.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta lives in a northern town where the tomb of our National Hero ‘Skenderbeg’ is located. The town is visited by tens of hundreds of visitors every year including foreigners, especially during the summer time. Violeta has been running a service shop where she repairs TVs, DVD players, stereophonic systems, clothing irons, hair dryers, etc. and is requesting this loan to buy tools and supplies for it. 

She is 45 years old and a mother of three teenaged children and she studied a profession back then during the communist era in Albania.  In addition to running her service shop, she also offers staying at her "getaway" type of house, or ‘bujtina’ as it is called in the local language, that is located in the very northern part of the country and is visited by mostly foreigners during the summer season. This village has breathtaking scenery. The internal and external architecture of such ‘bujtinas’ are very traditional, with very old pieces inside and the food served there is completely local and cooked by households.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies for her service shop.

loans.name: Maria Cordelia

texts.es: María tiene 55 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de fruta la cual cultiva en su terreno. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de las paredes de uno de los cuartos de su vivienda el cual actualmente esta construido a base de lámina. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo y hierro. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y de esta forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
María is fifty-five years old and lives in her own house together with her children.  She makes a living selling a variety of fruit, which she grows on her land.  She is a very enterprising woman who, with a lot of effort, has been able to move her family ahead. 

María is requesting a loan from FUSAI to build up the walls of one of the rooms in her home.  The room is currently made of metal sheets.  

With the loan requested, she will buy cement, sand, brick, and iron bars.  She hopes to be able to have this financial support so that she can improve the life conditions of both herself and family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick, and iron bars to build walls for a room in her house.

loans.name: Zendie Rose

texts.en:
Zendie Rose is 29 years old and has one child. She works very hard to provide for the child.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Zendie Rose has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Zendie Rose would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en: Pascal is a thirty-four-year-old married male with five children and has been in the clothing business for thirteen years. He works twelve hours a day, located on a busy street, plus rentals for additional income. He used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell targeting Easter season when demand is high. Pascal hopes for his business, however, competition, and seasons affect his business. Pascal is a hardworking man who is asking for a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita works hard to support her family. Merlita is married and has a selling ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Merlita has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Merlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: St. Jude Kyakatwanga Group

texts.en:
John is a Ugandan married and hardworking man and has 4 children. He lives in Kagadi where he has been operating a retail shop, tailoring, and farming since 1990 to earn a living. He hopes to educate his children despite capital insufficiency. 

John is requesting for a loan to buy salt, sugar, and soap for resale. 

He is a member of St. Jude Kyakatwanga where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, and soap for resale

loans.name: Julia

texts.ru: Юлии 47 лет, замужем, 2 детей. У Юлии средне-техническое образование, по специальности парикмахер. Она предприимчивая, ответственная, целеустремленная и доброжелательная. Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Семья очень дружная, отношения в семье очень хорошие. Юлия в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, с 1987 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки 20 овец. Благодаря упорному труду Юлии, в хозяйстве имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 нетель, 1 теленок и 5 овец, а также есть собственный земельный надел, размером 2,52 ГА, на которой выращивается картофель, морковь и ячмень. Ее сельскохозяйственная деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от хозяйства позволили Юлии вырастить и обучить детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы, для увеличения объемов продажи молока и дальнейшего приплода. Также часть кредита будет потрачено на покупку семян картофеля элитных сортов. Доходы от кредита Юлия планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет дать достойное образование своим детям.
texts.en:
Julia is 47 years old, married and has two children.  Julia has a technical education in hair styling.  She is a very entrepreneurial, responsible, persistent and a kind person. Her husband and her children help her out around the farm.  Her family is very tight-knit and amicable towards each other.  For supplemental income, since 1987, Julia has been farming and raising livestock.  She started this business with a purchase of 20 sheep.  Thanks to Julia's hard work, she now has one milk cow, one heifer, one calf and five sheep.  She also has a 2.52 hectares of land where she grows potatoes, carrots and barley. Her business brings in approximately 10,000 some (KGS) every month.  The profits from her business allowed Julia to raise and to educate her children. 

In order to expand her business further, Julia turned to the bank of Bai Tushum for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow.  This will allow her to increase her milk sales.  Also, Julia is planning to spend part of the loan to buy seeds of elite potato varieties.  Profits from her business Julia is planning to reinvest into her business and to save some for the future education of her children.

loans.use: To buy a cow and potato seeds

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor tiene 48 años de edad y es agricultor y comerciante. Víctor tiene casa propia y habita en ella  junto a su esposa quien es pequeña comerciante y entre los dos mantienen a su sus tres hijos de 20 años, 21 años y 22 años de edad. Con deseos de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación de la energía eléctrica en su vivienda puesto que no posee el servicio y desea dar mejores condiciones de desarrollo a su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor, 48, is a farmer and merchant.  He has his own house and lives there with his wife, a small businesswoman.  Between the two of them they support their three children, ages 20, 21, and 22.

He wants to improve his living conditions so he decided to ask FUSAI for this loan to invest in installing electricity in his house.  He doesn't have the service and he wants his family to make better progress.

loans.use: to install electricity in his home

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Las Violetas” está constituida por 07 socios cada uno de ellos con distintas actividades de comercio. Teresa tiene 47 años, separada con 03 hijos 02 de ellos aún dependientes. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a la venta de golosinas, la cual lo realiza ambulatoriamente. Este negocio le ha permitido a Teresa  solvertar con algunos gastos de su  familia. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, la cual comprará golosinas como chocolates, caramelos, galletas y bebidas. El deseo de Teresa es de poner  un kiosco y de esta forma no tener que hacerlo ambulatoriamente. El grupo “Las Violetas” está agradecido con el crédito brindado, pues hace posible su progreso. Teresa se encuentra sentada es la segunda del lado derecho, viste polo con rayas azules y blanco.
texts.en:
This is the group “Las Violetas” [The Violets]. It is made up of 7 partners, each of them with different sales occupations.

Teresa is 48 years old. She is separated and has three children, two of whom are still dependents. For over 12 years, she has worked selling sweets as a street vendor. This business has allowed Teresa to cover some of her family's expenses. She requested the loan to continue investing in her business; she will use it to purchase sweets such as chocolates, caramels, cookies, and drinks. Teresa's wish is to put up a stand and no longer need to sell in the street.

The group "Las Violetas" is grateful for the offered loan because it makes their progress possible. Teresa is the second from the right, wearing a blue and white striped shirt.

loans.use: to purchase sweets such as chocolates, caramels, cookies, and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase meat, beans, dairy products and other basic grocery items.

loans.name: Gledis Carolina

texts.es:
La Sra. Glendis  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con sus  hijos en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  pulpería desde hace más de 8  años.
Glendis el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de manteca, arroz, frijoles, carnes y pollo,  café, pan, arroz, maíz y otros productos de consumo basico. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes.
La  Sra. Glendis espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en una de  las pulperías más grande y reconocido de la zona y que sus hijos  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la  sociedad. 

Choluteca, Honduras  – Abril   del   2014
texts.en:
Glendis is a responsible, hard-working, and honest person. She lives with her children in southern Honduras.

Her business is a small grocery store she has had for more than 8 years. Glendis needs the loan to purchase butter, rice, beans, meat and chicken, coffee, bread, corn, and other basic consumer products for her business. With the loan, she hopes that her business' sales increase from having more products to offer and better attending to her customers.

Glendis hopes to cover her needs and improve her quality of life and that of her family. In a few years, she hopes that her business will continue to grow and will become one of the largest and most popular stores in the area. She hopes that her children will become good people with better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – April 2014

loans.use: to purchase butter, rice, beans, meat and chicken, coffee, bread, corn, and other basic consumer products for her business

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah lives in Kampala. She is married and has 3 children, all of which go to school.  She takes care of 1 additional family member (mother). 

She sells second-hand clothes on a retail basis in the market. She has been in business for the last 7 years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from farming. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings to buy a bale of second hand clothes. Her business challenges includes transportation and seasonality. 

Her goal and aspiration is to buy a delivery van and also to get more capital in order to serve more customers. 

She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. 

Her major monthly expense includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy  a bale of used clothes to resell

loans.name: Emelitina

texts.es:
La Sra. Emelitina  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a sus hijos en una comunidad en la zona  de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta   de granos el cual es muy conocido en su comunidad.
Doña Emelitina necesita el préstamo para la  compra  de varias cargas de  maíz. Los cuales  necesita para seguir vendiendo.
Ella espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con el  producto necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento considerable el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia en el hogar con el aumento de los ingresos. Doña Emelitina espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia y  que  sus hijos continúe con los estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.

Choluteca, Honduras – Abril  del  2014
texts.en:
Emelitina is a very hard-working and responsible person. She lives with her children in a community in Honduras. She makes a living selling grain and her business is well-known in her community. 

Emelitina needs a loan to buy several bushels of corn, which she needs to continue selling. She hopes that as a result of the loan she will be able to count on the necessary supplies to continue furthering her business and that way cover the demand of her customers. In the same way, she hopes that her sales will increase considerably which will be reflected by the quality of life of her family at home with the increase in revenue. 

Emelitina hopes that her business will continue growing and become the best known in her community so that she can continue supporting her family and so that her children can continue their education and have greater opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – April 2014

loans.use: to buy bushels of corn for her business.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de madera, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia elabora muebles,mesas,roperos entre otros, la socia desea poder trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de madera.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This group member continues to make a living through her business buying and selling wood.  She has been doing this work for years, and it is going well thanks to all the effort she puts into her business each day.  She also makes furniture, tables, wardrobes, and other items.  She hopes to be able to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more wood.  She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with her payments.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia Gloria continua dedicándose al negocio de artesania,la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia vende diferentes tipos de artesanía como polos, chompas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de chompas de alpaca.

La socia está feliz con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Gloria, continues working in her crafts business.  She has worked in this business for years and it brings her financial as well as personal satisfaction. She's a responsible and diligent person.  She sells different types of crafts such as t-shirts, sweaters, and other things.  She wants to keep working so she can continue to help her family.

Gloria's requesting the loan to buy alpaca sweaters.

She's happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy alpaca sweaters

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 34-year-old single woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be ambitious and honest. 

She operates a retail business where she sells tea leaves. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy and good area and has many customers. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough inventory. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more tea leaves to sell. 

Her business goal is to own a wholesale shop within 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.  She will invest the anticipated profits back into the business.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 54 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are in school.  Editha works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional merchandise to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc. 

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Orolkan

texts.ru: Оролкан 52 года, она замужем, есть 5 детей. У Оролкан среднее образование, с 2003 года занимается сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день у Оролкан в хозяйстве имеется 10 дойных коров, 15 телят, 40 овец, 10 лошадей и 5 жеребят, что приносит ей прибыль в 15,000 сомов (KGS) в месяц. Скот в летний период Оролкан отгоняет на джайлоо, а в зимний содержит в хозяйстве, для чего есть все условия на территории дома. Супруг и дети активно помогают по хозяйству. В Банк "Бай-Тушум" Оролкан обратилась за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Увеличение поголовья скота позволит улучшить материальное благосостояние семьи, а также дать младшим детям хорошее образование.
texts.en: Orolkan is 52 years old, married and has five children. Orolkan has a high school education and has been farming since 2003.  Currently, Orolkan has 10 milk cows, 15 calves, 40 sheep, 10 horses, and 5 fowl.  Her monthly income from this business is 15,000 som (KGS).  During the summer, she moves the herd to alpine pastures and in the winter she houses the animals at her farm.  Her spouse and her children actively help out with the farm work.  Orolkan turned to the bank of Bai Tushum for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves.  Increasing her herd will bring additional money into the house, improve their finances and provide good education for the young children.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Keto

texts.en: Keto is a 64-year-old married woman from the village Tskhramukha. She lives with her husband, and both are engaged in agribusiness. They extensively cultivate a plot of agricultural land, growing hay and selling it locally. However the family belongs to the economic category of subsistence poor, as they don't have any significant income and need an investment to cover all their daily expenses. Keto requested a loan and was approved with the start up program that gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. She will start a trading business with the mentioned loan. Specifically, she will purchase clothing at wholesale prices and sell it at an increased price among her villagers. This new activity will be great support for this hardworking woman, as she will be able to tackle financial difficulties and do her bit to help the family's welfare. Keto awaits your support.

loans.use: to start a business trading clothing

loans.name: John Mary

texts.en:
John Mary is a 65 year-old married man who has two children.  He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

He operates a retail shop where he has spent many years selling home use products. This has helped him to earn income which he has used to educate his children. He also does farming. He has always reaped tangible benefits and he even used these profits to improve his welfare and that of the family. 

His business plan is to buy a small car. He is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise to sell

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza works hard to support her family. Esperanza is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell.

Esperanza has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Esperanza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 53 years old, married, and has six children. With two children in school, Loreta works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy merchandise to sell like soap, eggs, milk, canned goods, etc.

Loreta has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future, Loreta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell like soap, eggs, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Busaira

texts.ru: Бусайра, 50 лет, замужем, есть дети. Все члены семьи активно помогают по хозяйству. У Бусайры среднее образование, на протяжении 32 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки одной коровы. Благодаря упорному труду, Бусайра смогла развить и расширить свою деятельность до 4 дойных коров, 30 овец и 4 лошадей, что приносит ей прибыль в 10,000 сомов (KGS) в месяц. Для содержания скота есть все условия. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бусайра обратилась в Банк "Бай –Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров, часть кредита потратит на приобретение телят. Доходы от кредита позволят Бусайре расширить ее бизнес и построить большие и просторные сараи для скота.
texts.en: Busaira is 50 years old, married and has children.  All of her family members actively help out with the farming.  Busaira has a high school education.  For the duration of the last 32 years, she has been raising livestock, a business that she started with a purchase of a single cow.  Thanks to Busaira's hard work, she has grown her business to currently include 4 milk cows, 30 sheep, and 4 horses.  Her enterprise brings approximately 10,000 som (KGS) every month.  She has all of the necessities for keeping and raising livestock on her farm.  In order to grow her business, Busaira turned to the bank of Bai Tushum for a loan of 135,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional cows and calves.  Profits from her business, Busaira is planning to use for the building of additional barns to house her animals.

loans.use: To buy cows and calves

loans.name: Bardhok

texts.en:
This is Bardhok who wants to buy an agricultural Frez machine with the loan that he is requesting from Kiva lenders. Since he owns approximately 13,000 square metros of land, he really felt that it was about time to invest on such a machine, to make things easier on himself.
 
Bardhok is a married father of three teen-aged daughters.  He had a son who sadly was killed and died during a political campaign. 

The activity of his focus has been agriculture for the past 24 years. He has 325 olive groves (he has been photographed there) and grapevines, and he also plants and sells dried beans and onions in large quantities and also plants and sells seasonal vegetables.  

He considers himself very busy with all this; agriculture is the only source of income for his family of five plus the two parents who reside with him as part of the rural tradition.

loans.use: to invest in an agricultural Frez machine

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia Inés continua dedicándose a la venta de comida, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de platos como arroz con pollo, saltado, sopas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder agradar su negocio y de esta manera poder continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, arros entre otros.
La socia está feliz con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Inés, continues selling food.  She has done this work for years and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.  She makes different dishes, such as chicken and rice, "saltado" [stir fry], soup, and other things for all her customers who order from her.

Inés wants to be able to expand her business so she can continue to support her family.  She's requesting the loan to buy oil, rice, and other products.

She's happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, and other products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator for the house

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a divorced woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as determined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and has many customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more cereals. 

Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will improve her business and her family's standard of living. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more cereal

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 45 años, trabaja como vigilante en el municipio del distrito donde vive, lo cual le permite poder tener ingresos para poder salir adelante y solventar los gastos de su hogar y poder sacar adelante a su hijo de 5 años.

Fernando esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá solventar los gastos para la realización de unos chequeo médico de su pequeño hijo, de esta manera podrá mejorar la salud de su pequeño y poder seguir trabajando para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y una mejor calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Fernando is 45 years old and works as a security guard in the city of the district where he lives. This allows him to have an income to get ahead, to pay his household expenses and to get his 5-year-old son ahead.

Fernando is grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have provided him he will be able to pay the expenses for his little son's medical checkups. In this way he will be able to improve his little one's health, keep working to improve his quality of life and keep striving to make his great dream a reality: "To give his son a good education and a better quality of life."

loans.use: to pay medical expenses

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is a 48-year-old married mother of one child.  She has been working as a tailor for nineteen years, and in addition sells house ware items.

Majida is a hard worker, who has been taking good care of her only child alone since her husband left her alone in Lebanon while he was seeking a better income and business abroad to cover his family's increasing needs.

Today, Majida is acquiring her third loan cycle from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her child's university tuition fees, and to invest part of the loan in buying necessary merchandise for her business. 

Education is very important to Majida and she invests everything she has to provide her child with the best education.

Her previous loans had a productive impact, and she is hoping to keep on developing her business as much as she can.

loans.use: to pay for her child's university tuition fees, and invest part of the loan in buying necessary merchandise for her business

loans.name: Banco Comunal Victoria De David Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal la Victoria de David está conformada por doce integrantes nueve mujeres y tres hombres, padres y madres responsables con veinte hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza  por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vieron  obligados  a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Micaela y tiene por actividad económica una  pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, fósforos, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  LA Victoria de David agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank, David's Victory, is now made up of 12 members, including nine women and three men, all of whom are responsible mothers and fathers with a combined twenty children under their care.  They are all originally from Sauce, a place located in the northern zone of the region.  They are characterized as being hardworking, responsible people with a desire to improve themselves.  Unfortunately due to a lack of economic resources, these group members were not able to study a career through school; they began working from a young age in order to help cover home expenses. 

Thanks to her effort to move herself ahead, the current group coordinator is Micaela.  She has a small corner store where she sells basic food items like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, matches, juice, and carbonated beverages.  She makes a living by working at her business for twelve hours each day.  

She hopes to invest in working capital to stock her business so that, in the not-too-distant future, she can earn higher profits.  

The Victoria de David group is grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders have offered to people who come from limited means and poor countries, like Nicaragua, so that they may have dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling food items, like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, matches, juice, and carbonated beverages.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a 26-year-old single woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hairdressing services. She also owns a grocery store where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a suitable location, and her primary customers are local residents. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy beauty products and stock vegetables for her grocery store. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and stock vegetables for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock more clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock more clothes

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself as determined. 

He operates a retail business where he sells cooking fat, rice, sugar, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good area and has many customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be finances. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more cooking oil, rice, sugar, and other items. His business goal is to own a large retail shop within 5 years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will own a wholesale shop. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, rice, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is 46 years old, widowed, and has two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Silvia is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Silvia has been pig fattening for 10 years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Meet Caroline, a well-established farmer living in the very rich and productive highlands of Litein. She has six children, all grown up now, and has been a farmer for over 20 years, her primary source of income being milk, eggs, and both cash and horticultural crops. Her greatest challenge in farming is insufficient dairy feed.

She chose this loan because she wanted to purchase milking cans for storing milk after milking her cows, before taking it to the milk factory. She will be in a position to have more milk for selling in the local market and hence increase her income level, which will help her cater for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase milk cans

loans.name: Anjelina

texts.en:
Anjelina has owned a food stall business, where neighbors and town dwellers come. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the KES 80,000 she wants to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat for the business. She dreams of expanding the business to a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Luan

texts.en:
Luan wants to start a livestock business by buying two dairy cows and he needs your compassion and financial help to achieve this.  He lives very modestly as shown by the photograph taken in front of his home. Luan, whose name in English is “Leon,” is fifty years old and is the father of two teenaged children.  So far, Luan has been planting and selling beans, potatoes and wheat.  He is a veterinarian by profession and practices his skills in villages around the area. 
The village where Luan and his family live has a very cold climate during winter and is cool in the summertime.  There is plenty of agricultural land for planting that is owned by locals.  They plant mainly wheat, corn, chickpeas, potatoes, beans, animal fodder and also seasonal veggies. As for animals, they have cows and sheep and many villagers also have apple and plum orchards. Traditional food in this part of Albania is beans with dried pork and pie with cooked beans called ‘Petanik’.

loans.use: to start a livestock business by buying two dairy cows.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique de 35 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que eran muchos hermanos y su padre no alcanzaba para enviarlos  a estudiar, tenía que trabajar. Ahora esta acompañado y tiene un hijo, el cual lo cuida su suegra, él vive solo con su compañera de vida. 

Enrique se dedica a la agricultura, todo el tiempo han sembrado sandia y maíz. Aprendió cuando era muy joven y trabajaba junto a su padre, también tiene una peluquería, su esposa es ama de casa. Él necesita el dinero para comprar abono y venenos para trabajar en la sandillera, porque dice que es el único cultivo que da resultados en menos tiempo y las posibilidades de perder son menores. Tiene la esperanza de que en un futuro algún  va a tener mejores resultados y construirá una casa propia.
texts.en:
Enrique, 35, didn't have the opportunity to attend school because he had a lot of siblings and his father didn't have enough money.  Enrique had to work.  Now he's in a relationship and has a child, who is cared for by Enrique's mother-in-law.  He lives alone with his companion.

Enrique makes a living in agriculture.  He always has grown watermelon and corn.  He learned when he was young and he used to work with his father.  He also has a hair salon.  His wife is a homemaker.

He needs the money to buy soil amendments and poison to work with the watermelons.  He says it's the only crop that gives results in less time, and there are fewer possibilities for loss.

For the future he hopes to have better results and to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and poison to work with his watermelons

loans.name: Basanti

texts.en:
Basanti is a 50-year-old woman from the rural village of Khagrabari in Jalpaiguri district.  She studied up to grade seven.  Her ignorance, poverty and lack of knowledge have not allowed her to study further.  Now she is married, a housewife and a mother of three children (one son and two daughters). One of her children is in the university, one is in college and the third one is the principal of a college.

Basanti's husband Khagendranath, 55 years old, is a farmer by profession.  He is illiterate and can only sign his name. He can't do hard labour in his agribusiness because he is physically unfit.  So, the income from the business is so scanty that it is hardly possible to run a five-member family.

Basanti has taken a loan to purchase a cow so that she can sell milk and milk products in the market. She wants to sell milk and produce milk products, such as curd, butter and paneer (cottage cheese) to her neighbors. She dreams that their future will not be affected by poverty. Instead, she dreams that this business will provide good revenue to her family to give them a decent lifestyle.  This loan will give them an opportunity to make their dreams come true.

Her aspiration is to provide a good education to her children so that they can be established in life in the future.

Basanti thanks BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to sell milk and milk products.

loans.name: Jairus

texts.en:
Jairus is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself as committed. 

He operates a butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good area and has many customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be finances. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of meat. His business goal is to have a big butcher shop within 5 years. 

He hopes that in the future, he can expand his business. He will use the anticipated profits buy more meat.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a 31-year-old woman with three children. She describes herself as motivated. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair dressing services. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be finances.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more beauty products to use in the salon. Her business goal is to own a large salon within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to add more inventory.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for use in the salon.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman and she has 3 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes, and she has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a business-friendly area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. Her business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 47 years old and single. She works hard to help her nephews.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending. Gemma is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pig fattening business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Chumki

texts.en:
Chumki is a very young, hardworking  woman of only 21 years. She lives with her husband Goutam and two children (one son and one daughter) in Maynaguri in the Jalpaiguri district.  She is a housewife and her husband is a farmer by profession. Both studied up to grade eight and could not continue further due to the poor financial resources of their family. Their son reads in grade one and their daughter is too young to go to school.

Chumki's husband is involved in agricultural activities.  In particular, he has a plot of agricultural land where he grows potatoes, beans and eggplant.  He is a very hardworking man who does his best to have a good harvest. He sells his agricultural products to the local markets. He is a very polite and well-behaved person. 

Now Chumki decided to start a milk supply business to give financial support to her husband. That's why she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase a cow.  Her main customers are her neighbors.  This will increase the family income and Chumki hopes to be able to improve their living conditions.

She aspires to provide her children with a better education in better schools.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to start a milk supply business.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is 36 years old, married, and has six children in school.  Alfreda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell.

Alfreda has been in this business for 9 years. 

In the future, Alfreda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is married and has four children, three of whom are in school and one is underage. She lives in her own house, but it has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanarusi has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to get financial supports.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Fancy

texts.en: Fancy chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because its loans have a low interest rate. This loan will help her expand her poultry farm by enabling her to buy more poultry, which means there will be more egg production and selling of poultry meat.  This will enhance her business by bringing in more profits.  She says that this will help her venture into more agricultural products and thus increase her income. Her family’s living standards will definitely improve.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 40 years old and is married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like chips, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Carmela has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like chips, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Margarita Amparo

texts.es:
La Sra. Margarita  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a sus hijos en una comunidad en la zona  de Honduras. Su negocio es la  elaboración y venta  de pan, el cual es muy conocido en su comunidad.
Doña Margarita necesita el préstamo para la compra de materia  prima como harina, leche, huevos, levadura, azúcar y manteca. Los cuales  necesita para seguir elaborando su  producto. Ella espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los productos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento considerable el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia en el hogar con el aumento de los ingresos.
Doña Margarita espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia y  que  sus hijos continúe con los estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.

Choluteca, Honduras –Abril  del  2014
texts.en:
Margarita is a very hardworking and responsible person. She lives with her children in a community in Honduras. Her business is making and selling bread, and it is very well known in her community. 

Margarita needs the loan to buy raw material like flour, milk, eggs, yeast, sugar and butter, items she needs to keep making her product. She hopes that thanks to the loan she will be able to have the products necessary to keep working at her business, thus meeting her customers' demands. She likewise hopes that sales increase considerably and that that is reflected in her family's quality of life at home with the increase in income. 

Margarita hopes that her business will keep growing and become the most well-known business in the community so that she will be able to keep supporting her family and so her children will be able to continue their studies and have greater opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras –April 2014

loans.use: to buy raw material like flour, milk, eggs, yeast, sugar and butter to make her bread

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a 32-year-old married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as honest and focused. She operates a farm where she keeps poultry. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy and productive place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough feed. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy poultry feed and more poultry. Her business goal is to be the largest supplier within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and more poultry

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
