As a married parent of evelen children, Evangeline works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from furniture making.  Evangeline is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more merchandise to sell in her buy and sell nipa roofing business.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Phonephas

texts.en:
Phonephas is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself as competitive. 

He operates a retail business where he sells utensils, tooth paste, cooking oil, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a reliable location. He describes his biggest business challenge to be seasonal changes. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more utensils, cooking oil, and other items. His business goal is to own a bigger shop within 5 years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more utensils, cooking oil, and other items

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma operates a palm wine selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. 

She appreciates the support of the previous loan.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase more palm wine for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase palm wine for resale

loans.name: Dhritibala

texts.en:
Dhritibala, 48 years old, is an energetic housewife from the village of Tekatuli in the district of Jalpaiguri. She and her husband Nirmal are uneducated and can sign only their names. They have no children.  They live in their own kachha house (a house made of straw, mud and bamboo).

Dhritibala's husband supports his family economically with his work in agriculture. He has a lot of experience in agriculture, which he learned from his parents.  Dhritibala works hard to help her husband by sowing, plowing and harvesting.  They grow different vegetables in different seasons.  They carry the produce to the local market.  Their income from the business is very inconsistent.  Dhritibala is a determined and enterprising woman who never stops dreaming of prospering in her life. So, she has decided to grow jute on their farmland. Jute is a very profitable crop.

Dhritibala is seeking help from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase fertilizers, seeds and insecticides for cultivating jute, as these items are very expensive these days. Her dreams for the future are to have an abundant jute plantation that brings enough profit to give her family a healthy life and to go ahead with her business.

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to cultivate jute.

loans.name: Shams* Group

texts.en:
This group is called Shams*. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Shams is the leader of the group. She is a 44-year-old single woman who lives with her family in their own house. She is an uneducated woman. Shams has an old house and most of the apartments inside need a renovation. Three apartments are rented. Because they are old, the renting of them is very low. Shams doesn't have enough money to renovate all of the apartments in order to make good profits. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. It will be used to purchase construction materials to renovate the house, such as bricks and cement.

Shams hopes to renovate all apartments of the house and rent them in order to provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as bricks and cement.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia Maruja continua dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, leche, azucar, golosinas entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz y leche.
La socia está contenta con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maruja continues making a living from a grocery store business. She has had this business for years and it brings her financial as well as personal satisfaction. She sells different kinds of products like rice, milk, sugar, and candy, among other items. Maruja is a responsible and dedicated person. She wants to be able to keep working in order to keep supporting her family. 

Maruja is asking for the loan to buy rice and milk. She is happy with the loan granted and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice and milk

loans.name: Philes

texts.en:
Philes is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells cooking fat, rice, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and she has many customers.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be finances. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more cooking fat, rice, and other items. Her business goal is to own a large shop within 5 years. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more cooking fat, rice, and other items

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married woman with five children. She describes herself as future-oriented. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food for sale. Her business is located in a semi-urban area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge as having a low stock of ingredients.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more ingredients to prepare food. Her business goal is to own a big hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future she will educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 39 years old, married, and has four children who are in school.  Geraldine works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more products to sell like feed, canned goods, shampoo, etc.

Geraldine has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Geraldine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell like feed, canned goods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 40 years old, married, and has five children, one of whom is in school.  Ligaya works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Ligaya has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Ligaya would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is married and has three children who attend school.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Esha has operated a cafe business making items like, rice, tea, beans, chapati( flat bread) and selling them to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality  as a major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, cooking oil, wheat flour, rice, and charcoal for the business. 

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, cooking oil, wheat flour, rice, and charcoal for the business

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma works hard to support her family. Welma is married and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines.

Welma requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Welma has been in this business for 9 years now.

In the future, Welma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam has operated a food stall business. She appreciates the support of the previous loan.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married woman and has three children, all of whom attend school.  She lives at a rented house that has electricity, but not piped water.

She has operated a photo shop and video business for the past four years, taking photographs at the functions in her neighborhood.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a bigger screen for her video business.  

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger screen for her video business

loans.name: Mwanashaban

texts.en:
Mwanashaban is a very hardworking woman who lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  She is married and has three school going children. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanashaban operates a cafe business where she makes various foods like: beans, rice, tea, chapati( flat bread) and sells them to passersby and neighbours. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase food items such as: tea leaves, peas, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. 

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as:, tea leaves,  peas, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.  Besides the food stall business, Mwanamisi operates a fruits and vegetable stall business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale.

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married and has three school-going children. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a green grocery business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high competition from other green grocery businesses. With this loan, she wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg (A) Group

texts.en:
These 10 women from a small village in Nayagarh district, Odisha came together and formed Maa Santoshi Self Help Group in 2013. Kasturi was selected as the leader of Maa Santoshi SHG. The lady standing with her raised hand is Kasturi. She is 50 years old and lives with her husband and her two children. She has been involved in vegetable cultivation for 20 years and her husband has been involved in paddy cultivation for 25 years. As a farmer, her husband has knowledge of vegetable cultivation and he is helping her in this activity. What they earn is not sufficient to manage their family. She has requested a loan to purchase hybrid seed, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor charges. The family income will increase and they will be inspired to do more. She says that the income will help to build a house for her family.

The other members of this group are involved in different activities like selling milk, selling vegetables, daily laborer etc. All are happy with this loan and thankful to Kiva for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed, fertilizers and pesticides for vegetable cultivation

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and has four school going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over five years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the loans, she wants to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions

loans.name: Maa Gramadebati Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2003, a group of eight women came together from a small village in Odisha and formed Maa Gramadebati Shg. Pali was selected as the leader of Maa Gramadebati Shg.  The lady standing with her hand raised is Pali. She is 40 years old, married, and living with her husband, one daughter and one son. She has been involved in a milk business for two years. She has one cow and she wants to purchase one more cow because the demand for milk is high and she is not able to supply the growing demand of the customers in the market. She has applied for a loan to purchase a cow and fodder and wants to repair her cattle shed. This business will help her to support her children's education. She says that this loan can help to increase her income, which will help her to purchase the study materials for her children's education and to pay her children's tuition fee.

All the members of this group are happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this help and support

loans.use: to purchase a cow and fodder for her milk business.

loans.name: Ma. Zaida

texts.en:
Ma. Zaida is 49 years old, married, and has six children, one of whom is in school.  Ma. Zaida works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Ma. Zaida has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Ma. Zaida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.  Besides the tailoring business, Saumu operates a food cafe.

She is asking for a loan to purchase wheat flour, milk, eggs, cooking oil, charcoal, and maize flour for her business. 

She is grateful for the support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, milk, eggs, cooking oil, charcoal, and maize flour for her business

loans.name: Hamit

texts.en:
Hamit is very grateful that he was finally able to build a house and not only a one-room house, as he had planned, but a three room home instead. "I wouldn't have done it without the help from these wonderful people who without even knowing me were so very kind. We finally live in a house, and we can't believe it. I had turned 70 years old and lived in that shack for as long as I can remember, so did my children and grandchildren," said Hamit beaming.
 
Now he is back, requesting a loan for his pig farming activity. He wants to buy food for the piglets shown in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy food for the piglets

loans.name: Mahamayee Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2014, eleven women came together and formed the Mahamayee Self Help Group to save money and help those who are facing problems in the group. Laxmi is the group member selected as the leader of Mahamayee Self Help Group. The lady standing with her hand raised is Laxmi. She is married and has no children. She is 37 years old and stays with her husband. Laxmi has applied for a loan for paddy cultivation. She is very talented and has been operating her business for the past 13 years. With the loan investment, she will buy fertilizers, pesticides and hybrid seed, and pay the labor charges that will allow her to do her work more efficiently. Her husband is helping her with the paddy cultivation. Laxmi started her business 13 years ago because it was difficult for her husband to manage the household expenses in addition to paying for medical treatment, as he was suffering from a disease at that time. 

Laxmi is confident that, after investing this money, she will be able to produce more paddy so that she can make more profit this time. She is very happy with this loan and wants to say "Thank You" to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and hybrid seed, and pay labor charges.

loans.name: Jaa Maa Mangala Shg Group

texts.en:
Golapa is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Golapa was born in the Nayagarh district of Odisha, India 44 years ago. The lady standing with her hand raised is Golapa. She is married and the couple has two children who are attending school. For seven years now, Golapa has been selling rice, cooking oil, lentils, spices, onions, and packaged food items like biscuits, cake etc. in her grocery shop. Golapa, along with her group members, has applied for a loan of 250,000 INR. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Golapa will use her share of the loan to expand her business. She will buy biscuits, chocolate, lentils, rice, wafers, detergent, salt, pepper, shampoo, toothbrushes, tooth paste, etc. at wholesale to add to her current stock.

The other nine members of this group are involved in different activities like animal raising, vegetable selling, milk selling etc. and all are happy with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is a 46-year-old married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be finances. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is a married man with 3 children. He describes himself to be motivated and operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture for sale, and also sells timber.  He has been involved in this business for 5 years.  His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are individuals. 
Jared describes his biggest business challenge to be financial challenges and a lack of timber.  He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more timber stock.  His business goal is to own a large timber yard within 5 years.  This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more timber stock.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a tailoring shop where he makes dresses. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be finances. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. His business goal is to have better and improved machines within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to add more tailoring materials.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife works hard to support her family. Marife is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.

Marife has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Marife would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a new loan to purchase more stock of cosmetics for her business. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new oven for the house

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 24 years old and married with two children.  With her children in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Mary Ann has been in this business for two years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 38 years old and has ten children. She is married and four of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosita has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hyline

texts.en: Hyline is a 33-year-old married woman and she has four children. She describes herself to be God-fearing, patient and humble. Hyline operates a retail business where she sells vegetables, and she has been involved in this business for two years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM, and she will use the 15,000 KES loan to buy a dairy cow for milk production. She hopes that she will educate her children and send them to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en: Charito is 49 years old and married with eight children, three of whom are in school. Charito works very hard to provide for them, and she runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Charito has been in this business for three years, and in the future, Charito would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 44 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Teresa has a business selling ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines. She requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more clothes to sell. Teresa has been in this business for one year and in the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has 4 children who attend school.  She owns a house that neither has piped water nor electricity.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over four years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women.  She cites seasonality as her major challenge and dreams of establishing a boutique in the near future.

With the 50,000 KES loan Mary wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Zahara

texts.en:
Zahara is a married woman with four school-going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Zahara operates a food business, making things like beans and chapati (flat bread) to sell to passersby and neighbours. With the loan, she wants to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 48-year-old single woman. She has one child. Catherine describes herself to be honest and ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a business-friendly area. 

Catherine describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Catherine hopes that in the future, she will buy her own residence. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.  She is requesting another loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale.  She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Marietta has been in this business for three years now.

Marietta requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell such as canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, etc. In the future, Marietta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell such as canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, etc

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 23-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be committed to her work. Rose operates a grocery store where she sells fruits and vegetables and has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with lots of customers. 

Rose describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to be able to yield high returns within 5 years. Rose hopes that in the future, she will open a hotel. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a 50-year-old married mother of four, with the youngest aged 14 years old. Throughout the years, Marie has preferred practicing livestock above all else as a means for living. Currently, she’s got one dairy cow, three pigs and one saw. She sells raw milk and piglets as well. “I have been suffering from some heart condition, but that hadn’t prevent me from doing what I do,” said Marie to the Branch Assistant who interviewed her. 

Marie wants to buy 300 hens and food for the hens. The amount she is requesting from Kiva lenders is 100,000 Albanian Lek. 

A bit about her village: it is known for a variety of traditional meals including the pies with nettles and also with pumpkin, tripe baked in the oven, grilled mushrooms, pickled olives seasoned with leeks etc. Also, in her village is the famous Albanian restaurant, “Mrizi i Zanave," which was built on a farm by three brothers who did culinary studies in Italy. This restaurant is frequented by all Albanians and foreigners, mostly from the neighbor countries who come to Albania only to taste the food in this restaurant.

loans.use: to buy 300 hens and food for the hens

loans.name: Marinil

texts.en:
Marinil is 31 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Marinil works very hard to provide for them.

Marinil runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Marinil would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Kabako Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    KABAKO est constitué de  7 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le village  de  DIOUTIEBOUGOU. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3ème prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de SIRA qui est la femme assise devant dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 100 kg de sel, 50 kg de poudre de gombo et 1 sac de choux avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 21.500FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Kabako group consists of seven married women who on average are 34 years old with four children. They live in nuclear families in the village of Dioutiebougou.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity to improve their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their third loan. The two previous loans have been repaid.

This group of women trades condiments like Sira, the woman sitting in front in the picture. She intends to use the loan to buy 100 kilos of salt, 50 kilos of okra powder and one bag of cabbages from wholesalers in Bougouni. She conducts her retail sales in the market and at home, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele.

She expects to attain average monthly profits of 21,500 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 39-year-old single woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be ambitious and honest. Caroline operates a grocery store where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with lots of customers. 

Caroline describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to expand and open another branch within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to pay school fees for her children. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 54 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ana's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ana is taking out a bridge loan and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business. She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Ana is committed to rebuilding, and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is widowed with three children. She buys, packages, and sells hardwood charcoal. At first she used to buy the charcoal already packaged, but now she has expanded her storage area. 

Dama needs this loan to buy charcoal because she is increasing her number of customers, and needs to increase her amount of charcoal to meet their demands. Her greatest desire is to provide an education for her children who attend school so that she can guarantee them a prosperous future

loans.use: to buy charcoal because she is increasing her number of customers

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a widowed woman with two children who are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, Martha has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, Martha wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil and pay school fees for her children. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking  oil and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal operates a poultry selling business. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses, as a challenge in the business. Racheal dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the KES 20,000, Racheal wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    KANOU est constitué de  6 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2ème prêt. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  friperie à l’image de BERETE qui est la 3ème femme debout  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, une balle de friperie  avec les grossistes  de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Kanou group consists of six married women who on average are 29 years old with three children. They live in nuclear families in the Heremakono Nord district of Bougouni.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity to improve their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their second loan. The previous loan has been repaid in full.

This group of women trades used clothing like Berete, the third woman standing from left to right in the picture. She intends to use her loan to buy one bale of used clothes from wholesalers in Bamako. She conducts her retail sales in the market and at home, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele.

She expects to attain average monthly profits of 22,500 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy used clothing

loans.name: Diako Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    DIAKO est constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO CENTRE de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2ème prêt. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait de la restauration à l’image de SALI qui est la 1ère femme assise  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 200 kg de riz, 20 kg de viande, 10 kg de poissons et une grande quantité de condiments avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Diako group consists of five married women who on average are 38 years old with four children. They live in nuclear families in the Heremakono Centre district of Bougouni.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity to improve their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their second loan. The previous loan has been repaid in full.

This group of women prepares food like Sali, the first woman sitting from right to left in the picture. She intends to use her loan to buy 200 kilos of rice, 20 kilos of meat, 10 kilos of fish, and a large quantity of condiments from wholesalers in Bougouni. She conducts her retail sales in the market and through home delivery, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele.

She expects to attain average monthly profits of 40,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy ingredients for food preparations

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    BENKADI est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  DIALANIKORO de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4ème prêt. Les 3 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  gâteaux à l’image de HABI qui est la femme assise devant dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 90 kg de farine, 30 kg de sucre et 25 litres d’huile  avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 19.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group consists of four married women who on average are 30 years old with two children. They live in traditional extended families in the Dialanikoro district of Bougouni.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity to improve their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their fourth loan. All three previous loans have been correctly repaid.

This group of women sells cakes like Habi, the woman sitting in front in the picture. She intends to use her loan to buy 90 kilos of flour, 30 kilos of sugar and 25 liters of oil from wholesalers in Bougouni. She conducts her retail sales in the market and from her home, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele.

She expects to attain average monthly profits of 19,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy ingredients to prepare cakes

loans.name: Sikidia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    SIKIDIA est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 7ème prêt. Les 6 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de FATOUMATA qui est la 1ère femme assise  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 100 kg de sel, 3 cartons de tomates concentrées et 100 kg d’oignons secs avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Sikidia group consists of four married women who on average are 35 years old with five children. They live in traditional extended families in the Massablacoura district of Bougouni.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity to improve their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their seventh loan. All six previous loans have been repaid in full.

This group of women trades condiments like Fatoumata, who is the first woman sitting from left to right in the picture. She intends to use her loan to buy 100 kilos of salt, three cartons of tomato concentrate and 100 kilos of dried onions from wholesalers in Bougouni. She conducts her retail sales in the market and at home, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele.

She expects to attain average monthly profits of 20,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Mario Del Transito

texts.es:
Mario de 30 años de edad,  solo estudio 4º grado, esta casado y tiene una niña de 2 años. Él se dedica a la agricultura, su esposa a los oficios domésticos. Desde que era muy joven aprendió a trabajar la agricultura, mientras trabajaba para otras personas. 

Después de casado cuando vio que era bastante rentable lo de la sandia y con la experiencia obtenida para trabajar el cultivo de la sandia decidió ponerlo en práctica, tiene que caminar 3 km para llegar a su trabajo. 

El cliente necesita el dinero para comprar abonos y venenos para el cultivo de sandía. Él dice que el crédito le ayudara a suplir la necesidad que esta teniendo en el momento y espera se le ayude con el préstamo. Al cliente le gustaría que su hija trabajara en Administración de Empresas, aunque dice respetar la decisión de ella.
texts.en:
Mario, 30, has a fourth grade education, is married and has a two-year-old daughter.  He works in agriculture and his wife is a homemaker.  He learned about agriculture when he was young working for other people.

After he married, when he saw that growing watermelon was profitable and he had experience working with this crop, he decided to put it into practice.  He walks three kilometers to work.

The borrower is in need of money to buy compost and weed killer for his watermelon crop.  He says this loan will help him cover the needs he has now so he hopes he will receive it.  He would like for his daughter to study business administration, although he says he will respect her decision.

loans.use: To buy compost and weed killer for his watermelon crop.

loans.name: José Fredis

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad, es una persona muy conocida en la comunidad, por ser una persona honesta y trabajadora. Estudió apenas 7º grado, esta acompañado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. Con ellos solo viven dos hijos, ya que la niña mayor se la cuida su mamá y uno estudia. El cliente toda la vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, antes solo sembraba maíz y al ver que sus vecinos sembraban sandia, decidió experimentar y le fue bien. 

Hace unos 6 años que comenzó junto a sus hermanos y después decidió hacerlo por si solo.  Él necesita el dinero para comprar abono y semilla para preparar la tierra. Al cliente le gustaría que sus hijos estudiaran para doctor, ya que en algún momento ha dependido de alguno de ellos y quisiera que sus hijos recompensaran el tratamiento que recibió y que también salven vidas.
texts.en:
Jose, 28, is very well-known in his community for being an honest, hard-working person.  He has a seventh grade education, is married and his wife is a homemaker.  Only two of their children live at home because the eldest daughter is being taken care of by his mother and another son studies.  This borrower has worked in agriculture all his life.  He used to plant only corn but noticed that his neighbors were growing watermelon so he decided to experiment and it went well for him.

About six years ago he and his siblings worked togeter but he decided to become independent.  He needs money to buy compost and seeds to prepare the land.  He wants his children to study to be doctors because at one time or another they have been dependent on them and he wants his children to compensate for the treatment received and also to save lives.

loans.use: To buy compost and seeds to prepare his land.

loans.name: Madres Laboriosas Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Madres Laboriosas” conformada por 10 socios responsables, ya que no han tenido problema con sus pagos. Mirtha de 59 años es separada con 03 hijos independientes. Mirtha se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza.  Ella se siente feliz pues gracias a su esfuerzo sigue mejorando cada día. El crédito que solicitó lo destinó para la compra de perfumes, cremas y talcos. El deseo de Mirtha es de apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios. La Alcancía Comunal “Madres Laboriosas” agradece el apoyo brindado. Mirtha es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste polo blanco. En la parte superior a lado izquierdo se encuentra Miguel la cual no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
This is the “Madres Laboriosas” group, made up of 10 responsible members who have not had any problems making their payments. Mirtha is 59 years old, separated, and has 3 children.  Mirtha sells beauty products. She feels happy, because thanks to her efforts, she continues improving every day. The loan she requested was used to buy creams, perfumes and powders.  

Mirtha´s desire is to support her children in their education. The communal bank, “Madres Laboriosas” is grateful for the support they have been given. Mirtha is third from the left in a white top.  In the top left-hand corner is a photo of Miguel who was unable to arrive on time because of work.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams and powders.

loans.name: Tembo Grp Group

texts.en:
Peter is a single man in Tanzania who is in his early thirties. He is blessed with a baby boy. He has been managing a business of small dry fish known as dagaa. He opens his business from 7am to 6pm each working day and is able to make a small month profit. 

This is his second loan which he will use to buy small dry fishes (dagaa) to resell. Peter used the previous loan to restock his business. He managed to repay back the loan. Peter earned a profit which he used to pay for his welfare. He dreams of selling his fishes to other countries. 

Peter will share this loan with his loan group"TEMBO GRP" which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy small dry fish (dagaa) to resell.

loans.name: Gs Doña Julia 3 Group

texts.es:
La Sra. María  es una persona  muy  emprendedora vive con  su esposo y sus   hijos en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  mini  pulpería desde hace más de 3 años. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, refrescos, carne, queso, mantequilla, manteca, y otros productos Con el crédito  ella espera  el aumento de sus ventas debido a que contara con más dinero fresco y  que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan,  a diario y así cubrir sus necesidades, así mismo espera que mejore su situación económica y que se vea reflejado con esta inversión. En unos años ella sueña con que su negocio  este posicionado como un mini súper conocido de la zona, y poder seguir apoyando a  su familia  a que se convierta en personas de bien  para la sociedad.
Luz  Idalia su negocio es  la  mini pulpería  desde hace 6 años 
3.-Scaleth  Josselin su negocio es la  venta  de refrescos  y churros agua  desde hace 2 años.

Choluteca, Honduras – Abril   del 2014
texts.en:
Maria is a very enterprising woman who lives with her husband and children in a community in southern Honduras.  She has been running a mini-market for over three years.  She needs a loan to buy corn, beans, rice, soft drinks, meat, cheese, butter, shortening and other products.  She hopes to increase sales by having more cash on hand to offer more products to her customers who visit daily.

She hopes to improve her economic situation through this investment.  One of her dreams is for the her business to be a well-known mini-supermarket in the area so she can continue supporting her family so they can become good citizens.

Luz Idalia has been running a mini-market for six years.
Scaleth Josselin sells soft drinks, pastries and water and has been in business for two years.


Choluteca, Honduras - April, 2014

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, rice, soft drinks, meat, cheese, butter, shortening and other products for her business.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La socia Olga pertenece al banco comunal LLAPANCHIS TTICARISUNCHIS, la socia tiene 37 años de edad es casada y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio e cual le va trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus clientes que le solictan,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de casacas para su negocio.
La socia está contenta con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Olga belongs to the LLAPANCHIS TTICARISUNCHIS communal bank.  She is 37 years old, married and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with selling clothing.  She has been in this business for quite some time and it has brought her many economic and personal satisfactions.

She sells on a door-to-door basis and to customers who place orders.  She wants to continue working to support her family.  The loan she is requesting is to buy jackets for her business.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy jackets for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts for her photocopier machine. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her photocopier machine

loans.name: Cooproriz Ngiryi Agasenyi 3 Gp1 Group

texts.en:
Evariste is 29 years old. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production. They need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. Evariste is the group leader of the group. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia operates a clothes selling business. She sells at the market to town dwellers and her neighbors. She cites her major challenge to be seasonality. Lydia dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is a single woman. She has four children. She describes herself as industrious. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows, which produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are farmers. She describes her biggest business challenges to be drought and diseases. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy animal feed. Her business goal is to be a supplier of milk within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
The desire to have a prosperous life is one of Rose's dreams. She always struggles to achieve success. She is a very dedicated woman who has been operating a vegetable stall, a business that is active to date.

Rose is grateful for the support from the last loan. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Mirembe

texts.en: Miriam lives in Kampala. She is married with six children and four of her children go to school.  She has additional family members (one of her brother's daughters). She sells green bananas. She operates her business on both a retail and wholesale basis from home. She has been in business for the last five years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,700,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more bunches of green bananas. Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to become a wholesaler and also to buy build rental houses. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman. She has nine children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk and also grows crops. Her business is located in a busy and productive place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy a dairy cow. Her business goal is to have a large farm within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Alexander Eduardo

texts.es:
Alexander es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabaja como empleado en un grifo de su ciudad, lo cual le permite poder solventar los gastos de sus estudios, Alexander se encuentra estudiando la carrera de contabilidad en una universidad de su ciudad y ya esta en el ultimo ciclo, para el ha sido un poco difícil el poder trabajar y estudiar a la vez, pero sus ganas de ser mejor cada día pudieron más que las adversidades.

Alexander esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá solventar los gastos para poder realizar los tramites de su bachiller y titulo profesional, de esta manera podrá obtener un mejor empleo y sus oportunidades laborales serán mayores, y de esta manera podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Tener su negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Alexander is a young man who is very keen to get on in life. He works in his city as an employee in a gas station, which allows him to cover the cost of his studies.  Alexander is studying accounting at the university of his city and is already in his last cycle. It has been a little difficult for him to work and study at the same time, but his desire to be better each day is enough to overcome any adversity.

Alexander is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help that they have provided, he has been able to cover the costs to pay for his high school degree and the paperwork for his professional title. In this way, he can get a better job and his employment opportunities will be greater.  In addition, he can continue to fight for his ultimate dream: "to have his own business".

loans.use: to pay for his high school degree and professional title.

loans.name: Youssoupha

texts.fr:
Monsieur Youssoupha, 59 ans évolue dans le secteur de l’élevage depuis plus de 20 ans. Il a démarré depuis son jeune âge car c’est lui qui amenait les troupeaux de son père paitre. A la suite de son père il a continué l’activité et pour améliorer cela, il sollicite un crédit pour augmenter le nombre de son cheptel. Youssoupha est marié et père de famille. Il nourrit sa famille grâce aux revenus de son activité, et épargne pour pouvoir devenir un jour indépendant et ne plus faire recours aux crédits. 
Monsieur Youssoupha possède un espace cultural qu’il aimerait exploiter dans l’avenir en y faisant la culture de mil ou du maraichage.
texts.en:
Youssoupha is 59 years old and has been raising livestock for more than 20 years.  When he was young he used to take his father's herds out to find pasture to graze.  Later, following in his father's footsteps, he built up a herd of his own.  He has requested this loan in order to be able to increase the number of livestock that he owns.

Youssoupha is married and has children.  His commercial activity enables him to provide for his family, and save some money in the hope of one day becoming independent and no longer needing to take loans.

Youssoupha owns some growing land and he would like to use this in the future to grow millet and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Ndèye Khady

texts.fr:
Madame Ndèye Khady, une dame de 43 ans, s’active dans le commerce de produits halieutiques et de tomates fraiches. Elle fait ce commerce depuis maintenant 8 ans. Ndèye Khady est mariée, mère de 4 enfants dont l’ainé a 15 ans.
Elle vient renouveler son crédit, afin d’acheter des produits de mer et satisfaire la demande qui est en attente. Après la vente, elle encaisse un bénéfice qui lui permet de participer à la dépense quotidienne de la famille et d’augmenter son capital.
Ndèye Khady, souhaite diversifier ses activités et ouvrir une boutique de denrées alimentaires.
texts.en:
Ndèye Khady is a 43-year-old woman who has been selling fish and fresh tomatoes for eight years.  She is married and has four children, the eldest of whom is 15 years old.

Ndèye Khady has requested this loan in order to buy seafood to satisfy the demands of her customers.  After selling her products, she will use her profits to help provide for the day-to-day needs of her family, and to build up her working capital.

In the future, Ndèye Khady would like to diversify her business and open a shop selling food products.

loans.use: to buy fish products and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Omar

texts.fr:
Omar vient pour la première fois solliciter un crédit afin de pouvoir améliorer son activité qui consiste à élever des vaches pendant un temps dans le but de les revendre. Omar a démarré cette activité il y a longtemps, appartenant à l’ethnie peulh, il fait l’embouche en héritage de ses parents et ancêtres. Omar est âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de famille. Il vit de son activité lui et sa famille. Avec le prêt, il pourra acheter 2, voire 3 vaches pour les emboucher.
Omar part dans les marchés hebdomadaires aussi bien pour acheter les vaches, mais aussi après les avoir emboucher, il peut retourner les vendre dans ces mêmes marchés, car la clientèle est toujours là. S’il vend ses bœufs, il peut avoir un bénéfice de 35 pour cent et cela lui permet d’épargner les 10 pour cent et les 25 serviront à renforcer le capital. Omar aimerait un jour avoir un grand troupeau de bœufs.
texts.en: Omar is requesting a loan for the first time in order to improve his business which consists of raising cows for a while before reselling them. Omar started this business a long time ago. He belongs to the Fulani (Peulh) ethnic group and fattens livestock, just like his parents did and like their ancestors did before them. Omar is 45 years old, married and a father. He and his family survive off the proceeds of his business. He goes to the weekly markets to buy cows and, after fattening them, returns to the same markets to resell them, as that is where his customers are. He can make around 35% profit selling the cows, which enables him to save around 10% and to use the other 25% to strengthen his working capital. One day, Omar would like to own a big herd of cattle.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wheat flour and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groundnut paste for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a retail business where he sells livestock. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a viable location and he describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more livestock. His business goal is to have more livestock within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more livestock.

loans.use: buy more livestock

loans.name: Merceline

texts.en:
Merceline is a 30-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as industrious. She operates a retail business where she sells medicines. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in urban area and her primary customers are urban residents. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of medicines. Her business goal is to open more business outlets within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her third  loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: buy more stock of medicines.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia lives in Kampala. She is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn't support any additional family members. She sells second hand clothes. She operates her business on a retail basis in the market. She has been in business for the last 5 years. She works six days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings to buy a bale of second hand clothes. Her business challenge includes transportation and changing prices of clothes. Her goal and aspiration is to get a permanent stall from which to sell her clothes. She lives in a rented house; the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Samini

texts.en:
Samini is married and has three children all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For the past twelve years, she has operated a motorcycle business. She faces a major challenge of motorcycle breakdown and muddy roads during the rainy season. She dreams of buying a new motorcycle and developing herself.

With the loan, she wants to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle.
